description:
Love this place! They are kid and dog (on the outdoor patio) friendly, and super efficient even when they are jammed. Service is always friendly and prompt. And the food is great! I love the breakfasts (crepes, scrambles) and the hash browns are awesome. There's also a good variety of healthy options.

I just learned that kids under 12 eat free on Wednesdays (wow) so will be back soon.
author: Kristy F.

description:
Great space. This place tries to be amazing, but falls short in many ways. Lackluster service with decent food. It would be a great place for someone with experience to open a restaurant. From my vantage point, what's needed is good management and an effort to create some ambiance. There's absolutely no reason to stop there for drinks, although they offer a beautiful outdoor seating area that is heated on chilly San Francisco days, there's no music or personality to the space. And, the service staff seldom works to sell anything, but rather acts only as order-takers. You're likely to hear "Are you ready?' instead of 'Hi, I'm Troy. I'll be your server. We have a vegetable soup today and a special crepe. But before you decide on what you would like to eat, would you like me to bring you something to drink?"

Everything wrong about this place could easily be repaired by good governance and management. 

The French fries that accompany the tuna or salmon sandwiches are, despite everything else, super tasty and worth a try.
author: Scott A.

description:
Stop serving Corn beef Hash. Too bad, it was really good. 
Had guests from out of town. First place they wanted to go was Savor for corn beef hash. Told them not available under new owner. 
So took them to Lundy's Home style cooking, 1143 4th St, San Rafael, CA for "awesome"home made corn beef hash. Small old style dinner. Super friendly staff. New go to place for breakfast and brunch.
author: David H.

description: I appreciate any place that has a patio and allows you to bring your fur babies. Cozy back patio, creating a nice atmosphere. The service is pretty quick and I was very satisfied with my meal! Will come back.
author: Brittany R.

description: Great food. And wonderful service. The Provence Omelette, Wild Alaskan salmon with spinach, onions & goat cheese - is huge and delicious. It's available any time of day and evening. Everything I have had here has been great, no complaints at all. There are outdoor tables in the back with overhead heaters. Love it here, for breakfast, lunch or dinner.
author: barbara r.

description: Came here with a large party (15 people). They did a great job serving us in the intended time and we were outside on the patio. There is a large menu but definitely a bit pricey, so it's easy to run up an expensive bill here.
author: Drew F.

description:
Bring your dog. The back patio  is great for dogs.  And they do serve crepes still. I just ate the TJ Fajita. It was actually really good. At 9am on a Sunday theres no wait. They are open for breakfast only on weekends. 
This is a good go-to place.
author: Greg H.

description: Savor is amazing! My family and I celebrated my 21st birthday and my uncle's birthday at Savor's outside patio. We had brunch there and the service and food was so great!
author: Danielle A.

description: Seating inside or outside (covered) - I enjoy their crepes and their breakfasts. They can get pretty crowded but they're pretty quick, too. Food is always hot and Delicious.
author: Adi A.

description:
This place used a I have really good food but since the ownership change the food is no longer tasty. We used to get the Caramel banana frenchtoast, no longer. So we order an omelet and a sandwich. The omelette had a glob of shredded cheese on one spot that made it taste weird (and I love cheese). The Noe Valley sandwich had chicken breast that had an unusual chewy texture like it was uncooked.
This was a go-to spot but no longer.
author: Sharon S.

description: Enjoyed a casual dinner with my family. Great food, friendly service. Smaller crepe menu then we remembered, but there are still some to chhose from.
author: Marzi W.

description:
Parking: street/meter

Service: it's like Squat & Gobble - you order & pay, then sit.

Food: they have a wide range of options - from scrambles to benedicts to sandwiches - just like Crepevine and Squat & Gobble. the portion sizes were pretty large, depending what you ordered.

The pricing was a bit on the higher end or average, depending what you're used too, but given the neighborhood (Noe Valley), it's understandable
author: Cheri C.

description:
Savor has a good variety of salads, sandwiches and tasty breakfasts. I had a Buffalo Grilled Chicken salad and my partner enjoyed a Grilled Chicken sandwich with ample fries. Both dishes were very tasty and the quantities were huge and especially for big appetites. The back patio where we sat is bright and sunny with a canopy that can be retracted.

We live in the area and it's great to find another good restaurant in the neighborhood. We will definitely return!
author: Dean J.

description: I ordered the vegetarian crepe. It came with a side of salad and hash browns. The quantity was enough to feed two people. The presentation of the dish was pretty nice. I also like the outdoor patio, it's very relaxing. They have heaters on. The downside about the crêpe is that it's now $17.95. I like how fast my food came out however I can tell my Mushrooms were not fresh... they had a large amount of water coming out from my crepe....everything else was good.  I would suggest if the cook can use something to soak up the water before it's served that's ideal. Otherwise using all fresh ingredients would be definitely recommended. I come here each time I visit San Francisco. The dishes used to be about $15 however it skyrocketed way too high. It's an old gem I used to go here a lot but now we all got to move forward.
author: Tom W.

description:
I give this local establishment five starts because its a really great all-around neighborhood restaurant. It's my go-to spot for salad, crepes, pasta, breakfast and more. The staff is always sweet and accommodating. So is the owner and manager! Also they just updated the interior and it looks fresh and inviting. Also the patio is really lovely. 
Savor is Noe's mini Cheesecake Factory. Something for everyone and hard to go wrong!
author: emmanuelle a.

description: Savor hosted us as a group of 15 adults and kids to watch the World Cup final in the patio.  The owner and staff were very welcoming which made our time there excellent.  Everyone really made sure we were all having a good time.  The owner shared pictures and videos of our crowd cheering during the game, which was a nice attention.  Good food and Generous mimosas :) we'll be back.  Thanks for hosting our large group!
author: Kieran P.

description: Great food and service, a wonderful place for brunch or lunch. Patio in the back is dog friendly.
author: John E.

description: Just had lunch at this great Noe Valley eatery, yesterday.  The food is superb and the service is outstanding.  They serve wonderful crepes, terrific salads, and delicious breakfasts.  The outdoor patio is lovely and even dogs are invited onto the patio.  The owners are friendly and very welcoming.  I highly recommend this fine food restaurant.
author: John S.

description: This place has an AMAZING enclosed back patio. The patio is very DOG FRIENDLY and has heaters so you can bring your dog on cold days! The food was great at breakfast and the owner (Charlie) came out to meet my dog! They also brought her treats and a water bowl. This patio can be reserved for events and hosts a dog meetup occasionally. Definitely worth visiting and don't forget to bring your doggo along for the meal!
author: Ebi M.

description: Dog friendly brunch! Head down the sidewalk alley and enter the tent area. And there was no wait at 11am on a Saturday-- a rare treat in SF.
author: Adam D.

description:
I once loved Savor.  Over the last few years it has undergone format and ownership changes... each time getting worse.

I thought I give them another chance today.  I ordered a the New Orleans crab benedict.  The muffin was untoasted, the crab cake was soggy and burnt, the poached egg was nearly raw with runny whites.  The fruit wasn't ripe. 

Not once were we asked about our meal.

 The single worst breakfast experience in 30 years of living in San Francisco.  I'm done with Savor.
author: J C.

description: Always a favorite. Was a favorite of a dear friend of mine who recently passed. We indirectly met through Savor actually, as a mutual friend was a server there, a long time ago. We ate in Jim's memory. Always a nice selection. Service is always good. Can get pretty busy. I will always have pleasant memories of Savor. Thanks for being the awesome place you are.
author: David H.

description:
Savor is your standard crepe cafe along the lines of Crepevine or The Crepe House. They have a reasonably large breakfast menu full of scrambles, omelettes, benedicts and of course, crepes. We came here for brunch on a Sunday morning after walking by it every day for the last month. It was reasonably busy each time so we figured it couldn't be bad. The space is big with a really nice back patio. You place orders at the counter and then your food is brought out to you as it's ready.

I ordered the Baja scramble without cheese which came with a side of wheat toast and subbed fruit for the potatoes with a coffee to drink. My boyfriend ordered the Barcelona crepe which came with a side salad and a side of potatoes. Both were close to $15 with a side of fruit being an extra $1 and coffee $2.50. The food took about 10-15 minutes which was very reasonable. The coffee was brought to me pretty fast and the staff was very good on keeping my coffee refilled which I appreciated.

The food itself was okay. The portions were MASSIVE. My scramble was pretty greasy and I really felt like it needed the cheese to cut through the grease. The sub of fruit was a fair value for the $1 but compared to the portions you get on the potatoes, it seems a little skimpy. The Barcelona Crepe was pretty good so I probably would go with a crepe next time. The salad that came with it was adequate and the potatoes were okay, nothing special.

Overall, I would come back but I can't say it would be my first choice. The patio is beautiful and the menu is varied and reasonable. For a treat, I want to come back and try one of their dessert crepes which look heavenly.
author: Carrie W.

description: Just another restaurant with poor service and overpriced food that absolutely not worth the money. The only dish I liked was a mushroom soup that tasted delicious. Would give 2 stars if they didn't have the patio with heaters.
author: Regina D.

description: It's gone downhill with the new owners. No more gluten free crepes. The food is mediocre and the service is pretty bad. Didn't bring the drinks for quite a while. What a shame.
author: Cynthia G.

description: We use to LOVE this place, service use to be great, always friendly, Now this place is dead, service lazy and unfriendly, food was still good even with the new system but now not even the food, pancakes taste like nothing so plain, they were my favorite spot for weekends, i don't think i will come back.
author: Ivonne M.

description: Sadly new owners took over and took the delicious vegan tofu scramble off the menu. Please bring back the old menu and please your long time customers so the write better reviews.
author: Brian K.

description: Very nice dinner on the patio. Great crepes and hamburger with fries. Nice entrees available available if you want something more filling. Table service, dog friendly and great desserts. Sam, the owner goes out of his way to make sure that your dining experience is exceptional. Back to being one of our favorite places in Noe Valley.
author: Jane P.

description: It is SOOO good.  Kid friendly and great food!  We love to eat the chicken nuggets while my dad eats the yummy salads and sandwiches!  Enjoy your meal!
author: Brad R.

description: Love Love Love this gem in Noe Valley. The assistant manager is the absolute sweetest and most attentive server that I've ever had the pleasure of being seated in their space. I go out of my way to come here because of the service, great food quality and relaxed atmosphere. The diversity on the menu is great for people with different food wants and needs. Can't recommend it more highly for a casual lunch or brunch with friends or coworkers.
author: Jak K.

description:
Food is still good. Restaurant is clean. The "pay-at-the-counter" revamp makes the place unfriendly, and the service rather sloppy (or non-existent). One always feels like you're interrupting a vacation when you ask for a refill...or for them to get your order right.


Will still come, as I have for years. Just wish they could tighten things up a bit.

Oh...and the tea tasted "off" this last visit.
author: Peter O.

description:
Earlier this year, Savor eliminated waitstaff and implemented an awkward  touchscreen ordering system that always requires the poor person behind the counter to take over because it's difficult and eliminates the ability to do the kind of customizations (salad, not potatoes; loose eggs, please; rye toast, please; etc) a breakfast/lunch place requires. And the food quality--never even--has become mediocre. The whole feel became "we don't care." 

But now it has new owners and table service is back. The menu has changed to be about burgers and similar lunch fare, less about breakfast and brunch. On the weekends, brunch is still on. There are still some of the old egg and crepe menu items from before, and the decor is nicer. But the food remains mediocre, sometimes bad. Egg dishes seem the iffiest; today, a friend's crab cake Benedict came with the egg whites uncooked and the crab cake burned on one side. All our hash browns were very undercoooked and flavorless; I suspect they were microwaved. The crepes were OK, but just that. The scramble was also OK. The fruit cup was all unripe fruit. Flavor is lacking all around.

It's clear the new owners are trying to recover from years of neglect. It's also clear that the cooking remains weak. For a restaurant, that's unacceptable.

Fortunately, there are several other good places in the area like Novy to try instead.
author: Galen G.

description: Mediocre food and terrible service.  I tried to flag down the server and was ignored several times.  There's lot of other neighborhood choices here, don't waste your money here.
author: Jason B.

description: Bangkok salad was so good, just like I remembered it! We were a party of 14 with a few smallchildren. We were not rushed, food was perfect and everyone was happy!
author: Jane G.

description:
I used to love coming here but they changed their policy. Pay up front and add a top. Aren't tips based upon how great the service is? 

I came in after 2 pm it was quiet. Just a few customers. I ordered a chicken burger it came out after 45 minutes. The employee said someone one was arguing on the phone and our food will be delayed. Someone sat on the next table after 20 min and got their food the same time we got our food. 

Service sucks so does their pay upfront and tip policy. 

That's why I like to pay the tip after I get my food based on the service.
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description:
I used to love this place. They changed their serving policy and now the food takes an hour to come 

Our food cane after 40 min and it was dead cold. 

Bad service. 

I do not recommend this place anymore
author: Deepankar K.

description:
under new ownership..no crepes, lousy expensive sandwiches, salads..
was there  7/28/17. go elsewhere, it's not the wonderful savor before
new june 20i7 ownership.
author: Benefsha G.

description:
I returned to Savor after an absence and discovered that the ownership did away with the wait staff.  Bad move.  If I wanted to go to an order at the counter type coffee shop, I would have gone to Starbucks.   The food wasn't as good as it used to be and prices remain inflated even though it's serve yourself.

I guess we can see more places going this way.  San Francisco is an extremely expensive place to run a business.  Hopefully the progressive idiots on the board of "supervisors" will pay attention.  Their nonsense costs people their jobs!
author: Harris A.

description:
GREAT DINNER EXPERIENCE!

On a recent Wednesday night we decided on a date night and headed to Savor. We've heard a lot of good things from whom we spoke personally with friends that actually ate there.  Well, it was our turn and we weren't disappointed. 

We were greeted and seated in a more quiet section in front of the restaurant. Menus were delivered and there is a good variety of options.  I chose from the dinner special:  Hanger Steak that came with two sides of my choice, which I chose the Caesar Salad and Garlic Mashed Potatoes.  That with a glass of wine.  

The salad came first and was fresh and large, nicely tossed with fresh cheese garnish. Sometimes you take a chance at ordering steak but this was really good.  Cooked medium as I like, the meat was actually very tender and quite tasty and the sauce that complimented the meat was not overpowering.  The mashed potatoes are from fresh potatoes I think since the freshness and texture of the potatoes were evident. 

The other order is the Sonoma, a grilled chicken sandwich on a bun.  The chicken was tender and it was served with a side of fries . . . long big fries unlike McD's. 

Overall the experience was great:  good food, good service. Unhurried and relaxed.  For the dinner experience, it was very nice and a pleasure.
author: Stefan L.

description:
Well I'm guess I'm the first this year to do a review if you read my review be kind if you are going to send a compliment don't be Rude just don't bother!!!!! 

Now to the restaurant first time review with this new account.
It's little bit dark but I love the decor the paintings they done on the wall the new remodel outside were no birds to poop on your food or come flying in on your food.. lol

My cousin wanted to look at the menu outside he says let's look now so we know what to order. I said dude I can't stand that long let's go inside it's cold outside, so we went inside we waited to be seated waitress said sit where you like so we sat in the back where's little bit warm right away a waitress came over took our drink order  can you believe out of my Stella beer, which I really want it so I got Sierra Nevada it was a little bit too dark for me but I drink the whole thing. lol

5stars on the Food since they changed the menu but I got grilled chicken you could order any sides so got garlic mashed potatoes mixed vegetables cooked in garlic and a Caesar salad.
My cousin ordered the tri-tip mashed potatoes with cream corn he gave me a sample of the tri tip was extremely good melted in my mouth he got medium well which I like nothing bloody next time I go that's what I would order.. The cream of corn came in it's own little baking dish look like clam chowder he tasted it said it was extremely good.

I took 2 bites of my salad here comes our food people who know me I'm very picky I love my food hot I'm like oh I just took a bite of my salad waitress response was  we could put it under the heating lamp NO! it's okay you could leave my food just pack my salad plz  I'll take it home. You see the photo of the food I took 2 bites of the chicken ate all my veggies two bites of the mash I was full very good I also got a side with alfredo sauce with mushrooms which they forgot and they did bring them..

I love the atmosphere because it's quiet little dark the waitress will come and check up on you I like that. 

 The only thing I give is a 4 star is just listen to what your customers ask you when they told you twice what they want and what they don't want, and come back to make sure they finish their salad or soup before you bring the meal that way the food will get cold or you'll have to end up taking the soup or the salad home.

Other than that I had a great time great service great food great company I would definitely come back. 
My Cousin enjoy the food he will be bringing his boyfriend here they serve breakfast at night because I saw someone who ordered eggs benedict that looks hella yummy... :)

So if you in San Francisco in your in noe Valley area come check out this restaurant you would surely enjoy the food they have lamb chicken fish. we didn't get dessert so I don't really remember and of course they have alcohol, and if you're not in the mood to eat dinner you could always order lunch items or breakfast items whatever you prefer..lol

Thanks for Reading my review! :)
author: Lizzie G.

description: My husband was done eating his breakfast by the time mine arrived.  Did someone forget to make my breakfast? I just finally cancelled it.
author: Nanette D.

description:
We walked in to meet some friends for a New Years day brunch.

Being my first time here, I avoided reading the reviews to ensure I would have my own unbiased opinion. The overall decor of the restaurant is outstanding. We were fortunate to get a seat in the backyard patio are.. or so I thought. Ordering at the front counter seemed a bit odd, but my hunger made me forget the small stuff. My order of pancakes, eggs and Maple bacon, and Sangria ran roughly $30 (not too bad for Noe Valley). Within 5 minutes of ordering the waitress brought our food with no issue.

So why the 2 stars? 10 minutes into my meal 2 aggressive pigeons came onto our table and tried to eat the eggs on my plate WHILE I'M EATING MY FOOD.  They literally tried to eat from the same plate I was eating from. I tried " shooing" them away but they paid me no mind. 5 pecks on my pancakes, and my party gave up. I'm no avian specialist, but these birds seemed so large and aggressive, this wasn't their first time jumping on someones plate. We went inside to make the staff aware and the hostess advised they were aware of the pigeon problem but had no plans to deal with it. 

While this made for a hilarious snapchat, no restaurant should allow pigeons to eat from their patrons plate while they're eating.
author: Samuel C.

description: I've been coming to Savor for years, but today I discovered that, under their new management, they did away with their crepes, their main attraction. Okay. Ordered their Bangkok salad, which I've been ordering for years, and it was simply uneatable. A parody of what it used to be. Couldn't finish it. Left hungry. This place has turned into the kind of crappy, overpriced hellhole you find at tourist locations. I am never coming back.
author: Mauro C.

description:
Is this CREPEVINE?? They basically have the same menu and food. We got alot of food and yes the portion is huge for around $12-15 bucks

The only thing I was disappointed about was that I told the server that it was my friends bday HINT HINT and then he forgot to bring out a cake. I had to remind him again and then they charged us full price of the cake. Really? Then it aint special at all. Oh well whatever. 

I will probably go to Crepevine instead.
author: Debbie D.

description: Brunch food and ambience are great here. There's a covered outdoor area in the back that makes you feel like you're in a mini garden. I always try to get a table back there. I've been here 3 times now and the service has been great every time. The location is perfect for us to walk to on the weekends and right in the heart of noe valley on 24th st. They have the fluffiest pancakes ever. I got the short stack which is only 2 pancakes but they're huge. My hubby usually gets the huevos rancheros w/chorizo which he's a fan of. Overall, it's a solid brunch spot. It's not as busy as some of the other places on 24th st. as it's towards the end of the main drag.
author: Lisa D.

description: Have no idea what Savor is thinking - first the pay at the front which ruins the experience. Now they've completely removed Crepes from the menu. It's basically an overpriced Diner now. Bummer - this used to be one of the best spots in Noe.
author: Christian H.

description: Had breakfast there today food was too cold service was good clean place just next time the food has to be hotter oh and one more thing you should put more potatoes on the plate when you order a breakfast
author: George S.

description: Returned to Savor after many months having not visited.   While it appears nearly the same as before, every aspect of my meal from quality, service , taste, pricing and atmosphere was sub par.   I have had higher quality food at a kids carnival.  It is clear cost cutting measures have only been matched by their ridiculously over priced menu.  That will be my last visit.   It's no wonder there was no line for a restaurant that once was a brunch destination.
author: Geoffrey S.

description: Used to love Savor and wanted to give it a chance since the new management took over. They kept some of the same menu items like the Sandwiches and salads but the quality is drastically lower than it used to be. I ordered a Caesar salad and they skimped on the lettuce and the dressing. Croutons and the dinner roll were awful and cheap. The chicken breast was incredibly dry, I could only eat half of it. It tasted like a chicken patty that had been grilled, then frozen, then microwaved right before serving. The interior of the restaurant is no longer warm and inviting. They slathered the same color of bright off white paint over every wall and the ceiling without any thought to ambiance or design.    It felt cold and uninviting. The switch to cheap diner signs and decor was sad. But I would have forgiven all of that if the food was good. It wasn't. I won't be back to eat. But I give 2 stars for actually having a nicely renovated outdoor patio, perhaps to drink iced tea on a warm day.
author: Courtney Y.

description: It's a relaxing place for American classics. Usually easy to get a table. LOVE the outdoor garden. Even if it's cold out, they have heaters. Family- and dog-friendly too. The new owner Charlie is very welcoming and nice as well.
author: Kelly K.

description:
We used to *love* this place, but unfortunately it has changed for the worse. They no longer offer table service, and it's adopted a very Crepevine-ish feel. I wonder if they are owned by the same people. Bummed they made this change, and frankly the food wasn't nearly as good as it used to be last time we went.  However, they still have the kid-friendly back patio, so I'm sure we'll still go upon occasion.

Just one more place along 24th street that ain't what it used to be. *sigh*
author: Sarah A.

description: Unfortunately I miss the other Savor. It looks like new ownership. There are no more crepes. Very very expensive. 2 eggs are $10. I know this is San Francisco but really? Service was actually very good and the waitress we had was very pleasant even though we were the only ones in the restaurant. Will not come back.
author: Tobias C.

description:
I used to love going to Savor.  The food is mostly still of the same quality, but this whole order-at-the-counter-and-take-a-number thing takes it from a nice sit-down breakfast/lunch place to a low-brow cafeteria.  Unfortunately, the prices did not adjust accordingly, and asking me about a tip before the food even arrives is just not a good idea.

Sorry Savor.  I *heart* you and I miss you, but I'm just going to say "no" to this change.  If cash flow was a problem, I wish you had opted instead to raise your food prices to keep the servers.  This new format....doesn't work for me.

Also - what's up with the burned potatoes?
author: Michael D.

description:
I had a three hour layover on my way home to Hawaii from the east coast so my big bro who is a regular here picked me up from the airport and brought me here for lunch. It was a great choice! Great service, great atmosphere and great food. I had a chicken breast sandwich with Brie, arugula and apples. It came with a side of fries ( best fries I have ever had, crispy, golden and fried to perfection!) I normally control myself ( trying to keep the weight down) and I indulged and ate ALL the fries. The salad the sandwiches come with-YES you get a salad AND fries ( I'm used to places making you choose between one and the other) was amazing. The homemade house dressing is spectacular. I was happy to be 35,000 feet in the air enjoying the other half of my sandwich since j ate all the salad and fries with half my sandwich at lunch and was content.

It's a great place for kids with a great menu ( breakfast and lunch items: scrambled eggs, pancakes, Mac n cheese, grilled cheese, ect )

You can bring your fur babies here too because there is a back patio that is covered. We brought my bro's dog.

They also serve up coffee and espresso drinks. I enjoyed an iced mocha smothered in whipped cream (again indulging since I was ending my quick vacation)
author: Jessica G.

description: This is a really good place for a variety of food in Noe Valley. Between sandwiches, pizza, pasta, burgers, and crepes (which they are supposed to bring back soon) The servers and management are very nice. Joanna was very sweet and stopped for a conversation with us as well as some free wine tasting. The food was delicious and the atmosphere is cozy and inviting. If you're in San Francisco or the Noe Valley area don't forget to check this place out!
author: Sarah E.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite local places when I was too tired to cook or when friends wanted something close to my place. The menu offers a lot of variety, the atmosphere is comfortable, the food is tasty and the portions generous. And the service used to be great. USED TO BE. They eliminated their wait staff and have become just like Crepevine, Crepe House and all the other cookie cutter, order from a menu board then take your number to your table type restaurants. 

I took a friend there for the first time since they changed their format and we were both disappointed not only with the lack of service, but with the meal itself. We ordered at the same time, however her food came out a full 5 minutes before mine. She ordered off the breakfast menu, I got a sandwich. While I was waiting i decided to order a drink so I had to leave the table and go back and stand in line. My food finally arrived and my french fries were cold. Since there was no server to check on the meal I just didn't eat most of them. I did flag down a server to ask for a straw for my drink and rather than an actual straw she brought me 3 skinny cocktail straws. 

I am so disappointed. They took a lovely little local restaurant and all but ruined it. I also wonder what became of their regular waitstaff. It would appear they're all out of jobs now. :(

I'm not sure I'll be back. It really bums me out.
author: Beth A.

description:
"Savoring" my last several days: 

3/9/14 @ 2:45 pm: Went to a late brunch at Savor (no wait) because Griddle Fresh was closed and Toast had a wait. 

@ 3:15 pm: Our nice waitress delivered my Mendocino Burger (Turkey w/ cheese & onion rings on a wheat bun).  

@ 3:16 pm: Took obligatory yelp pics in 1963268 different angles and took a first bite. Ok, turkey burger but patty tasted a bit off and not very fresh. Didn't think anything of it.

3/10/14 @ 5:15 am: Woke up and prayed to Mr. Kohler. Uh oh. 

@ 10:45 am: Ate several tablespoons of oatmeal. 

@ 11:00 am: Checked to see if the coast is clear in the office restrooms and prayed to Mr. Kohler again. Double uh oh. *thoughts of pitter patter of little ChErics running around*

@ 12 noon - 5:30 pm: Prayed to Mr. Kohler two more times. Stomach started churning like butter. Bubble guts...bubble guts...bubble guts.

@ 7:00 pm - 11:00 pm: Room started moving. Heart started racing. Extreme fatigue and body aches. Shivered like a wet puppy. 

@ 12 midnight: Woke up delirious, to an uncomfortable racing heart and my face feeling like it was lit in fire.

3/11/14 @ 1 am: Arrived at UCSF Emergency Room.

@ 1:45 am: 
"Nurse: Any chance you may be pregnant?"
*Mr. NSS starts hyperventilating*

Nurse: "Any new sexual partners?"
*Mr. NSS glares at me* 

Me: "No, and no." *AWKWARD*

@ 2 am - 4:45 am: Chest x-ray and blood tests taken. Hooked up on an IV to receive fluids. 

@ 4:50 am: Diagnosis - Viral Gastroenteritis aka Stomach Flu. 

3/11/14: QT time with Mr. Kohler. Every 15 minutes. 

Today, 3/12/14: Actually contemplating going vegetarian for a month. Umm does sushi count? :/
author: Cherylynn N.

description: I've been coming here regularly for months - mostly during slow times.  However, I have nothing but great things to say. Big menu - I've gotten burgers, sandwiches, breakfast for dinner, happy hour specials, etc. Always solid diner type fare.  I have the same waitress each time and she's really friendly and attentive. Relaxed place where I've had good food and great service.  Good solid diner type (with nicer atmosphere) as I was used to on the east coast. No nonsense comfortable place.
author: S L.

description:
This used to be our favorite easy local brunch spot but I don't think we will be back. They have changed it from table service to order at the counter and it felt disorganized and confusing.

 I also told guy taking my my order that I'm deathly allergic to pineapple and to please make me a new fruit side but when the food came I had the fruit with pineapple. They of course quickly made me a new one but it.
Very disappointed
author: Leda M.

description: I had been many times to this place, it is with the changes that I felt compelled to leave a review.  Terrible policy of paying upfront, why get rid of the wait staff?  Service is slow, food was OK.
author: Juan R.

description:
As someone who enjoys brunch every so often, I've been to this place about 3 times so far over the span of 3-4 years and ordered either their Cote d'Azur (an eggs benedict that comes with smoked salmon) or Blackstone (eggs benedict with avocado; no fish or meat). They do have a New Orleans (benedict with crab cakes) that I've seen my friends order and be satisfied with it. All their breakfast specialties come with a little cup of fruit and potatoes which is nice. If you aren't feeling their breakfast specialties, they have your usual omelettes, scrambles, french toast, sandwiches, and alcoholic beverages like bloody marys or mimosas.

Overall, I haven't found this place somewhere I would frequent often or go out of my way for because to me, their food is sort of average and something I can find at other brunch places. Be prepared to also spend a little more than $15 if you want something good here. What I do like about this place is that they have outdoor patio seating (which is nice!) and so far I haven't had to wait very long to get seated. I've had positive experiences with the staff and great service, which is why I wouldn't mind coming back every once in a while. 

In terms of convenience, it's located in Noe Valley and very close to the 48 bus stop with plenty of residential parking. If anything, go explore the neighborhood a little bit if you have some time to kill!
author: Kathleen S.

description: Cozy spot, my mother and I had great conversation over good food! It cold and rainy that day we visitor thank you for the fire place! Can't wait to visit again
author: Tippy T.

description:
Upon walking into Savor on a sunny Noe Valley Sunday morning, I noticed that the interior looked almost identical to Crepevine, a mediocre Bay Area chain restaurant that serves varieties of sweet & savory crepes, sandwiches, and scrambles. I learned later that Savor and Crepevine are owned by the same family/management; while Crepevine's food has never been up to par for me, I have to say Savor was far more impressive in both their dishes and ambiance. 

My friend and I tried the Noe Valley sandwich (grilled chicken breast, arugula, apples, brie, sundried tomato aioli on a dutch crunch roll; served with a side of thick fries) and the Santorini crepe (walnuts, pistachios, brown sugar, coconut, cinnamon and mascarpone). 

The sandwich was pretty decent - while the filling was quite rich and the apples & brie paired together nicely, the dutch crunch was not heated properly and ended up being cold. The side of fries was fantastic - thick cut, hot, Goldilocks-approved salt content. The sweet crepe was a little TOO sweet for my liking. 

My favorite part about Savor is the adorable backdoor covered patio - on a warm day, it's a perfect way to relax and mingle. Patio is also dog-friendly! 

I'll definitely be back to grab a cup of coffee on the backdoor patio, but I think I'll have a taste at all the numerous neighboring brunch spots in Noe Valley before I decide to eat here again.
author: Crystal J.

description: I'm so sad to reduce my ratings for this once go-to brunch spot. I went Saturday and it was dead. For good reason. They no longer have wait service, and the whole mood has changed. The food is still yummy, but these prices do not justify no-service and unfriendly atmosphere.
author: Antonia T.

description: Hooray! Table service has returned and so have I. Boycotted the place during its interim funky format even though it had been my go-to place for weekend brunch with the pup on the back patio, and I suspect a lot of the neighborhood did as well. Menu seems to be about 2/3 of what it used to be (no more cornbread ) but I'm just happy to have the old Savor back and I'm sure a lot of the former clientele will soon be returning just like me!
author: Lee Y.

description: Great place for a nice casual meal.  Terrific menu that offers everything from great omelettes and pancakes, to pasta, pizza and burgers.  Wonderful staff especially Margarita and Joanna, who is the best and sweetest server in Noe Valley.  Our favorite spot for Friday dinner after a long work week.
author: William P.

description: For a family meal or Sunday brunch, this place can't be beat. The patio is fantastic on a nice day and the fireplace is super cozy when it's raining. The wait staff is friendly and attentive. (Note: it's table service, not counter service as stated in other reviews). Food we love include all the omelettes and sandwiches, Shanghai salad, and dinner options like the lamb shank and fried trout. Beware--the portions are enormous. Our kids love that the kids meals come with fresh fruit. Savor is a gem.
author: Tatyana H.

description: Despite abandoning their misguided counter-ordering system and returning to table service, this is still a sad shadow of the good neighborhood restaurant it used to be. Although there is very nice, well-meaning staff, it feels like a mediocre suburban place now: a giant TV now dominates the formerly lovely outdoor seating area, the staff are well-intentioned but inexperienced and amateur, and the multiple menus you are given upon sitting down offer a chaotic hodgepodge of diner basics and earnest attempts at a few more sophisticated dishes. Nice people, not a very good restaurant.
author: tw s.

description:
Great outdoor seating with heat and shades & excellent service!

I've been meaning to review Savor for quite sometime and glad that YELP reminded this time around.

Pretty much everything you order here is delicious.  When my coworker and I were here last he had the Vietnamese pork sandwich and he enjoyed it while I had their seafood salad sandwich.  On previous occasions I had their strawberry waffles which was out of this world.  

One thing that standout here is their excellent customer service here.  They are very attentive and always asked  if we needed anything else.  They even refilled my coffee before I had to ask.  What great consistent service time and time again.  

I haven't brought my dog here yet but I imagine it would be okay seating outdoors and possibly seating way towards near the outdoor exit so not to interfere with others dinning.  

Cheers!
author: Edwin R.

description: Still one of my favorite places for great food. You walk in and it's as if you're a regular... Every staff person says hello and welcomes you. The patio out back is great & dog friendly!  I love the scrambles, from simple to spicy... Delicious. I tried a gluten-free crepe filled with eggs, chicken sausage, spinach and potatoes in the side.  SOOOO good! The coffee is a great blend of strength and flavor. Enjoy this casual and delicious place!
author: Craig H.

description: What the heck happened to Savor!?  It used to be a great brunch spot and now it's just another run of the mill, Squat and Gobble wanna be.   They have changed the place to an order at the counter diner and the food quality has gone way down.  It's apparent everyone has noticed as it used to be packed on the weekends and now there are plenty of tables open.   They even messed up our grilled cheese.  That's college cooking 101.
author: Greg S.

description: I got the chicken & waffles. It was almost $20 and it was chicken tenders. They were good chicken tenders. But y'all. The servers are super nice and the atmosphere is great. Nice place to hang out but the food is mediocre and expensive.
author: Cathy R.

description: Stopped by to try a meal with the new format. I thought the quality dropped quite a bit and the service was minimal
author: Tom B.

description: I used to love bringing visitors to this place.  I haven't been here in awhile and was surprised at the new "order-at-counter" thing.  Completely different feel...still waiting for our food to arrive, but I probably won't come back.  I can just go to CrepeVine for fast-food crepe dining.  The charging for a tip at the time of order seems almost insulting, as it forces you to choose the percentage when running your card through. No wonder there is no waiting for a table at noon on a Sunday. What a shame.
author: Brett J.

description: Who ever did what they did to our beloved restaurant should be fired! No table service and a front desk staff that can't understand anything restaurant! And yes even the food has changed BUMMER we tried several times to give the new Savor a chance well no more! And btw it used to be packed in here on a Saturday at noon, now looking pretty empty!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Savor went from great to garbage when some profit hungry hipster bought it and fired the servers, replacing w/ order and pay up front take number sign to your table, and cut the menu by 75%. It just about died (terrible!) until a real human bought it back, and returned it to a warm service oriented restaurant. Servers check in, ask if you need anything, explain dishes, make substitutions, etc. SAVOR is BACK!!!
author: Ian B.

description: The food is really good - I've had several items on the menu (the Pacific sandwich and fries, grilled chicken Caesar salad, Athena salad, etc). Nice patio in the back if you want to eat outside. Not giving 5 stars for 2 reasons - I don't like that they've done away with table service & you now order at the counter and the staff has never been very friendly.
author: M G.

description:
Thanks for letting the Pacific Fleet Band ensemble play in front of your wonderful restaurant..

I have eaten here many times and always enjoyed my meal..
author: Brent P.

description: Meh--had not realized ownership had changed.  Don't get me wrong, the ingredients all seem fresh, but the once "Let's go to Savor...YEAH!" has gone to a bit of just another run of the mill breakfast/lunch eatery in SF.   The Crepes are not what they used to be from my many visits prior to this when I lived near SF previously (we made a special day during our vacation to ensure we went here again this trip)...dare I say that crepes be just as good if you get them from the crepe booth at the mall?  The crepes have been limited to just a few although the chicken sausage one was pretty good.  The single dessert crepe was simply some berries with what seems like nutella.  Seemed like the 4 servers were confused on who had our table and we either had all 4 come by within 30 seconds each wave or nobody for lengths of time.  Some other customers seemed slight disappointed when their pizza came out burnt...basically saying to the staff that there would not be another visit and commenting to some other customers that they hoped the other customers would have a better experience...  Hopefully Savor can regain the formula they once had!
author: Steve Y.

description:
We had a great brunch for my daughters birthday everything was great! we order a pitcher of mimosa $20 with freshly squeeze Oj. 
we had:
crab Benedict home potatoes
Savory chicken crepe 
chicken and waffle
Tuna melt
corn beef and home potatoes. 
all came out quickly and hot. would come again and again.
author: Leila R.

description: The new order at the counter format is disappointing. It feels more like a cafeteria than a restaurant.
author: kris k.

description:
The crepe menu is very similar to crepevine. I got the Bombay crepe. It was horrible. Some tragic concoction of Indian spices. The same Bombay crepe is much better at crepevine.

Got the chocolate molten cake for dessert. Mediocre at best. 

The service was decent and so were the sweet potato fries.
author: Arun R.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants for breakfast. Inside it is loud, but outside it is nice and they have heaters. I got Swedish pancakes; a scrumptious breakfast of oatmeal pancakes. I ordered sausage too. It was really great and the pancakes came with a strawberry compote. I would recommend this place.
author: Summer B.

description:
Brunch on a Saturday morning?  This is the place to go!  Most other places have huge lines out the door, but not Savor.  That's not because people are avoiding it, they just don't know about it yet!

They have a nice large back patio area with plenty of tables and seats.  This is one of the biggest reasons why there isn't a wait, they can accommodate more than the average restaurant.

We began our meal by sharing an order of the Pumpkin Pancake.  It was delicious and fluffy, full of pumpkin flavor and the whipped cream was a nice touch.

Savor is known for their Crepe's.  I choose the Mazatian Savory Crepe.  It was filled with fresh tomotoes, cheese, and essentially a whole avocado!  The side of roasted potatoes was pretty tasty as well.

One of my favorite brunch dishes is Eggs Benedict.  Savor offers both a Crab Cake style and Smoke Salmon option.  One of my biggest annoyances is when the chefs are unable or unwilling to simply stack together one of each on to a plate.... why is it so difficult to grab just one crab cake instead of two, and just one serving of smoked salmon instead of two servings?
Disappointingly, they denied my friends request to have one of each again..... so far i've still only found one place that has ever been willing to do one of each. That's why Anne Sather's of Chicago will always be my favorite place to have brunch!
author: Albert C.

description:
This is a cute restaurant in Noe Valley. 

It has a large outdoor patio and a smaller interior. We came at dinner time and sat outside as it was actually a warm night. Plus, the patio is dog friendly and they'll even provide a doggie bowl of water for your pup. 

This is more of a breakfast/brunch spot. The dinner menu is fairly limited to just sandwiches, crepes, and salads, so that was kinda of a negative for me, but the prices are fairly inexpensive. Most things on the menu were between $9-12, so very reasonable and the portions are quite large. 

I got the steak sandwich which came with a side salad and fries. It was very tasty. My boyfriend got the pulled pork which he liked, but I preferred my dish. 

I'd come back here again for brunch, but rumor has it that there's often a long line. There was absolutely no wait for dinner and it was pretty empty. We were the only ones on the spacious patio. There's also a TV outside on the patio if you care to watch sports.
author: Rebecca G.

description: The owner came by on a Sunday and randomly dropped off a couple of glasses of wine (no charge) and said hi to us and our dog. Great food and service! Nice patio and PET FRIENDLY!
author: David E.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend during the hottest weekend this summer has provided. We wanted to eat and drink out on a patio and Savor delivered. 

The patio here is absolutely gorgeous, the service was great, and most importantly I loved my meal. Started with the Spicy Cornbread with Jalapeno Jelly (it was fantastic). I am a big fan of spicy jelly and jam - this hit the spot. Next I tried the the 'New Orleans' (crab cakes on english muffin with poached eggs topped with spicy cajun hollandaise) which was absolutely delicious. The homefries and fresh fruit it came with were also both above average for SF. The portion sizes were so generous that one dish was definitely enough for the two of us.

And the drinks? The Bloody Mary was delicious, if you like it spicy don't hold back when they ask you how spicy to make it, as was the hard lemonade.

I wish this was closer to my apartment - I will definitely come back again.
author: Josh S.

description: This place is amazing! Best part was the service. Right after was the food! So yummy. There isn't anything not good on the menu. Enjoy!
author: Candice N.

description: Was our favorite brunch and all day breakfast spot. Recently switched from full service to order at the counter and take a number. The reason I come to a restaurant is for service. What if I want to order more drinks or food? Do you think I want to wait in line to do that? Who wants to wait in line to order when you could be sitting enjoying coffee while you wait. I feel bad for all the servers who must have lost their jobs. We will take our once a week patronage elsewhere.
author: Jenny P.

description:
Like other folks who've commented, we used to enjoy Savor and had been having lunch or brunch there on average once a month for years..

Today, though, I was surprised when we learned about its conversion to a self-order/number-to-the-table eatery. A lot of the previous wait staff had been there for years and always greeted us and all the other familiar faces with warmth. And the service was always fine, since everybody on the floor backed one another up - meaning us diners would always get any needs met quickly even if the place was packed.

However, since the menu looked largely the same, and I understand the financial pressure on restaurants these days - especially affordable and dependable ones - we just followed the new protocol and ordered.

The bean chili has always provided a delicious alternative to heavier fare - and we each got a cup of that and split a turkey sandwich. Sadly, the chili was without any flavor at all - just a little bit of heat. Salt did nothing to brighten it up. The sandwich was also lower in grade. There was a deli-level over-abundance of sliced turkey - which I guess is fine if you like deli food - and there the tomato slices (one full slice of a small tomato accompanied by a quarter-slice of another) were a bit beyond skimpy.

The french fries that come with the sandwich are now beer-battered, and that created an OK crunch - but did nothing to spark up the flavor.

After the food was delivered, follow-up service was non-existent.

On leaving, we both agreed we probably won't return unless we hear that things have improved.
author: Ben B.

description: Savor was recommended to me by a local, and I was not disappointed. I was there during off-hours--3:30 on a Sunday afternoon--and nearly had the place to myself.  It was a beautiful day in the City, but chilly, and I was beyond delighted to find they had a gas fireplace, and that I could sit next to it and enjoy the ambience--and warmth--as I enjoyed my Prosecco and Bombay crepe.  They were so not-busy that they provided me with table service, and my server was a delight. He gave me abundant time and advice, and the meal was tasty and thoroughly enjoyable. I will definitely return when I am hungry in Noe Valley in the future!
author: N F.

description: Been coming here for years, the food is always good but the new ordering at the front is just poor service.  They should revert to paying at the table.  We should not have to tip before service.
author: Ruben F.

description: Won't go here again. You have to order at the counter now. What is this, McDonald's? If I want to wait on myself, I can eat at home. No thanks.
author: E. G.

description:
I don't subscribe to the philosophy of large portions = good value, but I think management here does. Did they come from the Cheesecake Factory? I ordered a risotto with salmon. It came with a spring salad. The spring salad consisted of bland romaine lettuce and cherry tomatoes, and cucumbers. The risotto was mushy and not very good. The salmon was dry and overcooked.

This meal could have fed a small family of 3. I felt bad for leaving more than half my plate unfinished, unfortunately, I couldn't eat another bite.
author: Robert C.

description:
My friends are breakfast and brunch people. I'm more of a dinner and dessert person.
Sure Savor has every classic breakfast item imaginable.

Omelettes, waffles, pancakes; yet not one of them stands out to me.

I've had about 5-6 things off of their menu, including the corned beef hash, eggs benedict, and of course waffles and pancakes, all of which come with potatoes.
All of which, seem to taste the same to me. 

This place reminds me of an upscale chain restaurant like IHOP, or Shari's, or Denny's.

Since I'm not really a breakfast person, this place better stand out...and for me, it doesn't.
author: Jack R.

description: This place was pretty disappointing. The food was ok but the service was crazy slow! I understand your busy but when I have to ask 2 different ppl for water and still don't get it :(.
author: Vi Vi V.

description: I have been coming for years and it is sad what they have turned into. I live down the street and barely come since the fired the servers and have the register person also running food. Too bad.
author: Ron V.

description:
I would love to give this restaurant 4 or even 5 stars. The staff are wonderful and everything looked great on the tables around us. The back patio is lovely.

We went for fairly simple fare: scrambled eggs, pancakes, bacon. 

The bacon looked good but in fact was so dry it was like bacon-flavored dried seaweed, that crumbled when you touched it. This was surprising because we had specifically ordered soft, NOT AT ALL crispy bacon! We had to send it back.

The pancakes LOOKED delicious - but they were so mushy inside we had to send them back. The staff helpfully gave us new hotcakes, only slightly less mushy inside. Good flavor but still undercooked. What is up with that? 

For the price, I would expect that they could cook up these simple items more skillfully. I might go back to try something else but I am sure I won't be able to get my husband to join me.
author: Janet F.

description:
As I was walking to Savor at 10am on Sunday to meet up with my friend for brunch, I was starting to get nervous. I kept passing place after place with lines down the block. Uh oh, I thought, I don't want to wait an hour for brunch!

Luckily we didn't need to! Savor is huge with tons of seating. I headed to their covered back patio with heat lamps and enjoyed the pseudo outside feel while I waited for my friend. The staff was very friendly and attentive. My water and coffee were continuously filled. I ordered the chicken and waffles, which was delicious! And so much food for the price. It came with four pieces of chicken, a waffle, fresh fruit and country gravy. The chicken was very crispy and savory and the waffle was the perfect mixture of sweet. My friend ordered an omelet, which was huge! I think that if you are a moderate eater you could definitely split the omelet between two people.

My friend and I were having such a good time catching up we didn't even realize that we were there for two and a half hours! The staff at Savor was friendly the whole time and never made us feel rushed to clear the table. I think I just found my new brunch spot!
author: Casey S.

description: The food here is really good and the service has always been nice and accommodating to my family with our little ones. I was sad to see the format change to an order at the counter style establishment. It just doesn't feel the same. The servers at this place made it a dining experience, which made the higher prices acceptable. Now that you order at the counter the prices don't quite match the experience and although the food is great it just feels overpriced. I hope this isn't the beginning of the end for what was once a local favorite.
author: Mike L.

description:
I've lived in the neighborhood for 13 years and have dined at Savor many times, usually for brunch. I've always enjoyed it -- until last weekend. Some family was in town, so I took them to Savor for Sunday brunch. The food was solid, as usual, and the service was decent, though not as good as it used to be. I was quite taken aback, though, when a person who I assume was the manager asked us to vacate our table after we payed our check and were still drinking our coffee. He mentioned something about a large party that had been waiting a long time.

I've been dining out in various cities at restaurants of various calibers for decades. I can't remember a single time I was ever asked to give up my table in this manner. This is absolutely unacceptable under any circumstances.

Savor has lost a customer.
author: The Other Jeff A.

description: best service i've had in awhile. food was good too, calamari was crispy, burger was dank. big portions too & dog friendly. also, they give food to the homeless, so they are pretty dope
author: Ariel S.

description: Cute brunch spot. Pretty big for the location  with indoor and outdoor seating. The Palermo pasta was really good. Can't go wrong with the Nutella crepe either.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I could eat the Shanghai salad everyday. It's so good!!!!! Love this place and the staff. It's a great place to eat breakfast lunch and dinner! 
There's street parking available with meters. If you're in town you gotta try this place. 
Definitely need to try more dishes because that salad has me hooked. 
Will post photos of future dishes I try.
author: Victoria V.

description:
What an awesome start to the new year!

Wifey and I wanted breakfast...the good stuff...something super Americana.  We headed over to 24th st and found savor...the place was super inviting and festive.  The employees greeted us immediately with happy new year!  I really appreciate all the workers who had to work yesterday (including myself) and those who either had to wake up super early or not sleep to get to work today.   Kudos to us!  Haha.  

Ambiance:  cute.  Roomy seating area and decorative of the season...I love how the kitchen is within view.  Nice touch.  All the employees hugged each other as they came to work...a family type of feeling.   Good stuff!

The food:  YUM!  I said I wanted something super Americana...so I ordered the Americana.  Haha.  I substituted egg whites...picked chicken apple sausage and rye toast.  I love how the sausage was butterflied and I could see the bits of actual apple in my sausage.  The rye toast was thick...so so good.  Just a basic breakfast to start off my new year.  Wifey ordered the complete opposite...she had the costa del sol.  Eggs Benedict with spinach and honey ham...the hollandaise was perfect...the ham was juicy and flavorful...but the spinach really brought everything together.  Oh, and the home fries were perfectly crisp!  

The service was awesome...he had me after he complimented my niners beanie and called out the chef who is a cowboys fan.  Haha.  

Overall, a 5 star experience...food and service were both above average...cutesy location...awesome way to start off my yelpin new year!  Woohoo!
author: Jen W.

description:
Can someone tell me what's so great? 

The menu consist of your typical brunch foods (French toast, pancakes, omelets, eggs Benedict, etc...) so I decided to just give the buckwheat pancakes and tofu scramble a whirl. And what did I get? MEH. Really nothing special and to be honest somewhat bland. 
The back patio is busy and I love that you can bring your dog! The service is fast and efficient but food just isn't up to par. Sadly I guess that means I won't be coming back here but hey we live and we learn right?
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
C: What do you want to eat?

Me: Uhhh, I don't know. I'm not really craving anything so I'll leave it up to you. 

C: how about Thai? 

Me: No, we just had that the other night. 

C: How about Papalote? 

Me: No, not feeling like Mexican food right now. 

C: Well, you said you're leaving it up to me and you're rejecting all my suggestions so apparently, it's really up to you. 

Me: (picking up iPhone to check Yelp bookmarks) Fine. (Scrolling. Five minutes later) What about Savor? It's close by and we've never been. 

The above is a classic example of how we decide what to have for lunch or dinner and is exactly the conversation we had the other day. I'll go on to say some of these convos in the past have resulted in semi-bickering but lately we've managed to avoid taking it too far. 

We had a "Lazy Sunday" yesterday and ended up taking out brunch and dinner from Savor. Their menu offers breakfast fares to sweet/savory crepes, pastas, salads, sandwiches so we had a lot to choose from. 

Food was ok, a bit bland but does well to satisfy your hunger. The portions are huge so keep that in mind when placing your order. For example they offer a small or large salad. The small was PLENTY for two. 

The place is larger than you'd expect judging from the outside. They even have a patio in the back for outdoor dining.

A solid 3.5. A great option on 24th for those days when you're stumped on what to eat and you're not feeling particularly picky.
author: Esther A.

description:
The menu is huge. The portions are huge. And so is the patio. People love patios. So how does this place manage to hide away in little Noe Valley?

I ordered the Tuscany crepe (chicken, mushrooms, garlic, almonds, feta and provolone with pesto) which includes house potatoes and mixed greens. The potatoes were standard, although a little crispier would be nice. The crepe was packed full with goodness, namely the pesto. The almonds gave it a little extra crunch and texture. I also got to try some french toast, which was plump and fluffy. It reminded me of Crepevine, but about half a portion bigger and the crepe selection was wider. The ambiance is also calmer and more comfortable. 

Our server was very attentive and refilled my glass at least 5 times before it went empty. Poor guy, I was thirsty that day. Nevertheless, he seemed like a jolly good fellow cracking a few jokes here and there. 

Coming here was a little out of my way, but I wouldn't mind doing so again. At least there was no hour wait like some other popular brunch places. Plus, I got leftovers for the next day unless someone else gobbles it up.. thanks Mom.
author: Ashley L.

description:
The past few times I've been here I've noticed the manager/owner guy (the one with the ponytail) is very controlling. I was here once before and he was standing right behind a newer waitress watching her take our orders. Super uncomfortable.
The last time I went here was an overall terrible experience. I ordered a wet cappuccino, drink arrived a ridiculously bubbly foamy mess. At the coffee shop I work at we call this "bubble bath foam." I immediately told her to remake it. The ponytail dude brought the beverage back to me and started to argue with me on what I ordered. This man clearly knows nothing about making espresso drinks and neither does their staff. I could not believe he confronted me like that, anybody who works in food service knows that this is extremely unprofessional. I then asked for just a latte instead and that also came out bubble bath style. Ponytail proceeded to hang around my table clearly trying to watch me drink the beverage. It tasted horrible, espresso was improperly extracted but I just shut up and drank it so ponytail would back off.
We were sitting in the back patio area, and I made a comment to my friend about how the awning should be opened up because it's a sunny day and they have a pretty tree in the back patio. Somehow ponytail heard this (because he was spying on me) and opened the awning. It was nice, except when he did that a bunch of dead fruit flies fell from the awning and dropped all over our food. Yikes.
Calm down ponytail man! Stop making customers feel uncomfortable.
author: Marie O.

description:
Came to Sahhh-vore for New Year's Eve brunch with some fam. We got seated in less than the time they told us the wait would be for our party which was nice. Lots of holiday decor was up and tons of nutcrackers everywhere. Besides indoor seating, there's a patio as well but it is covered. 

Service from our waitress was friendly. I ordered the belgian waffles which were huge and came with whipped cream and berries. They were good, not too sweet, but I expected more of a crunch to them. They were too soft for my absolute liking. I also had a bite of french toast (nice and eggy), salmon benedict (delicious salmon but eggs were not cooked), and a savory crepe (yummy but I can't remember which one. it had really tasty sausage). The pancakes were huge but tasted a bit like bisquick to me.  

Overall, good brunch food but nothing I overly savor for.
author: Maya S.

description:
Excellent place for breakfast lovers like myself! Almost all day with a great patio in the back! 
Although I saw all these delicious orders of French toast dance by my table... I ended up ordering the Caesar salad with chicken. Perfectly dressed, good meat, nice portion. 
Must try! Very busy on weekends!
author: Cherie F.

description: Family favorite  since early 2000, good food , friendly staff, always welcoming me and my family, we come here almost once a week for breakfast and lunch , some of the staff has been here forever since I can remember
author: Valeriana L.

description:
It's suppertime...and brunch is so five minutes ago. Definitely a couple of notches above a Crepevine, Savor is exactly the kind of cozy neighborhood place you want to have as your go-to place when your parents unexpectedly drop by from, say, Los Banos. No, it's not a cutting-edge culinary destination for your hipster pals who want to head downtown afterward and go clubbing. I don't live in Noe Valley, so I didn't know it was already a brunch staple. Jamie W. and I headed here for dinner after inadvertently catching the J train in search of dinner on a weeknight. It turned out to be an unassuming winner.

We started with sharing a $9 Spanakopita that came accompanied with quite a serving of hummus, pickled vegetables, cubes of feta cheese, and a big round of pita (see photos). The spanakopita was really well put together, all crispy and savory, and the hummus was very fresh with a swirl of virgin olive oil on top. Show-off that he is, Jamie went lighter than me on his entree with the $11.50 Tuscan Chicken, which came already sliced with fries and a side salad (see photo). It was flavorful, filling stuff.

At the same time, I'm still glad I went with the $18 Hangar Steak, medium rare and hearty-good with a mushroom au jus ladled all over it. As unadventurous as Savor is, the creamy mashed potatoes and mixed vegetable medley were just what I wanted that evening (see photo). Service was attentive, and Diet Coke refills came without provocation. They serve good stuff here, unexpectedly solid for a longtime place with such a low profile elsewhere in the city. Their brunch may be more famous, but dinner is definitely worth a try here.

FOOD - 4 stars...solid Mediterranean and American plates for the hearty appetite
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...on the dark side but the noise level ain't bad
SERVICE - 4 stars...good people doing their job well
TOTAL - 4 stars...a neighborhood place worth a cross-town visit
author: Ed U.

description:
The food here is awesome! I'm always happy and satisfied when I walk out the door. The service can be quite spotty though, which is reason for the one star drop. The servers are absolutely wonderful! Unfortunately the hosts pave a negative path into what is usually a really fabulous experience. 

Owners & Managers of Savor! Please give your hosts better training! They are the first and last impression of your restaurant. Each time I walk in I have to greet the hostess, they don't greet me. As a hostess you need to be confident and know what's going on in the restaurant. 
Today I watched a guest have to run around the restaurant to get a time estimate for an indoor table. The guest should not be doing the grunt work, they're here for a relaxing experience. 
Today the hostess walked us back to our table and failed to even hold the heavy door leading out to the back patio and so the door flung back on me as she rushed through it. I can open a door, that's not the problem. It's the lack of common courtesy and being present. 
Lastly, smile once in a while. Don't look so god awfully overwhelmed. 

The beauty of this rainy Sunday at Savor is the hot chocolate that hit the spot! The Arizona omelette that is always so enticing! And the sweet and attentive server that made our morning a simpler one. Thank you Savor!
author: olivia l.

description:
One of the best meals I have ever had in San Francisco, the trout was tasty and a very full portion. Served with garlic mashed potatoes and chicken poblano soup, my meal was a welcome surprise as we found this restaurant randomly. The restaurant was cozy and very cute inside.

I would give the restaurant a 5 if it wasn't for the poor service. The waitress seemed consumed with herself, never asked us about our meal and made us wait 20 minutes for check and after we asked she waited on another table first. Very sad for a restaurant with such exceptional food.
author: Drew F.

description:
Pros: lots of options on the menu. I like that they have outside seating and a big tv outside if you are hanging out with someone that is annoying and you have to pretend you are listening to.
Cons: Overpriced, the taste has low quality and tables are too close to each other. 

Overall my food sucked! I left hungry and left my plate full. Will probably come back just because I like the restaurant and ambience and will take a chance and order something different on the menu.
author: janat s.

description:
One sentence summarizes this place: It is a family-friendly, kid-friendly, group-friendly, good service restaurant that serves OK-food and at OK-price. 

When other places are jammed on weekend brunches in Noe Valley (Chloe's, Griddle Fresh, and sometimes Toast), this place usually doesn't have a wait. That is because it's got a large amount of seating, both indoors and in the back outdoors (heated). Given how huge the place is, the speed at which they serve you is pleasantly fast.

They also have an enormous amount of high chairs and space for you to place strollers. The food options cover all your basic needs: savory crepes, sweet crepes, sandwiches, salad, pasta....great for all ages and all appetites. 

The food isn't bad. But it's also not something you would remember. Still, we'd keep coming to this place, because it exists, there's no wait, and we need food.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Thank you Savor for a wonderful gluten Free meal. The staff was very sensitive to my nondairy non gluten preferences.  The server even came and double checked with me if I had an allergy or just a preference (as the crepe was made with milk). In my case I CAN tolerate very conservative amounts of gluten and dairy but I was glad she double checked anyway. 

Husband got the Lamb Shank - I am not sure if it was GF or not, but the tidbits I tasted from his plate were so tender and DELISH and portions were HUGE.

I got the GF Tuscan Crepe with NO cheese and NO pesto (for dairy). It was quite yummy and very filling even without the dairy ingredients.  Generous amounts of potatoes and salad on the side. The GF crepe was flakey and just as good as you would expect from a regular crepe. 

I also got a side of Corn bread (GF) with jalapeño Jelly.  and it was DELISH. Not too spicy at all and perfect texture. The slice was a generous portion as well. 

Returning customers need to note that they have recently changed formats to ordering at the counter before being seated. The dinner menu has shrunk in options from before according to my dinner guests but the 5 of us all enjoyed our meal entrees. As far as I can tell from my guests' comments, the quality of the food remains consistently good. The service was attentive to our table and we enjoyed our meal.
author: Win H.

description:
This place serves more than just Crepes. I haven't had one yet but i will tell you I had the chicken club sandwich and OMG it was sooo good. The chicken breast was nice and juicy and not dry at all. I usually run away from chicken sandwiches or burgers for this reason. I would highly recommend it. We also shared a ceviche and that was awesome better than some of the mexican restaurants in the city! I was surely impressed. 

The ambiance outside was very nice, they have heaters in case it's cold. It's very, very cute place. I went on a Wednesday afternoon and it was quite empty which I am sure it is not the same case on the weekends. I will definitely will be back to try all the other items on their menu! Yum, white sangria!!!
author: Carla F.

description:
Horrible experience- Please Read. I never write reviews, this is my 1st ever. Do not go if you believe you deserve some respect from management in a restaurant. Manager at Savor is nice on the outside but a huge Jerk in reality. This is down the street from me and I enjoyed the food here for years, not amazing but pretty good, but had a horrible experience on my last visit for takeout on an evening in December. I was asking the hostess, who was about to process my payment, if there were any good condiments that go well with the crepes. She didnt seem to speak perfect English and didnt seem to understand (Nothing against her, she seemed nice), so I rephrased and still didnt seem to process. I tried to explain 1 last time, simply asking if they recommend any sauces that could accompany the crepes, and was gonna leave it alone, when suddenly the Manager (please don't say this isn't pc.. but he was Middle Eastern looking guy with longish hair), ran up aggressively yelling at me that I need to leave and stop giving his employees a hard time, that Im always causing trouble.. on and on.. I was dumbfounded, embarrassed and felt terrible. (Over the past year or so had some iffy experiences where for instance my wife and I ordered in dinner and when I came 35 min later to pick it up it appeared the host didnt input my order and forgot what it was, and had to start from scratch. Was late and we were so hungry, but they just shrugged it off, and I didn't even make a big fuss less a brief dialogue that I was not happy about it. Any good restaurant would have recognized that screw up and would care more about pleasing the customer... and a couple times there were minor things like we were overcharged, or they took the order down wrong). Seems the manager had a selective memory and probably associated my face as someone who "caused problems," when in reality the faults were not mine! I had a friend who used to work there and I don't want to say anything bad about the staff, however it has really felt like a lack of courteousness and accountability. And lets just say hypothetically, even if I had "caused some trouble," whatever that could mean, how can the manager verbally attack a paying customer like that. There are no 2 ways around it, he was rude and out of line, and didn't even apologize after he realized all I was asking for was a condiment. I hope the owner reads this and the manager has some accountability for his actions. Its a shame but I will NOT go back there without a sincere apology at the least. Worst restaurant experience of my life.

**Additional note- Read another review where another long time Noe Valley resident, who loved to come here, also had the displeasure of encountering the manager's disrespect when he asked him and his family to vacate the table because there was a big party waiting. 

No restaurant should tolerate any staff, especially management, to treat paying customers so poorly and with such blatant disregard.
author: Mark K.

description: Good food, I had the Huevos Rancheros for 15 bucks and it was delicious!
author: Dennis T.

description:
Rachael Ray needs to get on the Savor boat because this place is pretty darn affordable and the portions are HUGEEEEEEE! 

First of all, this place is huge! You can choose to eat either outside or inside! It's amazing! The service is top notch. Robert Irvine can't touch them! They are the perfect waiters, WAY WAY WAY WAY better than any waiter I have ever seen, even at Cheesecake Factory! They like to joke and throw genuine smiles. You don't get that everyday. 

I ordered the Meatball Sandwich with sweet potato fries. The sandwich was almost a big as the sandwiches you'd get at Ike's and the fries, OMG, were godly! They were so crispy even after 10-15 minutes of talking with friends. They were perfectly fried and perfectly seasoned. I was sad that I couldn't even finish it and I'm a big eater! I was only able to finish half of it. Just one look at the food and I knew instantly that I have fallen in love with this place and will risk my life riding the scary 24 bus from the Bayview just to eat their food again. I would go here again and again. 

If you come here during the day, DEFINITELY check out their lunch specials. You really do get that bang for your buck!
author: Cynthia D.

description: Lovely garden terrace with great outdoor seating! Wonderful for breakfast and weekend brunch. Very kid friendly with Delicious pancakes! Great, consistently superb service, along with a diverse menu with a vast array of options, including gluten-free, vegetarian and healthy choice. Metered Parking can be a challenge, but there are a couple of small, public lots along 24th street that may be a good option.
author: William H.

description:
I can't believe I didn't know this breakfast place existed! I learned about it from a Noe local, and was impressed.

It's a big place with friendly service, and huge portions. And they have a patio.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Drove around looking for a brunch place that everybody doesn't already know about because we didn't want to wait in line.  We are like that. And since we're special we were going to find this place without benefit of a yelp review. And then we had no plans to tell a single soul about our amazing discovery.

So we wasted a bunch of gas, and finally ended up here when we gave up.

Sat next to the fire.  That was good. Some huge cops having a huge meal were sitting on one side of us. That was good. But they should have arrested the incredibly annoying table of women on the other side of us,  who squealed.  Like pigs.  Thin pigs. They were eating fruit. Of course.  Sadly they displaced a lot of area for such skinny chicks...they had large designer handbags which encroached onto my seat. I keep sort of pushing them back. It was an uber polite little space war. Me quietly shoving bags off of my lap, them squealing, and, gesticulating, eating their fruit, and shoving bags back. Sigh.
