Oh yeah, the food: 
We had New Orleans Benedict which is really a benedict with crab cakes. I didn't want the special New Orleans hollandaise on top.  I wanted the regular lemony fattening goodness hollandaise sauce.  They said fine. 

And it was very very good hollandaise sauce. Worth every calorie. Crab cakes were just fine. Potatoes were garlicky and yummy.  Portions were huge. 
But hey, I forgot to mention that I had fruit too. Just like the skinny squealing  space hog annoying chicks at the next table. So those calories didn't really count, right?

Day 3 of vacation. Clearly I'm going to need another week off if I want to undergo an attitude adjustment. Maybe I'll know I've recovered enough to return to work when I can eat in Noe Valley and not get annoyed?
author: El B.

description: This is complicated. I wish I would have written a review for this place a long time ago because it would have been a really wonderful one but on our most recent visit we had a really unpleasant experience and I won't be going there again. The new set up sucks to put it plainly but it's the service I'm writing about. I ordered my food and specifically asked for eggs over medium but when the server dropped the food off they were over easy, if that. They looked like they were cooked for all of 3 seconds. I asked him politely if I this could be fixed. I told him the issue and he was so annoyed with me. He came over and looked at the eggs for what seemed like forever inspecting as if I was full of it. I hadn't touched any of the food except to cut the egg. He argued with me about it which is BS. What's he going to do, ask for a scientific examination of the egg and the runniness of the yolk (which was like water.) Afterward he and a coworker kept staring at us and being obnoxious. FFS! I could understand if I was a jerk or was being unreasonable but no, asking for the order to be corrected isn't asking for a ration of shit. It's pretty shameful because there is no doubt he's treated other people like that. I guess Savor is doing such great business that they aren't concerned with people who won't ever go back. Don't waste your money, there are plenty of other great restaurants in SF.
author: Keeva L.

description:
We often go to Savor and have been going there for years, even though the standard of food and service has deteriorated progressively, but go there due to the vegan option for my daughter. Yesterday was the cherry on top, and we may not be going there any more. 

We were greeted by an extremely snooty Caucasian hostess. She had short brown hair with short bangs. Because it was cold and rainy my husband, who is Filipino, asked if we could be seated as close as possible to the fireplace, the hostess rolled her eyes at him and told us only parties of more than 3 could be seated in the back(something we had never heard before) and seated us in the front. We then waited for ever. No one brought us water or checked in to take our order for drinks or food, Eventually after about 15 minutes we left. It was an unpleasant experience and something one should not have to endure when paying for a meal.
author: Cos S.

description:
Terrible pasta.  Applebee's is better.  Over cooked penne, flavorless sauce, dried out garlic bread.  I won't go back for dinner.  
Nice patio and atmosphere, and attentive friendly service.
Breakfast was good when I last went a few years back.
author: Jamey F.

description: Our friend recommended this place as we are here on vacation and I know SF is known for the food but that might have been the best breakfast I've ever eaten! Had the 'Del Rio' with a side of spicy cornbread and wow. Put the maple syrup on and then the gravy and even though it seems like a strange combo with chicken it couldn't have been more delicious. Well done Savor!
author: Cole S.

description:
Savor is a very popular place for good reason.  They give out big portions of food.  The food is warm and it's just plain good.  They have very yummy omelets that are hearty and filling.

There is a really nice patio area in the back when there is a nice day out in San Francisco.  Most of it is covered so I think they still use a portion of it when it rains.  The patio is dog-friendly so it's definitely a neighborhood joint that involves all the family, even those on four legs.
author: John H.

description: Awesome place to eat brunch and it's good. The prices are a bit high but completely worth it. Loved their french toast and sandwiches are delicious.
author: Brenda M.

description:
Oh wow I didn't realize I haven't written a review for here yet!


I freaking love savor!


I think that I come here pretty frequently. Everything on their menu is delicious-- just close your eyes and drop your finger on something and you'll probably enjoy it ((unless you have food allergies and order something that doesn't go well..)) but aside from that.. It's great.


The staff here are all very pleasant. They're patient with the day after drinking people and they let me come in and sit around while I wait for my friends to show up because I'm  always early.
author: Neek W.

description: Won't be back.  Went to dinner there with 3 friends.  One of us ordered a savory crepe minus the cheese.  It arrived with cheese. Sent it back and we all waited 10 minutes with our own hot food at the table for the replacement crepe.  Replacement crepe arrived, again made with cheese!  WTF?  Waited another 10 minutes for another crepe. Third time they got it right but by then we were annoyed and dinner was cold and uncomfortable.  Got a meager apology from the waiter.  Should have asked for a refund and walked out.
author: Bob H.

description: The food is still as good as it always was but Savor has gone downhill since they switched to an 'order at the register' format. I've tried it a few times since (as the place was an old favorite) but it has zero ambiance now. In fact, less than, with a noise level that is unpleasant: employees banging chairs, dumping ice into sinks, crashing dishes. It felt like we were eating in a factory. Strictly a place to eat.
author: Max T.

description: New format is very challenging.  The register doesn't actually align with the menu, they spend 2 minutes searching for the item, only to have to do a write in. Which subsequently gets messed up.  Last night saw three mistakes - wrong drink, wrong food, no silverware.  In fact no table around us was provided with silverware, unless they asked after their food was brought.  Food used to be pretty good, and still has some merit.  But the strawberries inside the crepe still had the leaves on them, and the chicken on the salad was horribly overlooked and dry.  Used to love you, Savor, but sadly we just can do it again.
author: Mac N.

description:
Meh, I don't think I'm a serious fan of Savor.  But I'm only basing this on one meal.  If I end up going back here, perhaps my mind can be swayed?  I had the french toast meal for breakfast.  I think it was just okay.  Nothing super amazing about it, like some other places I've been too.  You get 3 slices of french toast sliced, and 1/4 cup of fresh fruit.  My friend let me bum some of his potatoes and those I'd have to say were really good!

There is indoor and outdoor seating.  The outdoor patio is heated.
author: Michelle M.

description: ...8:30 a.m....sidewalk was being hosed down...asked if it was open...place looked empty...not very inviting...walked down street to Toast which was excellent and full of people having breakfast...
author: jim b.

description: Called and placed a take-out order, pasta and a Cesar salad. Was quoted 10-15 minute prep time. Nothing worse than waiting passed the quoted time and watching the hot food (pasta) get cold on the counter while they make the cold food (salad). Food prep order didn't make sense. Was very annoyed seeing the food get cold.
author: Charlie A.

description:
This place was great, even though they made fun of me for being a Packer fan. We had a larger group of people, I believe 6 or 7 of us, but they were very accommodating and helpful and sat us outside.

I personally got one of the omeletes (can't remember which one, I think it was the one with the sausage) and a friend of mine got the pankcakes which looked delicious and gigantic. Some other friends got the standard american breakfast, but everything was delicious and timely. We were all very hungry after having to wait a bit for a table outside, so the service was very fast and very good and the food was great.
author: Anshel S.

description: Very nice atmosphere and fun decor set the mood for a pleasant and calm brunch. All of us enjoyed our dishes, and I especially liked the sweet corn muffin I got on the side. Every dish was HUGE and we all had leftovers. The service was quick and polite.
author: Molly N.

description: Service is absolutely dismal. Which also describes the food.  Lovely outdoor dining room filled with unruly Noe Valley children.
author: EC N.

description:
Savor is easily one of my favorite brunch spots in San Francisco. Everything I've eaten here is excellent, and the service is always attentive and efficient. There's also a lovely outdoor patio area, which is perfect for soaking up Noe Valley's blissfully warm sunshine while shoveling a big-ass Mazatlan crepe in your face.

This city is teeming with amazing brunch spots, but one thing that keeps me coming back to Savor is that there's never more than a 10 minute wait to be seated. I mean, I love brunch food as much as the next SF-er, but I think it's insane to stand around for 45+ minutes for eggs. Savor always does the trick, and I never have to stand in a Coachella-sized line for it.
author: Sabrina V.

description: Hubbie and I went for lunch recently and the food was such a disappointment. The wait staff was nice and friendly though, and we ate out back in the patio area, a nice ambiance. I would not come back based on the poor quality of the food - there are so many other local lunch places that are better. We were fans for years. Feeling sad that this place is now ruined.
author: Em S.

description: Recently I got two crepes for take out, besides for being very pricey for a crepe  $36 for two, both were extremely salty, mushy and not very edible. There are too many good restaurants to put up with less then mediocre food. I would not try their food again
author: Cary F.

description: Unimaginative, bland, sloppy "food". You would do marginally better in an Applebee's or Olive Garden.
author: Inigo M.

description: Delicious!!! I always order the Tuscan crepe.  I have also had the salmon sandwich that was also great. The mimosas are wonderful too.
author: Celina A.

description: I am not a big fan of crepes. But this place is different :) awesome yummy crepes. I had the veggie one with tofu and it was soo good. If you are in noe valley and in a mod for crepes, this is the best place.
author: Nitu S.

description: My daughter had a crepe with bananas and strawberries. She thought it was wonderful!!!
author: Katherine D.

description:
I'm a sucker for cute brunch places.
This is a cute brunch place.
An overloaded and aesthetically pleasing plate of brunch food is something that I swoon over. I swooned for this place.

Sat in the outside backyard patio thing and it was so Noe Valley and picturesque.

Ordered the Costa Del Sol (aka Eggs Benedict) -- loved it.
Brunch date ordered the El Paso (aka Corned Beef Hash) -- loved it.

Will I be back? Yes.
Should you try this place? Yes.
author: Riana C.

description:
This place seems well intentioned, but was slightly benign during brunch this past Sunday. Upon our arrival, we were initially told that it would be a 15-20 minute wait for a table of 2 to become available.  So as I put our names down, I look around a bit and can clearly see that about 80% of the restaurant has open seats available.. hmm really?!, so I am thinking at this point that they are probably just a bit understaffed this morning which accounts for the exaggerated wait times.

A few others are slowly and steadily trickling in.. and somewhere in the transition they started seated about 3 other parties before we are attended to. Upon our inquiry, the host was completely rude and unapologetic in his forray, claiming that our names were called and that there isn't much he can do besides putting our names down again.. but he wasn't even accommodating enough to have slipped us in before the later guests who have just arrived. 

IT WAS COMPLETE ATTITUDE,   
and a bit of an irritation, but we were seated about 15 minutes later than we should have.  So, this left somewhat of a sour tinge in my mouth.. but at least the food was descent.

We each othered 1 dish to go halfies on, and then switched:

-Blackstone Eggs Benedict with crab was good, I liked that I was given a choice of doneness to how I wanted my eggs poached.  I opted for runny, and it was impeccibly so.. complimented nicely by the nice crisp potatoes.
 
-I had a bellini to sip on throughout my meal, but you could tell it was very low grade prosecco which usually would be fine if it were mixed with fresh fruit/puree.  But it just tasted like a cheap quick syrup.

-The Chicken Club sancwich was simple, but tasted really comforting.  Especially with the thick and crispy fries on the side.  The aioli tasted a bit more like a slightly dilluted mayonaisse.  

I would honestly give this place another shot, but it was really discouraging to have had such rude service.
author: Ty T.

description: What Happened??? We showed up to Savor for dinner last night expecting their usual friendly table service, and we were greeted by instructions to "order at the counter and take a number to your table". (????) We went to Barney's . . . at least they wait on you. Is this a lesson on "How to Murder a Successful Business without Really Trying?"
author: Stephen J.

description:
Okay, so I keep coming back. This place is awesome on the portions for the price. The service is always great. I was ogling the food as it was coming out of the kitchen and our waiter was nice enough to explain which dish it was.

I went brunching with the *crush* and he liked this place as much as I do. He had the Club Sandwich and I had the spicy scramble, both meals were big enough to have leftovers for later. Which was great then too. :)
author: Rebekah T.

description:
They have a working fireplace. Everybody's genuinely friendly all the time.

It's nearly impossible to choose a poor time to go, sit at an unsatisfactory table, pick an unSAVORy item from the menu or get an unpleasant server.

If you have a restaurant-retard you need to accommodate, this is your place. Hands down. There's literally something for every perspicacious palate, no matter how particular. Even my mother liked it and she's like Mikey...from Life Cereal...I'm showing my age. Anyway, if you don't remember..."HE HATES EVERYTHING!"

In a word, this place is great.

I've actually eaten here more than once per day on more than one occasion. 
Don't judge.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Of the many choices for Brunch while visiting my friend in SF. Savor ended up begin the pick of the bunch. The friendly staff and minimal wait probably was the deciding factor but sometimes there's a reason to waiting. 

We were seated in the quaint covered garden patio in the back. The one thing I noticed in SF is the slowness of the servers. Maybe I'm use to the over hyper hustle and bustle of NYC life where service is if not sometimes a bit too quick. I find it the opposite here. I guess sometimes it is good to slow down but not when you are starving and dying for a bloody Mary's and surrounded by baby carriage city. 

I followed with my usual brunch selection of Egg Benedict and my friend an omelet.  Overall, I thought the food quality here is alright. Nothing too fancy, a little under seasoned and a nice plate of microwave bacon side always compliment a meal.
author: David N.

description: Popped in today at 11 am and was able to get a chicken sandwich for myself and omlette for my missus. Sandwich was called the Sonoma came with  fries and was more of a chicken burger. What's more it was pretty darn big and well garnished and certainly felt  worth the $14 price. The waiter was super antentive with the drink refills and the atmosphere and decor were most pleasant with high ceilings and a  fire place. Am not an omlette person so couldn't vouch for its quality but my other half said it was all good too. Would recommend.
author: Robert H.

description:
HUGE portions so you're definitely getting your money's worth. for all the vegetarians out there, you can substitute soyrizo (soy chorizo) as your meat in any of the scrambles or omelettes. i definitely recommend the milano savory crepe. the crepe itself is really thin and nice and crisp on the edges. inside there's all sorts of roasted/grilled veggies like red peppers and eggplants. it's finished off with cottage cheese, marina sauce and grated parmesan.

belgian waffles are also really good - they're very generous with the fruit (blueberries, strawberries, and banana).

service is super friendly and it's reasonably paced considering how busy this place is. the only complaint i have is that the coffee isn't exactly HOT...it's only warm, so after adding a little milk my cup was pretty lukewarm.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Came here on Sunday night of Memorial Day weekend on the advice of some random lady on the street, since I am a man of the people after all. I am pretty sure it was Monday night by the time I got done going through their entire menu, it's bigger than the one that Babu Bhatt had in his Dream Cafe.

Lots and lots of good choices here, from the chicken and waffles to some crazy crepe and omelette contraptions. Service was excellent as well. Moral of the story: Listen to random ladies you come across on 24th St. They know their shit.
author: Ian L.

description:
This place is hands down one of my favorite brunch places in San Francisco! 
Food is great, consistent, huge portions and reasonable pricing! Being a vegetarian, it makes me happy to see so many options on the menu! The staff is super friendly and on top of their game, always making sure you are taken care of!
author: Juliana B.

description: I had the new Orleans eggs benedict.  I always get eggs benedict when ever a restaurant has it in the menu. So far this place is one of my top places. I also like that they ask you how you want your eggs and what toast to use on your benedict. Mmmmmm
author: Urban Mammal B.

description: I've been to Savor many of times but this time was different. I went with my friend Thursday night (2/11) and though everything was the same...the thing or should I say person that made this a difference experience was our server. She was amazing, checked on us at the appropriate times, very inviting, and had great knowledge of the menu. Normally I would say Savor is a 3-1/2 or 4 but she definitely changed my mind. I will be going there more frequently...as long as she's serving! SAVOR SHE DESERVES SOME SERIOUS PROPS!!
author: Allie F.

description: What a great place to eat!  I was able to get an egg scramble as a crepe and exchange the potatoes/toast for a salad.  Others in our party got pancakes and omelets.  Everything was delivered yummy, but one order was made incorrectly and had to be remade.  We would absolutely come here again.
author: Denise B.

description:
Great Burger! I am definitely going back for another one. 8 oz!
I've had the lamb shank there as well. Nice to know there is a local, reasonably priced restaurant option on 24th Street with such a varied menu. Love it!
author: Joanne F.

description: I don't know what the hell you are all talking  about that this corn bread is the beez knees because it's  not. Stop being white.  It's just some pretty dry wall designed to look like toast labeled cornbread  I went to home town and they had some  real corn bread.  Peace.
author: Philippe D.

description:
Service was good, the waiter's super friendly and courteous. I came here for my friend's birthday. Thank goodness we got seats outside in the back, because it has a better atmosphere than inside in the restaurant. The inside of the restaurant was really dark, and I think it would be better if it has some lighting.

As for food, I ordered a tofu egg scramble. It was a bit plain, but I guess that's what I should expect of veggie entrees. The molten lava chocolate cake my friend got was good though. :)
author: Danny Y.

description:
What to expect:  
Good food, ample patio seating, a good humm or buzz of conversation, slightly sassy (and/or definitely friendly) service

What to have:  
Crabcake benedict - it's good.  Really good.  You can ask for greens instead of homefries, which makes the hollandaise more palatable somehow.
Cornbread with jalapeno jelly.  A friend of mine SWEARS by this, and it is pretty darn tasty.
San Francisco crepe - the dill havarti just MAKES it.

What you'll pay:
Something ridiculously reasonable for the amount of food you get
author: Evan G.

description:
LADIES AND GENTLEMEN!  

STEP RIGHT THIS WAY TO SEE THE WORLD'S LARGEST OMELET!!  ALL FOR THE LOW, LOW PRICE OF $12!!!!

Seriously, that was like a ten egg omelet.  If you insist on telling me it was three eggs, then fine, I'll believe you.... three ostrich eggs, maybe.

I got the vegetarian Arizona, with soyrizo and it was delish.  Spicy and tasty.  The potatoes are great too, with a decent amount of crunch. He got the french toast and it was great too.  

The nice part was the back patio, which is covered and heated.  We were there early enough that we could bring his dog, everyone was chill, kids running around on their sugar highs but not bugging anyone.  Great weekend morning starter!
author: Monica R.

description:
I ordered the San Benito Omelet. 
Overall, the dish was good, but i really liked the home potatoes. I've never had them with rosemary before. That made all the difference. I do not think I will ever eat those potatoes any other way. The omelet itself was pleasing. While all the ingredients blended very well together, the mushrooms and kale really stood out. I never would have guessed since it's in a dish with meat. 

The mimosa on the other hand, did not taste like what I was expecting. I'm used to drinking it with the good ole' Minute Maid, but this was freshly squeezed. It was probably just the the oranges they used but I was not to fond of it. It was drinkable, but just not preferable.  Oh wells, next time.
author: Lorth K.

description:
YUM YUM YUM YUM

Amazing staff- go in the AM when Dave or AD are working they are AWESOME!

Also try the back garden it is one of the most quaint and lovely spots to have brekky in all of middle SF.

I have munched scrumptiously there for years and years. Never fails to be delish!
author: Foggy Daze D.

description:
Just starting to explore Noe Valley, and had brunch here this morning. The wait was only 15 minutes (shocking for a popular place on a Sunday morning), and we were seating on the backyard patio in a great location. Who knew that it would be such a large space?? The service was great from start to finish, too.

As far as the food: I had a bellini (fabulous) and a combination of the Sante Fe and Mazatlan Savory Crepes. It was insanely delicious. Perfectly seasoned, perfect portions.  But the best part of the entire experience was the sweet Jamaican crepe. It was seriously better than sex. I needed a moment to myself after I finished it.

I will definitely be back. And soon.
author: Candice P.

description: Returned to Savor with my parents who were visiting from England as it was their last day of their vacation so we were having a farewell lunch. I had previously messaged Savor on Yelp to see if dogs were allowed in their outdoor area (I used to eat there regularly but it was the first time with my puppies) and they said yes so when I arrived went round to the outdoor area knowing that dogs would not be allowed in the restaurant. The place was empty with plenty of seating. We were met by  the waiter who spoke to me like a piece of  because we hadn't checked in with the host. I just don't understand why an empty restaurant would greet someone so rude. Yes they may have rules but if a customer doesn't know them because there is not a big sign then don't greet them with attitude. Simply seat them and politely mention you're supposed to normally check with the host but since we're empty I'm sure it's not the end of the world. It's safe to say we walked out and went for our lunch at Novy and won't be returning or recommending again!
author: Kelly M.

description:
UNDER DISHONORABLE NEW MANAGEMENT....

Today I went for Sunday brunch and was thoroughly appalled and embarrassed by the new management who has taken over.  I had a completely legitimate gift certificate that clearly states it is for Savor Restaurant at 3913 24th Street, with a signature authenticating the document.  The gift certificate was from a few years ago, but it clearly stated there is No Expiration.   

Upon our arrival we wait 15 minutes at the host stand while there were clearly 3 tables open and available.  I was growing suspicious of these new faces that were at the front of the restaurant, I got the sense that they were not as welcoming, polished, nor professional as the people who used to work there.

After 15 minutes, we were seated at one of the tables that had been open the entire time we were waiting there!!  

Due to the unprofessional start, I decided to check with our waitress to make sure they would accept the gift certificate.  She comes back and says her manager says they will not honor it!  I ask to speak to this manager...He was a schmoozing dishonorable jerk, who said that they would not honor the gift certificate because it was too old and they had a new owner and new manager.  I showed him that the certificate clearly stated there was no expiration and it was indeed for this business.  He was an idiot.

Any business with an ounce of restaurant professionalism and any interest in customer service would have honored the certificate.  It is also CA state law.  It was not worth it to argue and endure further embarrassment for sub-par service and food, so of course we just left.

I have eaten here many times, and can tell anyone:  the service now SUCKS and honestly, the food really isn't all that great.  I was throwing them a bone by returning.  Oh well, no longer.
author: Amanda L.

description:
I have a confession to make.  I'm not exactly the biggest fan of crepes.  I have enjoyed them in the past, and I do love the Crepes A Go Go truck on 11th... but I'm usually drunk when I'm having them.  So when my family and I had brunch at Savor recently, I opted for the burger.  

I ordered the El Dorado burger (listed under sandwiches in their menu), and added bacon and blue cheese -- my go to burger.   It came with a little mixed green salad and battered fries.  The fries were spectacular, and I finished them all before I even got to my burger.  The burger was for lack of a better word, ginormous.  At a half pound patty (cooked medium rare, and was really tasty), I only had a quarter of it, before I had the rest packed up to go.  

We also initially started with their cornbread with jalapeno jelly which was spectacular.  I've had many a piece of cornbread, and this was definitely in the top 5.  My brother and mom seemed to enjoy their crepes, and I had a bite of each (The Tuscany and Philly Cheesesteak).  As tasty as they were, I would still choose my burger over them.

Service was friendly and attentive.  Unfortunately the coffee that I had tasted as if it had been sitting in the pot for way too long.  We were seated in their patio area on a rare perfect weather day in SF, and it was nice and peaceful.  Would definitely make another trip to Savor the next time I'm in SF.
author: mariel v.

description: Came here on Sunday morning. Smelled great! Over a dozen people waiting to get seated, empty restaurant. After 15 minutes of waiting to get any attention, we left.
author: Vladimir G.

description:
We've been back multiple times since my first review for Savor and I absoutely just love this place.  Since my first review, we've been back for dinner a few times and I just love their dinner menu as well.  I highly just recommend the lamb!

We'll be back for more Savor!
author: Shana W.

description:
Not very good. Overly expansive menu. Soup tasted off and crepe was very soggy.

Wouldn't recommend it
author: Zach K.

description:
Been coming here probably for 18 or more years now and the food is still great. The Milano crepe is delicious..the pancakes and Greek omelette is good and pretty much anything in between. 

Noe Valley gem!

And the staff is so kind and welcoming!
author: Yas G.

description:
At one time this place was great. It would have a line out the door always. I went here last weekend 4/18 no line out the door, hmmmm.
Should of been the first clue. 

Came in and there were plenty of empty tables but the hostess took our name and made us stand there for ten minutes. 
That was strange. 

Server came over and took our order and seemed a bit off like she just popped some downers. Again that was strange.

Drinks came about 15 minutes after giving our order, lame. And note the place was not that busy. 

While waiting one of the cooks was cursing in Spanish. Not cool. 

Some of the food came but not all that we ordered. I hate that because I wait to eat until all in the party has their food. 

When it all finally showed up my meal was cold and the bacon was so over cooked it literally exploded when I took a bite. Pieces of the bacon went flying all over the place. I didn't order bacon bits I ordered bacon. 

While we were eating are less than desirable meal the hostess kept staring at us because she knew the food was less then perfect and that's putting it lightly. 

There was some kind of irritation between the hostess and a manager ( I'm assuming she was a manager ) and that made for an awkward vibe. 

We won't be going back. 
Sorry your loss.

On a brighter note. The big guy that works there and has been there for a few years is a very nice gentlemen. He's the only positive to the place. 
I give him 5 stars.
author: Tom B.

description: This place is amazing! Every time im in Sf I try to make it here for brunch. The portions are huge and the mimosas are great! Love the omelets!
author: Bri M.

description: this place is amazing!!!!!!! I would literally go here every morning if I could, the food is so good and the staff has made the experience that much better.  it's a little pricey but the amount of food you get makes it perfect since you will more than likely take home the rest for a second meal.  they also have 20$ pitchers of mimosa and the outdoor patio is so cute, I will continue to go here every Sunday for brunch!
author: B G.

description: Amazingly diverse menu. Great service and a sunny outdoor patio with a great vibe. Definitely worth the visit
author: Yasin S.

description:
Enjoying a lazy lunch on their outdoor back patio on a sunny day is really nice if you don't mind the not-so-awesome food. The quality was not that great and portions weren't big either.

The Hanger steak salad that I ordered off the Specials Menu (I always get tricked into ordering things off Specials Menus even though I know it's usually food that restaurants are trying to get rid of)...was soo nothing special - it was just a small bowl of chopped Romaine lettuce, a few soft kernels of corn and strips of red onion, and five strips of Hanger steak (though I have to say that the steak was juicy and flavorful). This salad reminded me even more of why I hate ordering salads at restaurants! My bad.

My friend's Corned Beef and Eggs was decent, there wasn't much corned beef though. The few fried potato pieces were a bit hard. The bagel it comes with is the kind I like though...small, dense, and chewy.

Our server was really friendly and provided great service, and he refilled my friend's coffee and our water like 5 times. 

I conclude that the food here falls below my future-housewife-cooking-skills status, and I probably wouldn't come back here unless it was to try one of their sweet crepes.
author: Jessica C.

description: Yummy breakfast for sure! Big portions and reasonable prices. My only random grievance is too much rosemary in the hash browns.....
author: Karen L.

description: Food was good, serving size was really huge (bang for buck), atmosphere was nice, but the patio was a little unclean. Servers were friendly.
author: Drini C.

description:
Ambiance:  This place is a good, comfortable place for a weekday or weekend brunch or lunch.  Even though it is nestled on the main strip of Noe Valley's most popular street, we didn't know it was there.  As such, we weren't looking for it when we found it.  We were pleasantly surprised.  We popped in for a quick lunch and ended up being seated outside on the back patio.  It was busy!  There were a bunch of different parties back there (families, couples, people on their lunch breaks, and of course -- us, two law students with time to kill).  It was as basic as any American-esque restaurant might be, with plenty of room, clean tables, and comfortable surroundings.  

Service:  The guy that helped us was pretty knowledgable; he was nice, joked innocently with us and made recommendations from the menu.  I don't remember him exactly or the quality of his service beyond that -- but I do remember that the experience wasn't a bad one, so he folds into the mix as being part of the pleasant experience.

Food:  It was good.  I had one of their sandwiches paired with fries and was pretty much a happy camper. Still, like Maya S., it didn't make me salivate.  Nor was it incredible.  It was a good deal better than something that was horrible, meaning that it was actually quite good, but with every new place I'm hoping for something that stands out as unique.  I didn't really get that from this place.  I'd go back, and for a quick tip to others I wouldn't hesitate to suggest it for a good place to go on a whim, but I wonder if there's anyone on the menu that is unique enough to draw in a repeat business clientele?  Let me know Savor.

3 out of 5.
author: Bryan H.

description: This place was very delicious. I have been twice and never have had to wait long in a big or small group. All my friends and I went for brunch on a Saturday, the mimosas weren't the best deals I have seen.  The food was really delicious. I always get their savory crepes and I never regret it. I am not a meat lover so I usually get it on the side and give it to a hungry friend (since it would be the same price without).  Yummy place!!
author: Kathleen D.

description:
Awesome Breakfast/ Brunch place! All there breakfast dishes are really yummy and large. Go hungry or else your'll never finish it. :)

Has all the basic breakfast your would expect, but also have some unique dishes with cool ingredients. The ambiance is great, people are super friendly, awesome service. Also great outdoor patio, pet friendly.

The only downside is it's too popular, on weekends there might a long wait, but I think it's totally worth it.
author: Anna W.

description: Went there this morning!! Everything was great! We got the la Bella French toast and the Baja scramble spicy to share!! Huge portions everything was delicious and they're dog friendly which is something we look for when we go out. Atmosphere inside and out is nice!! Wish I lived closer I would visit savor all the time!!
author: Jenise K.

description:
I love the cute patio at this place, great for brunch on any warm day. The staff is nice and efficient, and the portions are solid. My salmon Benedict was just a little less flavorful that I would've liked though. 

Noe Valley is a little bit out of the way for me, otherwise I'd be back.
author: Rowena L.

description:
Delicious!

FOOD:
New Orleans: Crab cake eggs benedict was perfect!! The sauce was delicious and the potatoes on the side were perfect- not dry and hard. 

Pumpkin spice pancakes: (short stack version): thick pancakes with mild pumpkin spice flavor- I loved that it wasn't sweet and was subtle so even though I'm not a big pumpkin fan, i LOVED it. The whipped cream that came with it was super fluffy and light- perfect!!

Mimosa made me think that I was getting my dose of vitamin C since it tasted legit- no juice from a can crap :)

highly recommended!!
author: Emily C.

description:
Came on a Sunday at about noon. The hostess quoted a ten minute wait for two people, but we got a table in about 7- not bad for a Sunday at brunch hour! All the employees were super friendly and the place was adorable (although a bit hot inside due to the oven). We sat on the back patio, which had a cute ambiance, and the place was packed. We had looked at the menu while we were waiting so ordered right away, and the food came really fast! Probably within ten minutes.

The fries were the best I've had in a really long time. I got the Noe Valley sandwhich (Grilled chicken breast with Brie , apples, arugula & sundried tomato aioli on a Dutch crunch roll) and my friend got the North Beach (Grilled eggplant, roasted peppers, tomatoes, pesto & provolone cheese on focaccia). Absolutely delicious! Neither of us had any complaints. The couple next to us got the Rio Grande Scramble (Grilled chicken breast with mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, spinach & goat cheese)... which we were googly-eyed over. Definitely ordering that next time.

Overall an awesome experience!
author: Christie B.

description: There is everything to love about the food here. Great omelettes, delicious sandwiches, perfect beer battered fries, and great choice in root beer!  Simply fantastic.  They're pretty smart about their ingredients. Meals will either be wonderfully subtle with all the ingredients blending smoothly or they'll pack a stiff punch that will widen the eyeballs.
author: Nick J.

description:
Brunch after a mud run is no joke.  I and 11 other ladies came in ready to EAT.  

Corned beef hash with scrambled eggs, the best Irish coffee ever.  The rest is a blur.  

Really, I'd come back for the cocktails as much as the brunch.
author: M. H.

description: Every crepe is amazing. Between my fiancee and I, we've tried them all. My favorite is the Tuscany. Great atmosphere, friendly staff.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Just came here on Saturday with a group of 7. We came in without reservations and the wait was only 20 minutes. We got a nice spot on the back patio. It's covered and has heat lamps, though it was really warm so they didn't need to be on. There were a few dogs there, so dog friendly!

Portion sizes are fairly large. We discussed and next time we would probably share with each other. Everything was quite delicious. I had the spicy crab Benedict, a few other had the french toast- all great! It was a good typical brunch, with pitchers of mimosas. They are a bit heavy on the orange juice. Next time we would probably ask to have a bottle of champagne instead and pour it ourselves. 

It was a very charming space. The back patio was very roomy and charming. I docked it one star due to it not blowing my mind away via atmosphere or food-wise, but overall it was great and we will be be back!
author: Annette D.

description:
Went there for Sunday brunch with some friends and loved it.

No reservations: Considering we were a party of 5, trying to get a table at 11am on a Sunday, our wait was under 15 minutes. Bonus: complimentary coffee while you wait!

Food: Ordered the Big Sur--steak sandwich--which came with fries and a salad. Fantastic that it was served with both. My friends loved their dishes as well.

Service: Our waiter was in top of it from the get go. Our food came promptly and our water glasses were never empty. 

In addition: The place was packed but didn't feel overcrowded. We were seated in the back outdoor patio which was kept warm by the best lamps.

Can't wait to again and continue to explore the menu!
author: Francesca P.

description:
The service was amazing and the food was pretty great. I like that they're open until evening unlike most brunch places. 

I had the mazatlan crepe, and it tasted delicious, but I've just been spoiled by the best of best crepes. so four stars.

Definitely recommend going if you're in the area, looking for some savory crepes and have $15 to spare.
author: Mayank G.

description:
Savor is an awesome brunch place! I've only been here for brunch a few times, so can't speak for their lunch or dinner menus. 

I love the fact that I can come here on a weekend and not have to wait more than 5 minutes before being seated. The outside patio is cute and pretty interesting since it's surrounded by the back doors of other local businesses.

They have a HUGE SELECTION of brunch items (WOOHOO - something for everyone). My friends and I like doing family style at these places, so that we can get a taste of everything. I love their Baja scramble (healthy too!) and their pancakes are delicious! We got the pumpkin pancakes to share and they were huge! Fluffy and comes with whip cream! Their savory crepes are good too (tried the Santa Fe and Tuscany), but I was not a huge fan of their crab benedict. Felt like there was more filler than crab, so wasn't really worth the money. If you need more food, you can always splurge on the cornbread! YUM. Overall, their portions are very generous and who doesn't like leftovers?! 

The prices are very reasonable, ranging between $9-13, but the portions speak for itself. The service is alright. Not the most attentive, but they haven't messed up on our orders and waiting for coffee refills haven't been too terrible, so no biggie. The waiters are nice and probably just too busy, so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. 

Looking forward to coming back to try the other things on the menu!
author: Ellen N.

description: Let me start off by saying the staff is friendly.... when dining in I feel the staff is attentive and warm.  BUT on their take-out orders the staff are in DIRE need of training.... this is the second time my take-out order has been wrong.  The first time I let it go.... but tonight, it was just sad.  I phoned up and spoke to a pleasant voice on the other end of the line...I asked for the Tuscan Chicken Entree, with two sides...and then a "small garden salad" under the salad menu.... I go in and pick up the order...when I got back to the car I noticed one of my sides were missing...go back in, get the missing side.  When I get home I noticed they gave me a crepe, not the entree....and the small "Garden Salad" didn't have the caramelized walnuts as described on the menu.....
author: Blake J.

description:
"Del Rio Fried chicken tenderloin atop a waffle served with country gravy & pure maple syrup"

I went here for brunch the other day. Best chicken & waffles I had in the city. Better than Hard Knox Cafe & better than Gussies (but Gussies does have the best syrup).

 Well seasoned fried chicken strips, fluffy, crisp waffles. Delicious light syrup. Gravy was "savory" and hearty. Also I would have to say I had the best home potatoes I ever had period. 

I already can't wait to go her again.
author: Isiah B.

description: I love the pancakes.  Service is a little weird, the servers often get the orders wrong, but the food is so good its worth it.
author: Jim S.

description:
Savor is my go-to brunch place in San Francisco.  I live in Glen Park, so it is a short drive away - though be aware that parking can be a bit tricky.  

The food and service here are great!  They have indoor and outdoor seating which is nice for colder days when you want to hide from the outdoors and warmer days when you want to enjoy the patio.  One of the major perks of this place is that they wait is generally pretty short.  I've come with parties from 2 people to 8 people and have never had to wait more than 10 or 15 minutes.

I can't comment on the whole menu, but I'm a big fan of their scrambles.  I almost always get the Baja Scramble which is delicious (though not spicy as the menu would suggest :P).  The portions are big and the service speedy.  

On my last trip the waiter accidentally threw away my leftovers (not a big deal, I told him not to worry about it) and he actually had them completely remake my scramble and brought it out with the check!  I was really impressed that they went out of their way for us.

If you are ever in the neighborhood you should definitely check out Savor!
author: Liz H.

description:
Love this place for brunch in Noe Valley... Eggs Benedict or crepes and a mimosa you can't go wrong!  You can also enjoy their back patio on a sunny day or in the evening where the heat lamps are sure to keep you toasty.   

Although this is one of my favorite places for brunch, I decided to stop by for dinner one night and I was greatly satisfied.  The Hanger Steak and Garlic Mashed Potatoes were delicious!  This is definitely a place worth visiting and you can always top your meal off with a delicious mimosa or nice cold beer!  

Try the Tuscany Crepe, Costa Del Sol Benediction, Shanghai Salad, and the Grilled Hanger Steak!
author: ERICA G.

description:
Savor used to be good but the last few times either the service has been very slow or the food delivery has been very slow. In fact we've actually seen the table next to us arrive after we ordered and get their food before we did. The portions are super sized. If you don't want a large portion you will still pay for it. The food is okay, except the soups are super salty.
We've experienced slow service during late lunch time when the place has been busy or not. We tried going once for dinner but we were too hungry to wait for someone to take our order. We would like to see Savor succeed.Maybe better management?
author: Luiz M.

description:
Just had brunch here with the wife and we had a great experience. They have a decent size patio out back which is great. The inside decor is a bit dark and didn't really stand out but the patio was awesome. Wife had a crepe with tofu and veges that had a Thai peanut sauce that was delicious. She opted out of the potatoes and just got salad only. Normally it comes with both potatoes and salad but man it was like she got a full size salad serving. 

I actually got their regular garden salad with chicken which was huge. All their serving sizes seem to be huge. Will definitly go back to try their sandwiches and omelets. Next time I'll try their mimosas and sangria also. Was a bit hungover so could only handle water and coffee.
author: Hyung L.

description: The food was really good although I think that I would prefer a bottomless mimosas on a Sunday! It can get a little bit crowded for brunch so make sure you get there early.
author: Michael Edward J.

description:
If you, like many people in Noe Valley, care about where your food comes from, and in the case of meat in particular, if you have any scruples about how the animals were raised and treated, you probably shouldn't eat at Savor.

Their menu did not specify anything about the source of their meats, so I asked, and I was told that they get their meats from SYSCO.

Does SYSCO sound like a nice family farm where chickens and cows spend their days under clear blue skies?

SYSCO is a massive company that purchases meat from factory farms.

A little bit of internet research backs it up.

Now you know.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I love Savor's space -- it's so relaxing to sit by the fire with a glass of wine on a chilly evening, and it's just as lovely to sit in the outdoor (covered) patio section when it's nice outside. I have never had a bad meal here. The Bangkok salad is my go-to -- it's an enormous, filling mixed greens salad ($13) with crushed peanuts, fresh cilantro and skewers of curry marinated grilled chicken. The lemongrass vinaigrette is the perfect dressing -- it's sweet and adds even more flavor to the mix. 

The staff is friendly and service is always great.
author: Katie M.

description: Been going to Savor for breakfast and lunch for several years. The last few times we went the quality and presentation of food has gone down hill. Omelettes, various eggs dishes lack flavor and any kind of consistency. Service is still excellent. Really hope we hit some off days!
author: Dan S.

description: We typically only go here for brunch when there are waits at the other places nearby. No traditional eggs benedict on the menu. They made me one, but it was of low quality. The fried potatoes were stale if that's possible. It was a disappointing brunch.
author: David H.

description: Nestle in Noe Valley of San Francisco this is one of the best breakfast places. It's small and often gets crowded but it's worth the wait. The french toast and omelettes are to die for. The homemade jellies are awesome. When the weather is nice sit in the courtyard area. Definitely recommend!!
author: Gerald H.

description:
On this night, we decided to treat our family to dinner out at Savor. We have always enjoyed the food and have eaten there for many years.

We arrived around 6:30 pm. Though the place was not crowded, the service was extremely slow. From the time we sat down, we waited over 15 minutes just to have a server approach our table. After we ordered and had waited over 30 minutes for our food to arrive, the server apologized for the delay. She apologized several more times over the next 30 minutes and each time told us it would just be a few more moments and the kitchen was really busy. Everyone who had been seated well after us had been served their food before us.

Finally, more than an hour after ordering, my 6-year old got a plate of chicken nuggets -- they just required re-heating, I'm sure -- but nothing else came. Then after about 15 more minutes, the server brought our food but had the wrong plate for me. Luckily, she only grabbed the wrong plate and the kitchen had actually made my plate. At that point, I don't remember whether we liked the food because we ate it so fast. It was almost a 2 hour experience and one which I don't plan to repeat.

Also, as an apology, the server offered us $5 off our meal. That was frankly an insult and I was quite surprised no one, other than the server, approached us to apologize. I would have expected a manager or supervisor to acknowledge and accept responsibility for either having too little or poorly trained staff.
author: Michael R.

description:
This is a great place for breakfast / brunch! The portions are ginormous. My fave dish so far: Cote d'Azur a.k.a. Smoked Salmon Benedict. As Rach Ray would say, "YUM-O!"

They also have a heated outdoor patio, and a friendly staff. I give Savor 2 thumbs up!
author: Kara L.

description:
I've been to this quite a few times and have never been let down with the food.  Service was pretty slow a couple times but those were at busy key times.

My favorite...
 The Tuscany crepe: sautéed chicken breast, mushrooms, garlic, roasted almonds, feta and provolone with pesto.  Yum.

Order it seriously.  

Prices are pretty good and the portions are HUGE.  Most of their dishes come with potatoes and salad.  

Great casual place for any time of the day - and they have a back patio which is really cute!
author: Juliana K.

description:
I had the Bangkok Salad (Ginger and curry marinated chicken kabobs with mixed greens, red onions, mint, cilantro, roasted peanuts with spicy lemongrass vinaigrette) at 9:30am, yes, 9:30 in the morning and I made an excellent decision.

The mixed greens and all the herbs were extremely fresh and the chicken was marinated perfectly and grilled to perfection, the greens were not overly dressed and the bread that came with the entree was warm and crunchy outside and soft inside.

I also ordered the Spicy Cornbread with Jalapeno Jelly and this was amazing.  The jelly had a hint of sweetness along with a kick of heat from the jalapeno.

Highly recommended place for food, will definately come back again if in the neighborhood.
author: Allen C.

description:
I find myself going to yelp these days for the reviews but haven't felt compelled to write one in a long time. in fact, I prefer to only write about places I love. I'm changing my mind after our meal here the other night. Granted, it was a night before a holiday, but really--if you are going to serve warmed up rubbery house potatoes at least give a heads up or steer us towards the fries. The crepe itself was not the quality I remember from previous visits. The flavors inside were decent but when surrounded by the rubbery potatoes and side salad with a flavorless dressing, I have no reason to come back here. The sangria was basically some old wine with a few pieces of fruit that couldn't mask the poor flavor. 

Nobody else in the family had anything better. I'm being generous with the 2 stars as the server was pleasant and the fries were decent. As far as the crepes--well there is another place less than 10 blocks away turning out consistently good food.

My hope in writing a review like this is that management takes notice and addresses the issues. The last thing I want to see is a business fail. Savor has all the potential to be better (like it used to be) and if it is failing, they only need to look at themselves to correct the problems.
author: Amy O.

description: Food and food selection is great.  Something for everyone.  Covered, outdoor patio seating is really neat. . . although you have to go at the right time, or you'll feel out of place by all the stroller groups or business folks.  Service could be a little quicker: on more than one occasion the waiter/waitress has taken forever to come swing by and even acknowledge they have a table.
author: Karin E.

description:
I'd like to Savor 3.5 stars, but don't have the option.  

Everyone's food, but mine, was just ok.

The staff was great!  They were patient with 4 lame asses in our group that were an hour late.  They didn't give us attitude even though it was a Sat brunch and there were people waiting.  They even teased the ppl that were late, which I thought was funny.  They kept our water glasses/drinks full.  They brought the check quickly.

Maybe my meal would have been better with the dinner menu and different companions.

I'll definitely go back
author: Heather C.

description: Tons of good dishes to choose from here. Came here for brunch on a Saturday at 11am and didn't have to wait to be seated. Nice back patio with heater. Ivwill definitely come back.
author: Kelly F.

description:
The BF and I went there last night hungry...not the normal kind of hungry the starving skipped lunch and grumpy kind. 

I recommended the place based on their savory delights, generous portions and quality. It was the first time I had seen him LOVE the food in a place that didn't cost over $190 for 2 (ahem Bouchon and Foreign Cinema I love you but you are pricey).

I LOVED my Tuscany crepe and it came with a salad (i had them switch with cesar and beer battered french fries instead of home potatoes. The fries were super tasty, not too greasy, fresh, a crisp on the outside that gave way to a soft middle. Perfection.
The Tuscany was HUGE (i couldn't finish it) and I had help (tee hee). Generous and. tasty salad. My OJ is the best restaurant oj i've ever had, wasn't too expensive was delicious (i think fresh pressed) and HUGE. The crepe was generously stuffed with a lovely fusion of flavors (see below) and was on par of the quality of France's dinner crepes but far far more generously stuffed. Maybe even tastier?

Tuscany - $12.50 (Served with home potatoes and mixed greens)
Sautéed chicken breast, mushrooms, tomatoes, garlic, 
roasted almonds, feta and provolone with pesto

The service was friendly and super great. The advice was honest and helpful. The food made my boyfriend smile in a way that I hadn't seen in a long time. When I asked if I could substitute home potatoes for fries and mixed green for caesar salad she was super nice about it (some places aren't). 

Desert:
The sweet crepes are served with chantilly and a very large very tasty scoop of vanilla  ice cream - $6.95. 

I had the Jamaican: Pan fried bananas with a caramel rum sauce and it was lovely, so soothing reminded me of childhood memories of France and my mother's fried bananas.

He had the La Bellav Seasonal berries and Nutella. I don't like Nutella but he LOVED it. 

Bottom line go here for sure, order the crepes dinner and dessert and be happy!
author: Parpar M.

description:
I enjoy visiting Savor for brunch.  The neighborhood parking can be a challenge, and I've usually had to wait.  If you can grab a spot on the patio - do!  It can be noisy inside.  I prefer to enjoy my San Francisco crepe with fresh salmon, red onions, capers, spinach, dijon and dill havarti cheese with a less hectic vibe.  If you're feeling naughty, consider subbing the home potatoes for beer battered fries.  

I think Savor is worth the wait.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
This is one of the best places to get brunch in San Francisco.  They have a beautiful back patio as well that is covered and even has heating lamps!  They also allow dogs in the back.

The food is delicious and the portions are huge.  Some of my favorites are the Cote d'Azur, corn beef hash, pancakes and the omelets.  I've also been here for dinner several times and have had the steak and the risotto, but amazing dishes.  

We also had a party of about 20 people in the back patio on a Saturday evening.  Leo, one of the managers, was absolutely the best in accommodating our needs and wants and gave us a great per person rate.  They also did a great job setting the place up for a nicer, rather than casual, dinner.

Everyone on the waitstaff is extremely friendly and efficient.
author: Aneesh S.

description: The service and meals - especially their specialty sandwiches are excellent. The back patio is wonderful on a nice day, it's covered, yet very nice and has heaters.  The salmon sandwich comes with salad and fries is delicious - and at a reasonable price.  Soooo worth trying!
author: rena b.

description: My mom and I have been here a few times now; the menu is pretty great and very diverse and I usually have problems trying to narrow down the choices. Today I got the Philly crepe and I didn't like it very much - too much cheese - but the service is good and I'll likely be going again soon.
author: Medina C.

description:
I came here with a friend last weekend for brunch and it was only alright. I'm not sure what I was expecting but it left me just indifferent about this place. The wait was about 10 minutes which is nice since other brunch places around the city usually has an hour plus wait time, but I guess that does explain my feelings towards this place.
I got an egg scramble and it was okay. And my friend got the french toast and was not impressed by it. I might come again but go with the lunch instead of breakfast choice. The service was prompt which is always nice.
author: T L.

description:
Read a review from Andy S. and I think his take is pretty spot on. Brunch is standard with omelettes and other egg ingredient dishes. Sat outside, and I highly recommend it if you can. It's nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the kitchen.

I do have to warn you, portions are ginormous. I recommend sharing or prepare yourself with a takeout box.
author: Annie L.

description:
I like Savor when I'm in the mood for an afternoon meal but am not sure if I want lunch or breakfast.  Breakfast is offered all day, and they have a fairly eclectic menu.  I'm more a fan of breakfast than I am of lunch.

Good service.  I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a table, and the food is always solidly satisfying.


Decent pricing and convenient to all the fun in Noe Valley.
author: Margaret I.

description:
This place has become my neighborhood go to spot for a bite.  Friendly, with nice seating both inside  and out.  Good selection of food, with hearty portions.  I have had the order messed up twice, but they fix it so quickly and cheerfully, and once even gave us free drinks because of it.

My favorite is the panko  crusted trout.  Go with the garlic mashed potatoes as a side.  My wife loves the Shanghai chicken salad.

You can't go wrong with his neighborhood gem for a reasonable priced, fast and tasty meal.
author: Gene B.

description:
This is your standard brunch place.  It is heavy on the egg dishes and the drinks are ok.  Nothing to go crazy about, but a fun place in Noe Valley to meet some folks for some mid-day vittles.  

We sat outside which is nice!  The day was beautiful and shielded from the wind, but still had a nice breeze.  I got the chorizo scramble/omelette.  It was good.  Serviced with the typical toast and hasbrowns.  

Nothing really wowed me, but it was standard stuff that I knew would taste good.
author: Andy S.

description:
I didn't get to finish my check in!!
 I said is there any business that doesn't overcharge for basic food!! I mean come on you guys really? if we're going to have a crêpe that just has two things in it, do I HAVE to pay $12.95??
If you're going to overcharge me I want organic eggs & I want organic 90%!! The guy was nice but he's no barista! he made me the worst iced cappuccino I ever had I made him do it two times and finally I just drank it to be polite! I'm finding this problem all over the city (as I am new here !) everything is way too expensive and not worth the price I'm just gonna stay home and cook I think !!
sorry guys I generally don't give heed to reviews or write them but I'm getting really tired of this game : (
SOOO DISSAPOINTED 
PS I was really looking forward to the crepes but unfortunately yelp is very outdated they need to update their prices and I just refuse to pay that much for a basic crêpe!
author: Soph C.

description:
Food was great. They have a large selection, and all items I've tried have been great. Mimosa was great and bubbly, the cappuccino was yummy and frothy just how I like it. 

The only down side is the service. It got really slow in the end. We had to get up and find our server to pay on the way out since he took so long.
author: Arlene R.

description:
Meh... So this is a cute place with nice people but the food seems like diner food. And like everybody here says: the portions are huge and it takes a while for your food to come out. 
To be honest, I don't get the hype. Get me fancy lettuce stuff with Himalayan goat truffles and berries that grow in a special part of main (but only on Thursday's), that would work for this place as then the wait, price and location would make sense to me. Right now I am not luvin' it.
author: Chandra S.

description: I live in Noe Valley and end up going to Savor a lot for their Shanghai salad (no cilantro) because it is so good! They are super friendly and the service is fast. Very affordable for the quality of food and portion size.  My only complaint is that they could serve better bread. On a nice day it is lovely to sit in their back courtyard. Highly recommend!
author: farideh h.

description:
Brunch is the name of the game here. The restaurant has a large inside area and a great patio, so whether it's a cold winter morning or a warm summer afternoon, you can dine appropriately. I usually come around 10:30am for brunch and have never had more than a 5-10 minute wait.

Absolute Favorite Item on the Menu:
+Arizona Omelet filled with soy bean chorizo, avocado, black bean chili, jack and cheddar cheese, and salsa fresca. Served with rosemary potatoes and toast.

I don't usually go for fake meat, but that soy bean chorizo is SO good. My mom and I are both completely addicted to that omelet. 

Another Great Choice:
+ Cote D'azur Benedict - Smoked salmon on english muffin with poached eggs, spinach, and diced red onions, topped with hollandaise. 

Smoked salmon isn't your thing? They have several other benedict options (crab cakes, grilled tomatoes, spinach and onions, and corned beef hash). Oddly, no traditional eggs benedict with ham. I'd choose the Arizona Omelet over the Benedicts any day though.

I've also tried the Haifa French Toast, made with challah and topped with apple pie filling. Challah French Toast is clearly the most superior French Toast in the world, but the chefs needed to be more generous with the apple pie filling.
author: Talia G.

description:
The huge portions don't just apply to the food. The mimosa's are gigantic. At least in my opinion. If you drink two, you might not be walking out of there. My sister and I eat at this place frequently and have always experienced friendly service and great food!
The brunch menu is pretty big and like I said, the portions are huge. There is lots of everything on your plate. 
Love this place because we can always count on consistency! Everything from the pancakes to omelettes to crepes are amazing. And for the price, you really can't beat it!
author: Lisa S.

description: The only good thing about wait her if our meals was my orange juice and my boyfriends fries. That's it. His meat on his sandwhich tasted way off so I smelled it and it s old and spoiled. My egg as were over cooked and the has was too oniony and peppery. The cornbread with jalapeño jelly well it was severed to us black, burnt to the point it was almost inedible it was so hard and the jelly was okay. Needless to say we both got sick layer that day and all we ate was our meals here. Next time we wait the 25 minute wait for places nearby.
author: Jesse D.

description: Still love you as much as the first time I met you! I love coming to Savor for dinner and I aim to sit by the fireplace each time! You cannot go wrong here. Pick anything off the menu and it's delicious. The grilled pork loins with ginger apple chutney and port wine reduction is a dish directly from heaven... not to mention, it comes with luscious mashed potatoes and another side. I usually choose the vegetables which are served al dente and well-seasoned. The portions are generous and you might feel like you just can't squeeze in desset, BUT you have to! Try the crepes. Savor is known for their crepes and you absolutely cannot leave without one.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: This is a low-key, family-friendly restaurant that we go to when we don't really know what we want but just want a break from cooking or eating at home. Almost like a deli, their menu is huge, and everyone can find something that they like. I think their savory crepes are their signature items, and I love them too. My 3-year old loves their pasta with meatballs, turkey crepes, and beer-battered fries (who doesn't). My husband likes their salads in particular. Not to mention, their portions are more than generous.
author: April S.

description:
Food:  Good

Staff: Friendly but forgot another course we ordered. 

Environment: Nice and clean rear patio where dogs on leash are allowed.
author: Jerico P.

description: This is by far one of my favorite brunch spots in the city. The wait never goes over 10 min! That's rare around here. Breakfast comes in nice large portions so you will have some for later. Savor also has the best pancakes around!
author: Robert M.

description: I went to the Savor for the first time for lunch. The staff were friendly and attentive. We sat outside because the weather was beautiful! I ordered the Bodega Bay, which was a tuna melt with beer battered fries and greens.  The fries were light and crispy, the sourdough slices were thick, but the tuna itself was just okay. There were many sandwiches and crepes to choose from, so I definitely plan on coming back
author: Annie M.

description:
It hard to say good things about a garden burger but  they did a  good job .
The fries are outstanding .
author: Eric B.

description:
The place is very nice inside. We were lucky enough that there were seats available at that time. We went there for lunch and I ordered some French Toast. It was incredibly good. I was not able to finish all of it because it was like 7 pieces. I tried some of the other food that other people ordered. The crepes were delicious as well. 

The waiter showed us the outside patio section. Next time, it would be pretty cool to eat outside. It does seem like it gets packed during the mid brunch time. After we finished eating, there was a line that was stretching outside. 

It's definitely a good place to go for brunch in the city. But do be aware of the long lines if you get there past 1030 am.
author: Dave K.

description:
After a long weekend heavy on the food and drinks, we were in need of brunch that'd be a little on the lighter side.  We were able to score a table in the enclosed patio in the back without too much effort.

While some of us were a little more worse for wear than others, we all managed to dig in to our awesome salads at Savor.  Huge portions and tons of ingredients made these plates of green goodness just what we needed to kick off our last day in SF.

Service was a little on the spotty side, especially after our food arrived on our table.  But it's brunch, after all - the laziest meal of the day, so I can forgive a little brunch-rush snafu.
author: Eve C.

description:
Today I went there for our valentine day breakfast with my wife and my two boys. We have eaten here in the past and I remember it as an ok place. We were seated immediately to an outside nice table. Ordered a crepe, chicken nuggets, Greek omelet and corned beef with eggs.
Kids were happy with their order. Corned beef was extremely dry, it looked and tasted like it was made for somebody else 30 minutes ago by mistake and was kept until I ordered the same thing and was served just that. My wife's omelet had pieces of corned beef that she did not make a big deal of it. All the potatoes that accompanied our dishes were burnt so bad, that I could not believe they did not mind serving it. When our server came to check on us, I informed her our dissatisfaction and she sent the manager to our table. He is a nice guy he acknowledged the problem and offered to take off my wife's dish off the bill. I declined and finished our breakfast and left. Total was over $50 which I don't mind spending had it been a decent food.
Service was good, kids' meal was alright, but next time I will check out the other places, before coming back here again.
author: George B.

description: I really liked my Airline Pan Seared Chicken and Cous Cous. The salad dressing was tasty too.
author: Niki A.

description: Absolutely amazing! Crepes are delicious and the patio in the back is heated, outdoor dining year round. I live in the neighborhood and this is by far my favorite  restaurant. Service is a little slow and sometimes flighty, but it's worth it.
author: Sancho T.

description:
Each time I have brunch here it becomes apparent to me that I as I get older I am becoming more and more a brunch fan. However I am noticing that I am more likely to order lunch type things off a menu than breakfast places. 

The last three times I have been to Savor I have had sandwiches and they are fantastic. Served with a heaping pile of french fries and fresh salad too boot. Big portions and fresh quality ingredients it is pushing itself into a place in my heart. 

They have a great patio outback and with propane heaters it is fully functional all year round. I have a new born and we typically go pretty early and had no wait at all. I can imagine that it must get a little busy towards the 10:30am hour. Noe Valley is lucky to have Savor!
author: Ryan B.

description:
I am not willing to pay these prices for bad service in a great city like SF! 

Problem 1: It was a moderately slow Saturday afternoon, and yet it took the waitress 10 minutes to take our drink order. Another 15 minutes later, she returned to take our food order.
Problem 2: The food took at least 20 minutes to come out. At this point, we were starving and cranky.
Problem 3: My roommate was on a non-carb diet and asked for her potatoes to-go, so I could take them home and she didn't have to look at them. Of course, those potatoes ended up on her plate.
Problem 4: My salad was drenched, and I mean drenched in dressing. I only ate the chicken, sadly.
Problem 5: The food was definitely overpriced for what it was.

I wasn't happy at all.
author: Christa K.

description:
I've been here several times. The last time was so bad though, that it negates the decent meals I've had. 

The food is decent, but not at all great. Not the kind of restaurant I'd want to take visitors to in order to show off. The one-person bathroom is sometimes clean, sometimes not, and if the restaurant is crowded, there's a line for the bathroom. 

The last time I went was with two eight-year old girls, who were given kidddie menus. I asked for ice water without lemon, and was given ice water with lemon. One of the girls asked for Swedish pancakes, and held her hands in a circle, to indicate the size of the (small) pancakes she wanted. She was given the adult portion. When I asked a passing waitress if she could get our waitress, she said sure, and I then watched her walk over to a fellow employee and stand there chatting with him. I finally asked another waitress to get our waitress, and when she arrived, I told her the kid had wanted the pancakes on the kiddie menu, is there any way she could exchange them? 

The waitress got VERY defensive, insisting the kid asked for "Swedish pancakes" so that's what she got, and the small pancakes on the kiddie menu are not Swedish. I think the waitress should have clarified if what the kid indicated didn't match what she was saying. I mean, the kid ordered an orange juice too, and was given that in a kiddie cup rather than a glass. So the waitress just picked and chose which items she'd serve off the kiddie menu? Twice I had to urge the waitress to move forward towards resolving the problem by asking, "So can this be solved by getting her an order of kiddie pancakes?" She kept wanting to prove the mistake wasn't her fault. 

Also, I asked for my potatoes and bacon to be extra crispy, and they were practically raw. Over 15 minutes passed without the new pancakes coming out. Finally the waitress came by, asked if the kid had them, and when I said no, she went and got them. 

In the future, we'll just go to Joe's 24th St. Cafe when we want brunch in that neighborhood.

It was a really shitty experience, because of the attitude. Everyone makes mistakes - it's how they're handled that really counts.
author: Green Y.

description:
Got up a little bit early than usual this morning and didn't want to cook breakfast, so decided to go to Savor and thought will be waiting in line bcoz they get busy most of the time, however, went there on a perfect time got seated right away close by the entrance. Nice little nook area!

Got myself the pomegranate margarita which I never had before and was a little bit skeptical whether it's going to taste good or not. Saw our waiter walking closer to give the drink and it was looking good. Now, comes the tasting part........it was yummy! Next time I'll try their other cocktail drinks.

So, while I was sippin' my margarita on the rocks - I came across two different food and was having a hard time picking which one of the two am I going to order. Either the T.J. Fajitas or the Big Sur? Why does everything has to be so difficult? LOL! Anyway, I ordered the Big Sur (sandwich with side of salad and battered fries) because I was really, really hungry. While waiting for the food, comes the crowd - it gotten so many visitors to come and eat and the hostess finally let them wait outside because it was getting too crowded. As the crowd minimized, my Big Sur came and it was off the hook! I love the salad, I asked for extra dressing. The fries was crisp and just right. The sandwich was delish, so I'm rating the food as 4 out 5. Service was okay, in a way since it was getting busier by the minute so I rate that as 3.5 out 5. The pomegranate margarita, super yummy, I'll asks for a bigger glass next time haha. So, overall my experience at Savor this morning was really good and I'll give it a 4.5 out of 5.

The place is simple, yet very homey and inviting. Nice place to eat breakfast and chit-chat for a while. I wouldn't mind coming here again. Oh yeah, I think they've updated their menu.
author: Jackie A.

description:
Directions for eating here:

1. The wait usually sucks....
2. Try to sit next to the fireplace, or outside if it's nice.
3. Order the french toast a.k.a La Suisse. It's delicious!
4. The home fries are delicious!
5. The coffee is alright...
author: Nathan B.

description: Seriously. Best. Lamb. Ever! My whole experience here was off the charts amazing. Server was fantastic, food... Phenomenal. I'm a private chef, and I am typically very picky when it comes to dining out. I can honestly say I enjoyed every bite! Definitely coming back for more.
author: Britt B.

description: Savor is a really popular spot for lunch with a lengthy wait for a table at peak times. I ordered the stereotypical large American portioned pork sandwich with french fries and salad. The sandwich was delicious and I was so full when leaving that my walking pace around Noe Valley significantly slowed after lunch.
author: Matt B.

description:
I have to say the food is delicious...but it comes LATE and  COLD!! They say they have an emergency?? But I do not think so.......Something is definately wrong with
their wait staff. It took over 2 hours for 2 people to get their food..3 appetizes and
1 side!!!@#@&*//...really BAD service.
author: J D.

description:
i'd give it 3.5stars~ 
i'm still not completely dedicated to the taste of the food. But, it is decent, and huge portions. 

their cocktails: skip
Service: polite, and friendly
their menu has  a wide selection of omelets, crepes, stuff. 

def. get the jalepeno jelly.. it's mixed with apricot or some kind of fruit jelly, giving it a good sweet but bit spicy balance. MMM!
author: Miss J.

description: I come here often with family.  This place is a great family, neighborhood restaurant with comfortable seating, great service and nice sized portions.  The food is also pretty delicious. The outdoor seating area is nice when it isn't too cold or windy, and it has plenty of heat lamps. I would highly recommend the lamb shank, which is served in a very delicious brown sauce/broth with a side (great with the mashed potatoes).  Also, the salads are delicious and filling.
author: Ronnie S.

description:
I have come to Savor several times for dinner. I have always ordered from the list of Savory Crepes. My favorite would have to be the San Francisco. My least favorite is the Santa Fe, which was poorly executed in taste, presentation and flavor. What also comes with your savory crepe order are home potatoes (which are more than enough, not a bad thing) and the mixed green salad. 

This place is a cool local spot to frequent at if you live in the neighborhood or worth a try if you have not yet been. Aside from that, there are other establishments in SF where you can get better crepes.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Came here after running the Emerald Across the Bay 12K.  Needless to say, my friend and I were famished.  We were around the Noe Valley area and asked another friend who was meeting us to hold a spot at a nearby place.  Savor was a place we'd heard of but had never gone to. 

Like many SF places on a Sunday early afternoon, Savor was crowded.  There was a line out the door about a dozen long.
