The place can seat about 60 indoors and another 40 or so in backyard covered patio area.  They had a few heatlamps in the back to make it comfortable in the slightly chill after the rain.

Based on Yelp reviews, this place is all about omelettes and crepes.  My friend ordered an SF crepe with salmon and dijon on the side.  She enjoyed it and was only able to finish half.  She happily took the rest home for tomorrow's lunch at work.  I had a Mazatlan crepe (see photo) and added chicken.  It was very good but in retrospect I should have gotten something less familiar, because it seemed like a quesadilla.  This isn't a bad thing, but like I said I should have tried something unfamiliar.  The home fries were good and crispy and not overly seasoned.  The OJ was from Odwalla.

The service was very good considering how busy it was.  I was deliberating between and 3 and 4 but when it boils down to it the place was very good, had good service, had friendly staff, and justified the slightly stiff price (about $10/entree) and the wait outside.
author: Dave K.

description:
Had the crab benedict YUM. Service was great, they refilled my coffee like 3 times with out having to even ask. Food was good and their menu had a good variety, nothing cliche and everything looked tasty and had a unique twist. 

Good breakfast place.
author: Aundria G.

description:
WoW! Did I feel the love this past Sunday! The food was amazingly perfect and the staff were extremely nice! This was my 4th visit and I can't believe I haven't yelped.

I had been looking forward to Sunday brunch after a rough week! Sometimes a girl just needs to be a little high maintenance and our server was so accommodating to my every specific request: Soy Hazelnut Extra Foam Latte, Scrambled Eggs "medium" (whatever that means), and French Toast with Strawberries AND Bananas- yes all for ME!  

The weather was perfect and I could have sat in that outdoor patio all day but we got our (bounty of) food pretty quickly. Only issue was my bananas were missing. I wasn't going to say anything but they asked if everything was ok, and I had to be honest! A minute later the bananas arrived, and two minutes after that the guy that had dropped off our food came back to make sure I had gotten them. But he asked so nicely, as if he was making sure I was taken care of!!! Being the (pmsing) sucker that I am, I stopped eating as he walked away, said aww, put my hand over my heart and nearly shed a tear. I felt the love. 

All of the servers are so nice and genuine. As we were walking out EVERYONE said "bye, have a nice day" to us and for a second I wondered what they were on! :) Savor is super kid friendly, my goddaughter loved her crayons. They even brought her a balloon and walked around her as she decided to explore a little. 

Overall, a great place with delicious food and amazing service!
author: Valerie A.

description:
2 scales

Food - 3.5, delicious (ordered Petaluma club, blueberry muffin, New Orleans)

Service - 0, we were sat and it took 30 minutes for someone to take our drink order and we had to flag them down.(Even though, servers were constantly walking by).   WEIRDEST/SADDEST dining experience ever. 
As a former Server, I was appalled that no one even apologized once we were helped.

Overall - This experience has taught me that service helps cultivate the satisfaction of the meal.  I think it will be a long time until I go back to Savor or recommend it to someone else.
author: Kate S.

description: This seems to be one of those places that tries to impress you with large portions. But if the food is bad, why bother?
author: Leigh A.

description:
Breakfast isn't that hard. This place, years ago, had great service and great breakfast. I went in a couple of weeks ago with a friend and ordered a basic breakfast, Eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast. My friend ordered the waffle.
When our food was delivered, not by our waitress, I could immediately see the soggy steamed potatoes, the overcooked (rendered) bacon, my three eggs and toast.  I looked at my friend and he immediately knew that this was bad. The butter on his waffle was stone cold and hadn't melted, which was suspect. His Waffle was also cold!
I knew at that moment I would not eat nor pay for the bacon or potatoes as that quality of food should not come out of a kitchen for that price. The waitress finally came back around and asked if everything was alright. By that time I was already done with my toast and eggs. I shook my head no and immediately told her that the bacon was overcooked and the potatoes were soggy. She asked if I wanted a replacement and I told her no, that I am done eating and I will not pay for that.  She then tried to shift the blame asking why I didn't tell her when she came to check on us. Interesting because this was her first visit back to the table and when I told her that she denied it.  She told me she will have to talk to the manager. She came back like 10 minutes later and abruptly said you will pay for the eggs and toast.

At that point I was like whatever, and she didn't even address my friend's cold waffle. Breakfast ingredients are *cheap* and easy to prepare properly if you care about your business. You are delivering crap to your patrons and then making them feel bad to complain. That's just not cool in my book.
author: Nick R.

description: This restaurant has delicous food, nice portions yummi latte's. The atmosphere is nice enough for a romantic date out in the patio and nice enough to hang with friends. Good service and good food.
author: Araceli A.

description:
Y'all should the get the specials, "New Orleans"!!

Its like heaven in a plate! 

The service is awesome, food is fast, big and the ambiance is perfect for brunch!

Need I say more?!
author: Cavin T.

description:
Solid breakfasts - favor the Arizona omelet and the New Orleans (crab cake-eggs benedict w/cajun hollandaise sauce).

Generous portions and good house java. Sitting out in the patio w/the heaters is a plus.

Have yet to come in for the salads, sandwiches or crepes, but they look good.
author: Gregg M.

description: Savor has my favorite meal of all time! The panfried trout with beurre blanc sauce is TO DIE FOR. I dream of this meal all the time. It is the only dinner meal I have ever had from savor, and I love it to much to even bother trying other ones. I also have had the tuna melt on the lunch menu and it was the best I have ever had. I go to savor all the time, but I always get the trout. If you like fish TRY IT. The mash potatoes, seasonal veggies, and sweet potato fries are also all stellar. Savor is in a great neighborhood, with a lively and fun environment and there are tons of great bars nearby.
author: Steph J.

description:
Came here for brunch on Sat.

Got: 
TJ Crepe
Crab cake benedict
Baja Scramble
Belgian Waffles

The TJ Crepe was bland to me. I actually enjoyed my friend's Baja scramble much more since the apple chicken sausage had flavor.

The crab cake benedict was not that great. The crab cake was fishy.

The belgian waffles were just ok. Nothing special.

The service and ambiance is great though. They have a big outdoor seating and servers are great and friendly.
author: Mai H.

description: Cute place.. staff friendly... food ok.  Got the greek omelet. . Sir had del rio ( chicken n waffles)  he said he liked the chicken strips but not his waffles.. my omelet was salty given the amount of feta n olives. Dissapointed but that is my fault for hyping this place up too soon..( should have posted a long time ago...Never finished it. ..my bad lol )
author: Gigi C.

description: I love this place for breakfast! Honestly the portions are really big, so I usually share a plate between 2. The pancakes come in a full stack and half stack. Sometimes even a half stack is too big, the good thing is that you can order just one pancake! Love the coffee here too! Always getting refilled before I'm half way done with it. Service is always A+
author: Lissette V.

description:
This is my second time at Savor and the food continues to be very good. I had the fish tacos yesterday and they were very good - grilled, not breaded and fried. The plate was huge and the Caesar salad was amazing, with what appeared to be homemade croutons. (Love that.)

I saw that others had knocked the service, but yesterday, the staff was so friendly and helpful and the service was great. I had arrived ahead of my companion and they made sure that we had a table ready, even though the place was starting to fill up. Drinks were continuosly filled up and our waiter was attentive, but not overbearing.
author: Lisa B.

description: Nice good Friendly service. Did not have to wait long for a party of 6ppl on a Sunday afternoon. Good selection of food...will probably come back again!
author: Thomas C.

description:
I really liked Savor, though I was initially hesitant about coming here because of the less than 4-star review.

We went at around 9:30am on a sunny (but not exactly warm) Saturday morning and had no wait (always a plus!).  We were seated in the lovely, spacious patio area out back.  A huge fan of outdoor seating, I was really excited to have found another cute brunch place for the warmer months!  

We ordered the Arizona omelette with soy rizo (think Southwest flavors) and the challah french toast with apple pie filling to share.

We loved the omelette!  The soyrizo was absolutely delicious and complemented the other flavors quite well.  I would absolutely order it again and recommend it to other soyrizo fiends.

Didn't love the french toast because it was a little egg-y for my taste.  I like more toast and less egg in my french toast.  Also, the apple pie filling tastes kind of like it comes from a can, and since it comes on the side, it is not really integrated well into the dish.  I would have preferred if the french toast was topped with the filling.  Would not get this again.

Next time, we will most likely order the Arizona omelette and a sweet crepe to share (the flavors looks awesome!).  Can't wait!
author: Julie S.

description:
Excellent food and outstanding service for such a roomy place.  I love breakfast and egg dishes, especially in the back seating area.  

I try to introduce people here whenever possible.  Better than the two Toast locations in Noe.
author: Mike H.

description: We went there for lunch today and tried the crab cake eggs benedict and it didn't turn out good at all.  Crab cakes were filled will fillers and instead of poached eggs they gave me fried eggs!!! The potatoes were soggy and bland  I ate my friend's half steak sandwich (because I was so hungry) which was a little better than what I ordered.  Service was spotty as well. I also ordered the Mango Iced tea and one of the servers refilled my drink with regular iced tea when I wasn't looking.  Don't see what the hype was all about.  Did not eat my food and gave away the eggs.  The server saw what was happening and did not offer to replace my dish.   Left the place still hungry.  Restaurant owners take note--will not be coming back and will tell others not to as well.
author: arlene c.

description: Ate in the courtyard in nice weather. Friendly and fast service, interesting menu, and tasty food.
author: Bob P.

description:
The food here is not very good. I agree that the patio is nice, and the service is good. But the dishes I tasted at brunch ranged from fishy to bland to cat-food-esque.

I am also deleting one star out of spite, because my boyfriend raved about his dish, and this makes me doubt all the many compliments he has given my cooking. So points off for damaging my fragile ego.
author: Molly O.

description:
Loved the outdoor seating inside of the restaurant. Food was yummy, server was friendly and prompt (even though it was during busy hour). Menu provides a variety of choices, mainly American style breakfast/ sandwiches.  Perfect place for a weekend brunch, would definitely return. Be patience on finding a parking space.

We ordered a savory crepe and an omelette, huge portions! Missing one star because the potatoes were raw inside and burnt outside.
author: Pauline H.

description:
Great ambiance. I love the SF Nutcrackers display and the open-air patio seating in the back.

However, the service was somewhat poor. 

I waited for more than 20 minutes for seating, and I was not sure why the hostess kept ignoring me, yet helping other parties. I thought, OK, maybe it's because those others are larger parties. But then it just did not make sense after a certain point.

But more than this, what's actually prompting me to write a review is: the poisoning.

The tofu crepe I ate gave me a stomach ache-- possible poisoning. 

I regularly eat tofu and the sauces that were a part of the dish, but by the time I took the BART home, I was in a lot of pain. Even though I drank ginger tea, hot water, and had a dose of Pepto Bismol, I eventually passed out mid-afternoon in fetal position from the pain. 

I was knocked out for a good three hours. Then was groggy and nauseous for another couple hours. Every once in a while, I was still shrinking over in pain. 

Another dose of Pepto Bismol and a lot more hot water later, I was feeling OK enough to eat some food.

Savor, I want to like you... but what was that???

I am a fan of crepes-- savory and sweet... and I used to regularly make crepes years ago, but the Savor experience was one of my worst restaurant experiences.
author: Reese P.

description:
Service: 4.5/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 4/5
Price: $$
Presentation of food: 4/5
Presentation of restaurant: 4/5
Overall: 4/5

Great outdoor seating available for a nice day out. I've been here twice only and we had the same GREAT server both times. Very attentive (not over hovering like some places), some of the breakfast seems a bit over priced, but the sandwiches are great. The beer battered fries are extremely yummy!
author: Eva H.

description:
Perfectly named! Every time I come here I am NOT disappointed.

I first came here probably 7 years ago for a group dinner. The food and service have been consistent ever since: incredibly hearty omelettes & scrambles, salads and plentiful sandwiches and crepes. The ultimate yum is breakfast/brunch (look out, it gets crowded  during weekend brunch times, and rightfully so), but dinners are great too. Very attentive waitstaff, fun outdoor area with heatlamps, and a nice warm ambiance. All centrally located on the nice village-y 24th St in Noe.

Savor the food here.
author: Diane B.

description: So my friend and I met up in Noe Valley and were debated where to eat. We were walking the neighborhood, and I added that I had been to this place before for lunch and it was alright. My friend and I went for brunch, and stayed and ate. We sat in the back patio, order  2 Bellini's , and when they came it was disgusting. What looked like some kind of puree in a tall glass ( not even close to a champagne glass) with a bottle of cheap champagne. My friend and I just drank it but it wasn't very tasty. For brunch she order a crab benedict, which was definitely not fresh... it was more frozen then fresh. I had some griddle thing with a load of cheese on top, it wasn't balanced very well.  We will never be going back there.
author: Nathalee M.

description:
I favor Savor.

Cute rear patio area, very relaxing.

My salmon sandwich was pretty good but my brother's tri-tip sandwich was better. 

If you've never been here and dig on savory crepes, yummy breakfasts, dessert crepes and huge salads, this joint is definitely worth checking out.

I accidentally forgot my credit card there on my way out trying to avoid a parking ticket and also trying to nab the check before my brother did (it was his b-day lunch.  Nobody should pay on their b-day.)  So hasty me signs and rushes out to beat the meter-maid. The owner recognized my last name and tracked me down through my cousin to make sure I got my back.  They rock.
author: Athena S.

description:
Their crepes are soooo goood. This is a really friendly, neighborhood place. Everyone was really friendly. Prices are friendly too. $10.95 for a great plate of food with a well-size crepe. 

Parking would be tough but we walked down.
author: Kim C.

description: I love this place.  It satisfies every itch.   Sandwich, breakfast, sweet, hearty. The fish tacos they make at lunch are wonderful.  It also has a great outdoor patio, where we can sit with our dog.
author: Matt W.

description:
I really like this place, for sweet and savory crepes of various sorts, breakfast-type food, like variation on Eggs Benedict,served any time, and a nice atmosphere.  The prices are also fairly reasonable considering the location and one gets a decent amount of food.  The food range also makes it fairly kid-friendly, at least for our kids, and they have a number of salads as well.   I have not too many things on the menu, but several of the crepes and similar things an everything that we've had is very good. 

The service in my experience is friendly and attentive.  

There is a lot of room inside and a large covered patio area in back.
author: Wulfstan C.

description:
This is our families regular Sunday night dinner spot!  Great food, you can great breakfast all day long (who doesn't like that?!), salads that can feed you for 2 separate meals and great service!!  All of the servers are friendly and the manager, Leo, is great.  We were out of town so we missed one of our regular days and the next time we went he asked where we were....it's nice to know that at a local spot, that sees a lot of people come in and out of their doors, that your valued as a customer. 
Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great meal!!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I forget how great this place is, because it's so hard to get in.  Always full when I'm most likely to go - you know I'm a brunch ho...  That's why it only gets 4 stars.  Still, I love the brunch menu.  It rocks for lunch, and is a mellow place for dinner.  The back patio is a treat on the rare, warm day in SF.  The indoor fireplace adds a nice touch on the many cool evenings.  Plus, I've only received good service here.  

My recommendations:
The La Mancha omelet with chicken apple sausage. 5 stars
All the crepes!  4-5 stars
The New Orleans crab cakes. 4 stars
The Bangkok salad with ginger and curry chicken, mixed greens, cilantro and mint with a light, tangy lemongrass vinaigrette. 5 stars.
The burger is good too. 4 stars.
Good mimosas and a decent wine list. 4 stars.

All that and reasonable prices.  I really would give it 5 stars on the value scale if it weren't for the obscene lines on weekend mornings.  So maybe it's worth it to grab a coffee half-a-block away at Martha's and chill with all the hipsters and strollers while you wait for brunch.  I'm always too damn hungry for that though.  But on a leisurely mid-week day off, it's a great place for a relaxed lunch!
author: Ted R.

description:
You know what's funny, everyone raves about their breakfast, brunch, and lunch at Savor because of the Crepes, Salads, and Sandwiches.  Yes, they do have pretty darn good Crepes, but honestly, I love having Dinner at Savor!

Dinner at Savor in Noe Valley is quiet, romantic, and tasty! It is actually a pretty good place to go for a date night as the service is attentive but yet they don't rush through dinner or courses.  Depending on the weather you can sit outside or inside next to the fire place.

Their dinner menu consists of a variety of choices, whether your craving chicken, fish, pork, or steak, you will find an option here. They have a decent affordable wine selection if you want a glass of wine with dinner. 

I have always enjoyed the steak at Savor, it is always cooked perfectly, with an amazing sauce drizzled over it, it is a melt in your mouth kind of steak, that will always cure any hunger.

We always look forward to going to Savor for Any Occasion or No Occasion at all.
author: Sandra L.

description:
THE SPOT!

I think there's like 5 places in SF that have outdoor seating. This is one of them. Located in sunny Noe valley, this place serves up a killer brunch.

I hope my girlfriend doesn't read this because she'll probably want me to take her here. 

I found my eggs benedict tasty and not too expensive (for SF). 

The service was also excellent even though they were crazy busy.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Friendly service, cute indoor and outdoor heated patio option. All breakfast and lunch dishes are very good. Favorite sandwiches: Pulled pork (Carolina) and the Chicken Pesto (Sonoma).

I've never had to wait more than five minutes for a table. 

Great booze filled brunch drinks.

The only downer is being surrounded by crying and screaming kids...but that's Noe...not the restaurant's fault.
author: Vicki L.

description: Back patio, friendly service, beer battered wide fries with a wide variety of interesting sandwiches, salads, crepes and soup. I'll be back!
author: Heather M.

description: I loved coming here, but I came in today for a delightful breakfast with my family and that delightful breakfast went south... real fast. We had an extremely rude waiter, he seemed so angry the entire time and tried hurrying us up. Im sad to say, I will not be coming back to this establishment as long as this man works.
author: John M.

description:
Post San Francisco Marathon (first half), we walked into a just opening, but already bustling restaurant serving the early brunch crowd. After 13.1 miles, I wanted something tasty and that's what I got.

If you love corned beef hash, you definitely have to try their El Paso. Most places will have some tired excuse for corned beef atop some potatoes. Not here! You get some of the good stuff - corned beef from that looks like it came straight off the brisket, large chunks of red and green peppers, onions, and of course, served with a side of home fries. They also add some cheese at the very bottom that melts and becomes awesome goodness when you mix it all together with a bit of pepper and tobasco. *drool* And hey, you can't forget your eggs - two any style. I like mine over medium so you can crack the yolk into the goodness below. 

My girlfriend got the Coronada - an omelette with avacado, cheddar, and onions served with black beans, salsa, and sour cream. Different? Yes! Tasty? Surprisingly! Who would've though avacados would do so well in an omelette?

Portion size was huge... if I hadn't ran so much, I probably would've felt more guilty eating that whole plate (see pics). Would definitely come again to try other things... their benedict options looked pretty tempting =P
author: Stanton C.

description: Sometimes its good and sometimes its not.   If the waiters and cooks did their job consistently it would be a good place.  You will wait forever sometimes and then may possibly be served cold food not to your stated preference on top of it.  Other times its good all the way through.
author: W. H.

description:
I had an awesome experience here. When we put our names in, they told us it would be a few minutes, but they have a little coffee station right there next to the hostess stand for those folks that are waiting for a table. Nice! It made the wait completely painless... Plus, the wait was only like 5 minutes. 

The interior of the place is so lovely -- stucco, pillows on the benches lining the walls, overall a very cozy, inviting vibe. The patio, which I only saw through the windows, looked really nice, as well. 

The menu isn't huge, but it's carefully curated. I opted to try out something under the "Benedictions" section -- corned beef hash. And, omg, I was glad I did. The corned beef wasn't diced or all smushed -- it was actually more like pulled pork; sort of shredded. It was cooked with diced onions that were perfectly carmelized, diced potatoes that has a pleasant hint of garlic to them, and cheddar cheese. Wait, I'm ruining it. The set up went: potatoes on the bottom, covered in cheddar, then the meat and onions, and finally, two eggs over easy on top. Perfection. A bagel and cup of fresh fruit came along with it, and they were very nice as well. 

I also noticed their brunch-y cocktail menu, which had Bloody Marys, Mimosas, and Bellinis for $5. Unfortunately, I knew that consuming one could result in a barf-fest in my state, so I had to refrain, but I'll definitely be back to try them soon!
author: Natahley B.

description:
Good honest food, at a great value. 20 bucks for a good steak and two sides is damn near impossible to find. Large portions too.  Even a stoner with the munchies may need a to-go box. And the service is great, reflects the food. 
The awesome part is you can eat breakfast for dinner, all day everyday.  A place where my free-will is unabated and I can have cornbeef hash w overeasy eggs at night is my type of place!
author: John E.

description:
Love, love, love this place!!! I haven't gone back in a while but it will be on my list of adventures when I go back up to the city. My favorite thing is the patio seating on a beautiful day. It is covered with beautiful plants that keep it nice and cool. 

Maybe I'm a lush but I love their mimosas. So yummy! 

Scramble: Baja! 
French Toast: La Sussie! 
Crepes: San Francisco, Milano, & Santa Fe! 
Benedictions: Blackstone! 
Sandwich: Sonoma! 

On a nice day, definitely give this place a chance!
author: Priya B.

description:
Savor is surely  the best place to eat on 24th Street in Noe Valley.

The ambiance is unpretentious and warm, the prices are sweet, and most importantly, the crepes are scrumptious.  Quality-wise, crepes are not on the level of Ti Couz (in my humble opinion), but Savor definitely does the job.  Besides, any lack of quality is compensated with the generous portion.

And they have a to-go menu!  You know my coworkers and I are all over that.

So if you're strollin along in Noe, Savor is a pretty sweet spot.
author: Angella S.

description:
great location, great service at first, but started to slowwww down towards the end.

french toast was thick and delicious!

portions are huge; we will split next time!
author: Rosalee C.

description:
I've held off writing a review on Savor in the hopes that my next time would be better. But after 4 times with various friends in the last year, I have to warn others away. This restaurant is usually crowded but I can't understand why. My 2 dinners there have been among the worst meals I've had. The lunches have been mostly average but only since I've stayed with salads. Sandwiches have been barely edible with soggy bread and over cooked meat.
My 2 dinners were so bad I could barely eat a small portion of the meal.
Once I ordered a steak medium rare and it came as a dried out well-done. When I asked for it again it still came back medium to medium well. The potatoes were a watery flavor less mush. And the salad for dinner had no dressing or seasoning that I could discern. I asked for dressing on the side which helped but as I began to eat it I found lettuce that had brown mushy spots on it and the cherry tomatoes were so tough and hard I needed a steak knife to cut them.
The wait staff varied from friendly to hard to track down. 
It was very crowded but my friends who ate with me were also a baffled as to why people would come back.
There are alot more places close by that have much better food (Pasta Pomodoro, Le Zinc and for really nice good dinners Firefly or great casual food Joe's diner)
Don't waste your time or money here.
author: Armando H.

description: On a weekend where "feeling good" physically was illuding me, it was lovely to be taken care of for Sunday Brunch...I had the Mazatlan Crepe. Delicious.  The coffee could be stronger...and refilled, but the service was lovely other than that glitch. I'll be going back!
author: Karen D.

description:
Bombay Crepe - Excellent curry sauce, but the overcooked and previously frozen shrimp were barely edible.  

Tofu and Egg Scramble - Excellent peanut sauce flavors and mushrooms.  I'd order this again.

Pear Bellini - A decent drink, but nothing special.

Bloody Mary - Lacking spice and just tasted too similar to V8.

Service was awkward.  After we got settled but before we ordered, they tried to get us to switch tables so they could give our table to a larger party.  Huh?  There were 4 empty tables adjacent to each other on the other side of the room, so I refused to move.
author: Darlene W.

description:
Wow! Did it really take half a year of me living in Noe before I discovered this gem?? I'm coming back here again and taking all my friends with me. They have huge portions, delicious food, great/friendly service, lots of tables in their patio out back, and we didn't have to wait on noon on a Saturday.

We ended up here when the fiance and I were walking to La Boulange, and he suggested we try out Savor. It didn't look that exciting from the outside, but I figured we'd give it a try. We ordered...

- the Santa Fe crepe which was absolutely delicious - crepe, egg, cheese, lots of filling... it was like an omelette and huevos rancheros in one! 

- the french toast, which was great for french toast, but not as memorable as the savory stuff here

- cornbread with jalapeno jelly - oh my. really delicious. crunchy on the outside, soft and flavorful on the inside, cut like pieces of toast and toasted

Usually I can eat my whole entree plus more, but we ended up taking a couple of take out boxes home - but don't worry, the cornbread is just as good if you reheat it in your toaster at home!
author: Erin Y.

description:
The menu reminds me of Crepevine (are the restaurants connected???).    I had my favorite Bangkok salad, which is far better at Crepevine (better dressing by FAR).

The service was AWFUL.....servers were not quick to do anything; service was very slow even when we were asking for simple items like straws.  

The $1 tax on each customer for HEALTH INSURANCE was maddening.     I think it would behoove them to rise prices a bit instead of pissing off customers.  Don't get me wrong, I believe that all workers should have health insurance, but the prices here should cover the cost.   This tax is applicable no matter what you spend, so it applies if you have tea or a $12 salad.

The patio is nice for those great SF sunny days, but the entire experience was not worth it.
author: Katharine A.

description:
The pulled pork here is off the hook! Comes with salad, coleslaw, and home potatoes. With the big ass glasses of mimosas...I had the itis BAAAAAD.

Thanks Savor for the hangover cure, and the big nap that was to follow!
author: Lauren S.

description: How did my previous review ignore the big plus: a dog-friendly patio and staff. If you're out with your dog and want lunch, it's worth a drive to come here.
author: Tom R.

description:
Big yummy salads, outdoor seating, sandwiches that taste healthy, latte's, nice staff and good shopping all around the area.
The only down side is they no longer allow dogs in the outdoor seating area, which is the main reason I used to frequent savor but the food is still really tasty.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Sad because I used to go to Savor all the time but stopped going because I moved 2 years ago. Now I'm back in SF and wanted to go back to my favorite place. Savor always used to have a line out the door but not today!  I went to Savor and our server was rude from the start. He got upset when we asked for separate checks and took forever to give us our bill and after waiting for 15 minutes we walked over gave them our check and were told we were an "inconsiderate party". Overpriced food, that's not even that good, and rude waiters. Next time I'll pass...disappointed my favorite place has turned out this way.
author: Ariana C.

description: I was completely impressed with this lil gem of a restuarant. I went there a little tired and slightly hungover, but all that changed when our very attentive waiter took care of our every need. The service was amazing, he was so nice, and the food was delicious. I think I had the Coronado omelette which is Veggie based topped with Black Bean chili and sour cream and the Cornbread w. Jalapeno Jelly? YUM... Definitely going back. After how I felt when I stumbled in, they brought me back to life and got me ready for my horse backriding trip... The waiter even said that he hoped I felt better! So Sweet!
author: Joy W.

description:
Savor has to be one of the best brunch places in the city.  You get great quality, well-priced food and huge portions.  The service is good and the staff is very friendly and attentive.    On a nice day you can sit outdoors and enjoy your meal in the shade or in the sun.  Even dining indoors is great.

The menu is full of everything you'd want in a brunch place - omelets, scrambles, crepes, French toast, etc.  What makes this place different is that everything tastes great - it's not just a few dishes, but everything on the menu is awesome!

My favorites are the Corned Beef Hash and The Challah French Toast.  The corned beef hash is a huge portion of savory beef with potatoes and peppers all topped with two eggs.  The French toast is flavorful and filling and even comes with a side of sweetened apple compote/pie filling.

Just be prepared for a long wait when you arrive since this is a popular spot.  You can usually call ahead and get your name on the list, which does cut down on the amount of time you have to wait.
author: Ken G.

description:
I really like savor. It's a great brunch place with excellent food. Their gluten-free options for brunch are scrambles and omelets. The black bean chili and the soy chorizo are both gluten-free so I always get the Arizona. The corned beef hash is pretty good as well. 

I didn't give it 5 stars because the drinks I've had there are not that great, and the the GF options can get tiring after a bit.  Overall, I'm a regular here because they are a great location to hang out with friends or family (including children), and are gluten-free and vegetarian friendly.
author: Min M.

description: Savor is solid. Great friendly staff, some who've been around forever. I eat here a few times a week for business meetings and I've never been disappointed. The portions are enormous. a great value, they're quick, consistent, and the atmosphere is very sweet. A great spot to have in Noe.
author: andrew s.

description:
Nothing too special with the menu items, but a solid breakfast-anytime type of place. So much better than your local Denny's! Large portions with fair prices.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: Huge portions and good food. I got a $16 wild mushroom risotto with prawns and could only eat half of it.
author: Thomas C.

description: The portions here are huge, the price is reasonable, and the food is a-okay.  But it's not amazing.  Try the cornbread side, for sure, which is BEYOND.  But the breakfast/brunch crepes, sandwiches, and omelets were just fine, but nothing fantastic.
author: Tarah D.

description: Didn't have to wait which was delightful for a Sunday morning at 10:30! My salmon eggs Benedict were delish! The omelet my friend got ( one of the Mediterranean ones) was good, though on par with something I could make.
author: Lindsey R.

description:
Noe Valley has never appealed to me much because it's so family oriented....lots of baby strollers, kids, baby clothing stores, etc.  BUT, it has some great food spots.  Savor is one place that it an absolute must try if you're in the area, and definitely worth the trek for brunch.  We waited about 30 minutes on a Sunday around 11:30am, which is not bad when you compare it to the line at Momma's (over in Washington Square).  Lots of tables, windows for sunshine, and a back patio which is quaint but comfy.  

The food was divine!  I went with 3 other adults and 1 baby, and we sat at a large table in the front.  We were able to get a high chair with no problem.  The 2 guys felt that the food was hearty/seasoned enough (some southern flavor) to satisfy them, while myself and my girlfriend found that it was healthy/simple enough to keep us from feeling full/gross after.  We were all very satisfied!  We ordered:

1. Kyoto marinated grilled tofu, shiitake mushrooms, greens onions, spinach, tomatoes and peanut ginger sauce (for us girls)
2. Santa Fe grilled chicken apple sausage, with scrambled eggs, green onions, provolone and salsa fresca. (the boys)
3. New Orleans crab cakes on english muffin with poached eggs topped with spicy cajun hollandaise (the boys)
4. Haifa made with challah and topped with apple pie filling (we all shared)

Wonderful, responsive service and the price was right.  It came out to about $12/person.  I will definitely be returning here.
author: Naomi P.

description: I love the place, the service, their staff.  I could have breakfast there every day of my life.
author: Andy B.

description:
Am always on the lookout for some decent brunch places to start off the Sunday. Its great to just sit over your crepes or eggs, sipping coffee, mulling the end of the weekend!

The menu is amazing. A lot of options, right from the vegans to the hard core meat eaters. Ordered the Santa Fe Crepe. The portions are huge, but delicious. The coffee wasnt that great, felt it was a bit weaker than I like. The food in itself was quite good. 

The place is huge, and seating was very comfortable. We had to wait a bit, but we got to sit outside, which is well protected. The heater was on, and we were well shielded from the rain.
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
Enormous size for any dishes so try splitting if possible.  Salads are always very fresh.

Trout is ok.  You just have to get over the fishy taste which is inherent in all trout.  

Crepes and side potatoes are wonderful.  I wouldn't recommend leftover crepes for next day.  

Wine by the glasses are affordable and we tried 3 different ones (one white, a pinot? and something else) and all were excellent.  

No waiting for dinner on any week night.
author: Yvonne Y.

description: Ive eaten here for years.  Good solid breakfast food.  Crepes are great, muffins are great, eggs are great.
author: Randi M.

description: Beware: "20 minute wait" = 40 minutes+. The redhead working the front has a terrible attitude.  After several unpleasant encounters with her we ended up eating somewhere else.
author: Ryan G.

description: A good restaurant with more than adequate portions. Went here with a friend my first night after moving into the area and got the shrimp linguini (I had a pretty major craving). It was delicious, service was good and the heated patio was pretty awesome as well. No complaints, not the best restaurant in the world but still quite good. Food was cheap!
author: Sam W.

description:
This review is mostly negative but I wish it wasn't because my meal was actually quite good. I ordered the Cyprus crepe and it was delicious. That said, there were a handful of unnecessary issues that force me to give the restaurant a lower rating.

Starting from the most easily fixable, the service. Though our waitress was friendly, she got my order wrong. Mistakes happen but when a bug flew into my wine glass and I informed her, she removed my glass but returned with only the amount that had remained minus the bug. Did she scoop out the bug and give me the wine back? I highly doubt it, but she should have poured a new, full glass to alleviate any uncertainty and as a gesture. Poor form.

The biggest problem were the flies. Why were there a ton of fruit flies buzzing around us inside the restaurant? That grossed me out and to have one fly into my glass of wine added insult to injury. 

This restaurant has identity issues. The space has a broken layout with most of the restaurant in the back outside mall area in the middle of the block under an awning. They have heaters but only one was turned on so we ate inside.  

The fact that there are two menus with different designs and layout made me feel like there were two different restaurants in the same space. One is a creperie and the other offers a new american fare. 

I'm not sure I'll ever go back...
author: Eliz M.

description:
Very friendly staff, casual atmosphere and yummy food - great place for brunch.  The crepes are really delicious, but I tend to favor the benedicts.  They are all really yummy, especially if you ask for them soft poached!

Also, be sure to try the cornbread with jalapeno jelly - very yummy!
author: Richard H.

description: I've been to Savor several times and this review pertains to my last visit over the weekend. We arrived at 9:30 - it was almost empty. Maybe 5 or 6 tables were occupied. We figured we'd be in and out. Fairly quickly, our server came to take our order. Drinks came, then we waited. And waited. 10:06 - still no food. 10:20 - the place is now packed and my husband and son receive their order. She got our son's wrong. Instead of a short stack with a side of fruit, she gave him a full order of coconut banana pancakes. He took 3 bites then was finished. My husband said his crepe and potatoes were cold. My order - eggs, sausage and toast (a seriously no-brainer breakfast that should have come out in 15 minutes vs. close to an hour) finally arrived. Toast isn't toasted, eggs look gray, sausage and potatoes look fine. We talked about sending our son's breakfast back, but he said he just wanted to get the check and leave. Our server comes by to check on us once and before my husband has a chance to order a mimosa she walks away. 10:49 - we flag down another waiter to ask for our check. Our server was polite and nice, but service was horrible. There is no reason that eggs, a crepe and two pancakes should take over an hour in a basically empty restaurant. I almost wanted to leave no tip at all but my husband gave her a little less than 10%. In the past, we've liked this place but don't think we'll be going back.
author: Kathleen D.

description:
I've come here a few times for brunch. There generally looks like there are a lot of people waiting for a table  but I don't think I've ever waited longer than 10 minutes for a table.  

I usually have a really hard time choosing something to eat here because everything looks amazing. Today I had an egg scramble with goat cheese, sun dried tomatoes, spinach, and mushrooms. This particular dish usually comes with chicken but I don't eat meat. I've also had the New Orleans benedict here which has crab cakes and poached eggs on english muffins, topped with cajun hollandaise sauce. I think I've had the french toast, as well. Regardless, everything I've ever had here had been GREAT!

The service was prompt and friendly as well. Overall- a great brunch option!
author: Kayla N.

description:
This place makes a mean bellini and an even better mimosa.   On that occasional warm San Francisco day having brunch on their patio with a nice mimosa is a great way to start (or end) a relaxing weekend.  (They also have outdoor heaters for the patio.)

Their breakfast crepes and omelletes are hefty (3 eggs at their fluffiest) and they are more than willing to turn crepes into omelettes if you're looking for ways to lower your simple-carb intake.  They'll also sub mixed greens for potatoes without batting an eye.  My favorite crepe/omelette option is the San Franciscan because of the salmon (or lox -- your call) and the spinach.  The Santa Fe, which has chicken-apple sausage, is another good choice. And the raisin bread is almost worth the carbs.  

I typically come here for brunch but recently revisited this place for dinner.   I had the hanger steak, served with a wine and mushroom sauce and was very pleasantly surprised.  I ordered sweet potato fries and sauteed spinach as my sides.   If you get the fries, ask for them on a separate plate to avoid the sog factor, but, sogginess aside, both sides were still yummy. 

The wine list is decent with a lot of options from Argentina and other up-and-comers in the wine world.  And the dessert crepes are pretty hard to resist (darn the makers of Nutella).

Service is mostly good.  My favorite waiter calls everyone "hon" and wears shorts on even the coldest days.  When I'm there for brunch, he usually gets my mimosa ready for me before I've been seated :)  On the down side, the kitchen staff seem mostly indifferent as do some of the other servers.
author: Ms C.

description: Cafe au lait was pretty tasty and sizable. Wonderful ambiance and cozy outdoor porch. I got the Provence which wasn't mindblowing but tasted well enough. Overall I would recommend this place for a nice Sunday brunch.
author: Julian B.

description: Huge portions, great service, nice patio that allows dogs...but! The quality of ingredients is really low - college cafeteria low. If they reduced the portions and improved their ingredients, they could get to four stars. I'm sad to say I won't be coming back because there are so many better brunch places around. This mainstay of Noe Valley needs to up its game and catch up with the healthy, organic, local food vibe of the establishments around it.
author: Tudor H.

description:
Probably won't be returning to this place.
I drove to this restaurant this morning from Berkeley to have breakfast with a friend. I ordered waffles, which rarely ever happens but today I felt like having waffles, and they were TERRIBLE. 
Their waffles have the consistency of cardboard with zero flavor. 
No amount of syrup would of made them edible.
--Maybe this was the one item on there menu that needs a bit of TLC but it was a bad first-impression for me.
author: Monica M.

description:
Came here for Kelly W.'s birthday brunch yesterday. When we arrived, there were people waiting for tables out by the storefront and since it was a Sunday I would assume this was standard. Three of us riding together came late to the already seated 20+ person brunch. So not trying to draw attention to ourselves was a mission we failed miserably. 

As my friend Ray R. put it, "They parted the seas to seat us." The staff was more than accommodating to shuffle us around like Tetris pieces so that we would be able to sit together. BTW we were seated in the outdoor patio. The weather was beautiful and by beautiful I mean warm in SF--a rarity. I think we should have screen printed a few tees with the date along the lines of, "Today was a warm day in SF. April 18, 2010." 

I ordered the Barcelona savory crepe with a mango iced tea. I had been suffering from a hangover courtesy of the night before so I steered away from the mimosas but nonetheless they looked delicious plus they're only $5! The Barcelona crepe had fontina cheese, mushrooms, spinach, and onions. It came with a mixed green salad and potatoes on the side (included with all savory crepes). The service was prompt and friendly, never missing a beat--my iced tea never hit below the halfway mark. I thought the portion was rather large and reasonably priced. The crepe was delicious and hit the spot--everything was flavorful so no complaints. I want to come back and try their scrambles and omelets because everything looked amazing.

P.S. It's walking distance from Delores Park and the mecca of ice cream, Bi-Rite Creamery, so venture out and take a stroll.
author: Audrey D.

description:
Had lunch today with my husband at Savor.
We've eaten there many times and have enjoyed it.

Sadly , today my husband discovered small pieces of broken glass (!) in his food.
The waiter was concerned, asked if my husband was okay and offered to bring him a fresh plate.
My husband took it all in stride, although he was a bit unnerved to be eating glass.

When we finished our meal, the waiter presented us with a check and reassured us that he had given us a 20% discount - $4.39.
We were both completely underwhelmed by this response. When you serve your guests glass, the very least I would expect is to have that patrons meal comped.
If I were really on it, I would comp the entire meal and offer a gift certificate to bring them back.

There are far too many great places to eat in our beautiful city for this sort of experience. We will not be returning.
author: peggi j.

description: Good inspired food, poor service on our visit. It's frustrating to be seated 5 minutes before a large group comes in, then have the group order before we've had any service. Could have just been a busy morning, but you can't do that. Food service was quick once we did order. Had the chicken and waffles and the salmon and egg muffins.  Good food for certain.
author: Clark B.

description:
There was no wait.  The service was great.  It was about a zillion times better than Cafe Pointe (on 24th and Diamond).  

Personally, I didn't like the sausage that came in my scramble.  I was jealous of my boyfriend's eggs the whole time.  

But, yeah, its was aiight.
author: Amy N.

description: Sat in the back patio and was pleasantly surprised with the food and the service.  Glad I came here.
author: Stephen L.

description:
So I was searching for a yummy breakfast place that wasn't the size of a shed like most delicious breakfast places (i.e. Brenda's, Dottie's) due to the fact that I had a group of 7...and I also wanted a place I could make reservations (hard to come by for a good breakfast place). So I did some yelping and saw the reviews for this place and decided to give it a try!

Satisfactory! The service was great and they were super chill and nice. The place was actually ginormous and even had an outdoor patio! The decor was warm and cute. 

So one of my friends ordered the San Francisco crepe which was salmon, capers, dill, some cheese, and spinach - sounded amazing and was...good. Not off the chains amazing, but was good. My other friend ordered the Granada salad which I was like...WHY WOULD YOU ORDER SALAD of all things! But honestly all my shit talking was not necessary because the salad was so good! It was like pear, with walnuts, gorgonzola and pomegranate vinaigrette! Delicious. And ginormous. I ordered the New Orleans which was like a crab cake benedict and deeeeeeeemn it was good. It was rich and the flavors were bold but good! I did feel like poop after eating the fried stuff with the rich sauce but it was worth it!
author: Eryn K.

description: Has courtyard but it is nearly completely covered. Oversized dishes range from good but far from great dishes to frankly mediocre. Service is standard. Overwhelmingly patronized by families w children, so not your choice for conversation or romantic ambience.
author: Chetan I.

description:
I would give Savor 3.5 stars if I could - but I'll bump it up to 4.

I had a hankering for 'breakfast for dinner' and found a recommendation online for Savor.  We had no trouble finding parking (5:45ish on a Friday) and were seated immediately.  

The menu is fantastic - a huge variety of options with choices sure to please anyone.  I opted for their Barcelona crepe (spinach/mushroom/fontina) - it was served with a side salad and home potatoes.  Very solid; very satisfying meal.  I also had a bellini that was so-so (the quality of the sparkling wine was questionable, but I dug the muddled mango!).  Hubby had an omelet served with potatoes and a bagel (all very good, according to him), plus a pomegranate margarita (so-so per both of us :) ).

Really liked the atmosphere - it was very relaxing/comfortable and the service was friendly. We ended up walking around the neighborhood after our meal and exploring some of the local shops - all of which are super cute!  Not sure I'll be back on my own, but certainly wouldn't refuse an invitation to Savor in the future.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
My friend took us here for brunch on our way out of town and it was really good. She told me this place was a lot like some of the brunch places we have back home. It's located in Noe Valley, which is a cute little neighborhood. We sat out in the back courtyard area which was nice and quite relaxing.

All of us were pretty pleased with our food. I had the San Francisco crepe, my friends had one of the benedictions and the eggs any style. Both seemed to be pretty happy with their meals.

TIP: I wouldn't recommend ordering your bacon extra crispy. I'm not a meat eater, but I recognize overcooked, dry bacon when I see it. Plus, it was also on the cold side, which I doubt is tasty.
author: Mary T.

description:
I woke this Sunday morning and had a craving for a hearty breakfast. 

Off to Savor! 

I've been here a few times and I never really had to wait long for a table which is a HUGE plus in my book. I hate waiting more than 30 minutes for anything especially for my favorite meal of the day....breakfast! 

We walked in and was immediately seated. Service was attentive and my coffee was always filled. I like.

I ordered the Rio Grande scrambled eggs which comes with a side of potatoes and your choice of toast. I got the walnut raisin bread. Yum. I'm normally not a big goat cheese fan but it worked well with the scrambled eggs. The sun dried tomatoes and spinach went well together too. One of the best things about this place is their homemade jam. I have a lot more respect for those restaurants who will go out of their way and make their own jam....not Smuckers. My bf got the the Baja scrambled eggs which was also tasty and had a kick to it. Good way to wake up in the morning. 

Portions are big. Come hungry. Leave Happy.
author: Molly T.

description:
Excellent food and service in a 
beautiful spacious venue!
Thanks!
author: John S.

description: Great omelets and crepes but I keep on coming back here for their awesome bloody marys! It's sake based but still gives you that kick. I swear it's the best bloody mary in the city.
author: Janis P.

description: Oatmeal pancakes, fresh squeezed OJ and a delicious plate of Egg Benedict.... and yes, I am in heaven.
author: Monique T.

description:
Seriously, delicious brunch and HUGE portions! One of my favorite breakfast places in the city..and I LOVE breakfast! So many options for all your different tastes. 

Plus, the staff are SUPER accommodating!!!

I LOVE SAVOR!
author: Rachael B.

description:
Savor is a great neighborhood restaurant!  We don't know what we'd do without it.  Huge bonus points that it is dog friendly (they have a great back patio area with giant, effective heat lamps) as we enjoy bringing our giant Newf with us - and they seem to enjoy his presence as well!

I've tried quite a few items (mostly breakfast) and have been happy with most.  They are very open to substitutions and tweaks, which is awesome.  For example, you can get any crepe item as a scramble or omelette for a $1 more.  I've gotten the Milano this way and it is DELICIOUS!  I don't care for their home fries/rosemary potatoes so I order their french fries and mixed green salad instead.  Their beer-battered fries are killer.  Nothing overly special put on them but they're crispy on the outside and nice and warm/soft on the inside, and not greasy!  Perfection as far as I'm concerned. 

Portions are also very generous.  You will seriously either leave completely stuffed or comfortable and have lunch for the next day.  

Other notable menu items:
- Swedish pancakes.  Totally not a pancake fan but these oatmeal pancakes are seriously heaven.  It comes with a fruit compote (and butter) that goes perfectly with them.  It's a huge meal or a nice appetizer for everyone at the table ; )
- the Carolina.  BBQ pulled pork.  'Nuff said.  Comes with fries & salad.
- the Arizona Omelette w/meat chorizo (with fries and salad of course, per my request)
- the Blackstone Benedict (with ham added)
- Nicoise salad (w/grilled salmon - only b'c I'm pregnant and tuna is off limits for now - but it's cooked perfectly.. very tender and not dried out)
- Chicken Marsala w/their garlic mashed potatoes & seasonal veggies (mashed potatoes are so creamy!)

Anyway, you should try and see for yourself.  The staff are also great - friendly, accommodating, personable, and perfectly attentive.
author: Arlie A.

description:
Eaten here at least half a dozen times for brunch, so I'll keep that portion short: eggs good and prices similar to Crepevine. There's a reason they serve breakfast all day. 

Now as for dinner, do yourself a favor and order breakfast food if you ever find yourself here around that time. 

Dinner appetizer portions are huge, big enough to fit two people, or one person as a main dish, but flavors aren't that strong. Baked brie in philo dough with walnuts and their house jalapeno jelly not as flavorful as baked brie dishes need to be (the jelly just didn't give it enough tang) and the baked mushrooms in cheese with crostini was very soupy tasted like plain, unseasoned sauteed mushrooms with cheese on bread. 

Dinner entrees too lacked flavor, as the shrimp fettucine was basically pasta with a little bit of lemon juice squeezed atop it. Risotto ratatouille was their strongest dish, warm, chewy, but needed just a little more something, some crunch, extra sauce, something to push it into good territory.

All in all, breakfast is good, as has been reiterated many times by other Yelpers, but dinner is bland.
author: David G.

description: The patio is great for families with kids who like fresh air and plenty of space to explore. The kids menu is tasty and comes with little waxed sticks for bending into sculptures, jewelry, etc. It's a little pricey for simply good (not great) food but the service is excellent. I like the spicy Bloody Mary and salmon.
author: Katy N.

description: Very good french toast - and a portion big enough for two!
author: Mark B.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Their Golden Gate salad which consists of beets, caramelized walnuts, gorgonzola (I add grilled chicken) is my favorite salad in the city. It is very large portioned. You can definitely share your salad between two people. Their creeps are delicious as well as their sandwiches.
author: Sylvia M.

description:
I love this place for breakfast/brunch.

They have a great outdoor patio with heaters that I take advantage of whenever it's even remotely nice outside.

Here are the best items on the menu

1. Savory Crepes (I like the Santa Fe)
2. Sweet Crepes (Riviera is my fave)
3. Muffins of the Day (always super yummy)
4. Mango Iced Tea (sooo goood!)

Stay away from the pancakes (I had the banana coconut and they were pretty dry, blah), and two of the scrambles I tried were just ok.
author: Amanda S.

description:
I've been eating at Savor since it opened up years ago, and it is hands down my favorite breakfast spot.  Where else can you get exceptional food, with large portions, for a fair price in a comfortable, pleasant atmosphere served by friendly staff?  
I've never grown tired of the menu.  It's in a great neighborhood.  The quality is consistent.  The serve free coffee on weekends if you wait in line.  The whole place is my kind of restaurant.  And should be yours.
author: Kenneth R.

description:
I've been coming here for almost 10 years and it always remains consistent. 

I know what to expect when I arrive and if that is on the weekend it would consist of a wait for a table. If it is on a Monday it is immediate gratification. 

I always ask for David. I guess he would be considered a "bear" but he is nothing but a big teddy bear. He treats everyone with the utmost kindness and the families and kids all seem to gravitate towards his good nature. 

I have tried many things on the menu for brunch. Everyone of them are great! The portions are pretty generous. Try the corned beef hash and you will know what I am talking about. They never skimp on the mimosa and sometimes give you a complimentary one. 

I will be moving from SF in about 40 days and Savor is right in my hood. I will miss it a great deal. I feel so welcomed when there and it feels like home. 

Thanks to the amazing staff for all the good meals and keeping my belly happy.
author: Scott P.

description:
3 stars is a little harsh, this place was more like a 3.5 but to be honest, being a brunch snob/whore, I hold my 4 star brunch venues in high regard. 

That said, my eggs scramble was solid. Nothing out of the ordinary but not disappointing. Service..same as the food. In fact, that would probably be the overall assessment of this place - Ordinary but not disappointing. 

I'd say more but, to be honest, since this place shouldn't be making it on anyone's list..it doesn't matter.
author: Shreya C.

description:
I've been here a couple of times for brunch and I always leave very happy with my meal.  The portions here are hearty so come hungry.  But, coming hungry may backfire on you since there's always a wait.

I love their bloody mary's and I love the garnishes they use to decorate my yummy drink. :)
author: Rosalind S.

description:
The food here is just ok.  I had the chicken shwarma which was nothing like shwarma and just not very tasty.  My wife had the chicken pesto crepe which was also not very good.  The crepe was fine but the filling was nothing special.  Not enough pesto flavor.

The room is very cozy with a nice fireplace in the back.  On this chilly night, the ambience was very welcoming.  I just wish the food was more satisfying.
author: Eric Y.

description:
I haven't had a breakfast better than this in a LONG time. There are so many bland restaurants out there, especially when it comes to this CRUCIAL meal. Savor isn't one of them! 

The menu is full of options that are all mouth watering - I was having trouble deciding between about 4 things, as this place seems to include many of my favorite ingredients in so many of their dishes...portobello mushrooms, grilled onions, every kind of cheese you can imagine, sun dried tomatoes, spinach, salmon...the list goes on. I finally decided on the crepe with salmon, and decided to modify it a bit... 

{side note: this place has a full breakfast menu - omelets, french toast, pancakes, etc - not just crepes} 

While we waited for our food, we each had a mimosa. Finally, a place that doesn't serve their mimosas in a champagne flute, giving you only 3 sips. The mimosas here were BIG! Mine lasted all the way until the end of breakfast. 

My crepe was delicious. The salmon was flavorful without being salty, and all of the ingredients (spinach, grilled onions, Swiss cheese) were super fresh. The side salad / dressing - delicious. The potatoes were good too. 

The atmosphere was cute, and there wasn't a wait for the three of us. I HIGHLY recommend this place!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Have been here several times with friends for brunch/lunch. 

Food: Huge, hearty portions.  Come hungry!  The crepes, both savory and sweet, are made well, and they have a variety of traditional and not-so-traditional breakfast and lunch fusions.

Service: Pretty kind and fast.  If you're coming for brunch, be prepared to wait for a little bit since it is a busy spot.

Cons: I'm usually a fan of outdoor seating, but if you get stuck in the far left corner in the back, be prepared for small bugs flying around you and into your water.  Seems to only be that one spot that has this problem.
author: Amy Y.

description:
I've been to Savor a few times over the years. I tried again a couple of weeks ago with some friends. I really, really want to like this place, but the food is the only thing that prevents it!!

I love the location, friendly servers, and the outdoor patio. However, every time I eat here I find myself wishing I would have saved my money. 

I've been here for breakfast and lunch. I tried the crab benedict and it was whatever. This last time I had the pulled pork sandwich. I don't even now what it is, but it's just not good. Can't remember what all I've eaten before.

I may try again just to get some baked goods, but as I type that, I'd rather just go to Noe Valley Bakery for that...sorry Savor.
author: gabby m.

description: AMMMAAAAAAZING! Fish Tacos! And the Veggie burger was mouth watering. I eat a lot of veggie burgers and have become accustomed to disappointment, but savor did what I really wanted. A flavorful different assortment of flavors. Next time we're in the City, I'll make sure to come. The waiters are cute. teehee
author: Hector B.

description: thanks to griddle fresh up the block for being ridiculously packed that day, we happened to walk past savor and thought, what the heck, it can't be that bad.  and it wasn't at all.  the jalapeno corn bread was great, albeit a bit on the dry side.  the buttermilk pancakes were yummm-my!  and big!  if you're in a hurry, and or impatient, and or want to keep your sanity, come here and save yourself some time and frustration.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
I just had the worst service at this restaurant in the 9 years I have lived in SF.  The waitress brought the wrong item for my wife's dinner order - and when we asked her to bring the correct item, she insisted we had made the mistake but reluctantly agreed to bring the correct item.  My wife's dinner never came - 25 minutes passed and finally I said that we just would rather they take it off our bill and we would leave.  The waitress then said she'd box it up for us - to go... but then another 10 minutes passed and still no check, no steak.  When she finally came with the check she told us she gave the steak to someone else and again said it was my wife's fault for the incorrect order.  When I corrected her she became offensive and argumentative.  I asked her to stop speaking to me and told her I was not going to be able to leave her a tip if she was going to keep insulting me.  She told me to not leave her a tip - so I didn't.  She was extremely rude.  
My nicoise salad was just so-so.  But really, there is nothing worse than being insulted - I still had to end up paying $40 for two drinks, a cup of soup and a salad.  Really not worth the experience at all!  I'll NEVER return.
author: J D.

description:
Rules for enjoying breakfast at Savor, especially for those  of us who do not like waiting, crowds or lots of loudness.

1. Go on a weekday morning
2. Make that a weekday morning with some sun (not hard in Noe Valley)
3. Sit out on the back patio with or with out the space heater thingy on
4. Order on empty stomach cuz the portions really are HUGE.
5. Proceed to get ridiculously well fed and full
6. Order one of Savor's signature giant muffins to go

Lather, rinse, repeat as necessary.
author: C P.

description: Wow wow great breakfast food.  Had the savory smoked salmon crepe and hubby had Americana breakfast with steak.  Best cooked and favored steak. Didn't give 5 because it is so dang cold in there. Maybe will warm up after open for a while. BUT first customers should be as warm as the next.  Mimosa is a generous portion.  Will be back again maybe later in the morning.
author: Sandy N.

description:
In the valley of strollers and brunches, Savor is a decent option with plenty of seating both indoors and outdoors and a minimal wait compared to some of the other places. The breakfast servings are big and can be split if you are only somewhat hungry. While nothing stood out on the menu you cannot go wrong with ordering the Crepes or an Omlette. 

After recently moving to the 'hood and cruising 24th St. looking for late brunch options on a misty Sunday glad to have happened upon Savor. While Toast looked like the hip spot with people loitering out front. Savor should be your best bet. And they have free coffee for those of us waiting. At times it might get cold but it is free.

On cold days the outdoor seating is not really exposed to the elements. There is plenty of canopy to shield your perfectly coiffed hair and heat lamps to warm the soul.
author: Ryan G.

description:
I had a good experience here. The outdoor patio is great and has a nice private setting.

The portions are well worth the price. Most of the dishes range from $10-13 but I never go hungry (compared to when you buy something with the same price and get this itty bitty wth is this...)

I like the crepes. I prefer the Santa Fe because I love having cheese in my crepes. Not only do they have crepes but they have a good portion of a simple fresh salad on the side and potato cube things (don't know the actual word for them)

The dishes are pretty filling for one person so my suggestion for first timers (especially if you want to try out the dessert too) is come with a friend and share a plate of the crepe dish and then share a dessert one. That way you can experience Savor more, and if it turns out you like it so much go ahead and come again and order your own Savor dish just for yourself!!!
author: Michelle L.

description: I have been here numerous times, and always consistent; food fresh ,salads has the right consistency of dressing not so overpowering or completely limp due to the heaviness of the dressing. My family and I came here for a Friday afternoon lunch and always greeted with warm similes enjoying a sunny day opening up their big windows without going outside a little breezy. Their fish tacos were a big hit, mango salsa with beautiful yellow cubed slices of mango with salsa, a gorgeous plate with a side of Cesar salad. Chicken was also tasty and given two thumbs up. Mango Iced Tea was delicious and our waiter was very courtesy always refilling for us without asking or flagging him down. They also have a great selection of hot teas chamomile was sweet smelling and calming as well.
author: Jennifer M.

description: The Coronado omelet is amazing. It's kind of like huevos rancheros but WAY better. The hostess was very accurate with the estimated time for our seating. It looked really crowded so when they told me 15 minutes I figured it would be 20-30 minutes. However, they had a table ready right at 15 minutes.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I'm a "regular" from this neighborhood. Usually dine early evening on less crowded days...cooking reliable, I know the menu well!!

My favs are the salads, Golden Gate or Bankok with salmon especially! I also like the full meal menu, often order the trout or Chicken Piccata. Wine menu variety is adequate, Groth SavBlanc is a good choice in white wine. Crepes come with salad and potato...great light meal and very popular...BEST is you can eat healthy here!

I especially like the casual setting, outside heated seating is available. Lots of light and space. generally welcoming atmosphere. Family friendly too. Easy access from the J line, walk from Church up 24th Street... Enjoy!
author: ML B.

description: I like the fish tacos. My co-worker loves the oyster po'boy. Nice spot for a quick lunch break. Service is good, parking can be a challenge. Price is fair for lunch menu.
author: sumaya g.

description: Hands down, favorite bfast spot in sf! AMAZING customer service. Huge portions. Quality food. Great neighborhood. Reasonable price. (:
author: Elena U.

description: Used to be better but now its going down the slippery slope.  It seems like they don't cook their food anymore and their portions are getting a alot smaller.  Service is alright although I went there with some friends recently and once we got seat no one came around for 20 mins to take our order so we left.
author: Blanca A.

description:
Here we go:
Bread-Delicious
Gluten Free Steak-To Die For
Gluten Free Mashed Potatoes-A Taste You Won't Forget
Vegetables-mm mm mm, Gotta Love Them Veggies
Sauteed Spinach-Look Out Pop-Eye, Savor is in town
Great service, view, seating. The wait wasn't long, it went by pretty quickly.
I love you guys!
author: Belinda M.

description:
I re-visited this great spot after a couple of years, and I still love this place. We usually don't hang out in this neighborhood, but I have to recalibrate my internal GPS ;-)  

Anyhow, this place is great, the selections are extensive with many choices for salads, or crepes (sweet and savory), omelettes, appetizers and entrees. WARNING: the portions are huge! But, that's what take away boxes are for, right? We (4 of us) all had different dishes and they were all superb.

The service was attentive, and the atmosphere was friendly and unpretentious. We need more place like this in the Bay Area! 

The only "bad" thing about coming here is parking, which was not too bad last night only because we ate in the early evening, otherwise, it may be a headache and will require circling around for a while.
author: M C.

description:
I don't understand the rage about this place... So many people tell me they absolutely love this place....! Yeah, nice patio. I think that is the best feature of this place. The brunch food is merely average. Nothing to write home about. 

Had Eggs Benedict with crab cakes... Hm... so so...
author: Sabine K.

description:
the BF and I were craving for some Noe VAlley life and eggs benedict.. so we came here. Super cute spot, rain or shine. They have a cozy inside plus an outdoor patio seating that doesn't get you wet..Service is mediocre at best.  I'd say this is a great place to take kids, babies, friends out of town.

We ordered the Ham and Cheese with Holl-andayze sauce (can't spell) and some other Benedict, as well as 1/2 an order of French Toast.
French Toast was good, but French Toast is french toast as far as i know..
BF and I loved their ham and cheese benedict and wud def come back for more, more for the atmosphere tho.
author: Linda C.

description:
Scenario: Anytime I want breakfast in Noe Valley.

Product: Where do I start?  They have delicious, fluffy omelettes full of veggies.  They have crepes, both breakfast and dessert.  They serve up some damn fine scrambles.  They also have pumpkin spice pancakes.  And the breakfasts are always huge.  So basically, I'm getting TWO really good meals 'cause they're always happy to box it up for you.  There is a wine menu, though I've never tried any there.

Service: Well, they're a bit slow to be honest.  It takes awhile to get your order and a little while longer for the food to show up.  And a little long for the check to arrive.  But throughout the meal they're attentive.  This is really keeping it from 5 stars...

Atmosphere: Eat Toast down the street is always packed but this place has outdoor patio seating in the back so there's usually no problem getting seated.  But let me make this clear: if you're going to bring your kid here put them on a leash!  I'm so tired of Noe Valley moms with their damn strollers and greyhounds letting their kids run amuck around the resteraunt while they pontificate about yuppidome.  Luckily, it's not as bad here as most other resteraunts in the area.  Parking is not so good in this neighborhood but it's a nice walk from the J or bus (48 methinks).

Uniquity: The food is SO good you have to come here.  And if you come on a Sunday morning you don't have to deal with nearly as many Noe youth;)
author: Robert R.

description:
This is it--the epicenter of the Noe Valley brunch scene.  (Or was, anyway, before that upstart Toast place took over.  Explain to me again why they need two locations in one neighborhood?)  Now while they certainly didn't skimp on the decorator (it's as glossy-beige as a Mexican resort in here), Savor is actually pretty casual at heart, sort of a Squat & Gobble on steroids.  The back patio is certainly the place to be (bonus props for having a pedestrian alley and storefronts *on* the patio...very Euro-Urban).  And it's so massive that there was only a nominal wait on a warm Sunday morning.

Now about the food.  They've got a long but fairly typical lineup--sweet and savory crepes, omelettes, benedicts, and a few token pancakes and french toasts.  And while the portions are large and all the right ingredients are there, somehow the flavor just doesn't click.  So unless you've got your heart set on the sunny patio or the stroller crowd, I'd stick to Crepevine or S&G.
author: Wes M.

description:
We had 7 people and we called ahead even though they don't take reservations.  They said get there at noon and we'll seat you right away.  Not sure how that's not a reservation, but we got there at noon, there were alot of people standing around waiting for a table, and they seated us right away,

I took a blind stab at the menu and got the San Francisco crepe.  It had salmon, spinach, some kind of cheese, and a big batch of awesome.  My girlfriend got a salad with salmon on top, and that was just as awesome.  I can only speak for these two dishes, but i'd say getting something salmon oriented is a safe bet.  I'll go back.
author: John S.

description:
Watery! 

 That one word sums up my entire experience here, from the door to the food. 
  The staff was out of it on the Sunday morning me and my BFF decided to visit.  Waited quite a while for our noisy table in the back. Only to be forgotten for quite some time before our order was finally taken.  
I will say my Tea was excellent, but hey it involves hot water and a tea bag so how hard can that be really?  My bff commented that her coffee was the best and only thing about our meal that actually was not watered down. Amazing!
 I ordered the eggs Benedict that everyone was raving about. This variation involved crab cakes. It arrived to the table in a puddle, and when I say puddle I mean the Hollindause was clearly the wrong consistency. Pale and watery, and drowning everything in sight. 

The crab cakes appeared as if they were supposed to be fried and crispy but had somehow jumped right out of that pan about ten minutes too soon. Soggy in the middle and no crunch in the crust. 

Moving on to the potatoes which lay on both my BFF and my plate. I got the bottom of the pan, crusty burn pieces and all. The rest of the potatoes were soggy ,undercooked and bland.  About this time I reached for the Tabasco....which isn't my favorite hot sauce anyway. But when in Rome....the Tabasco was clearly watered down. We tried another bottle, and again were thwarted. The bottle was so obviously watered down you could see the Tabasco and water separating within.  

My BFF was still trying to like her crepe that arrived in a pool of water with spinach spilling out of it, unable to eat it as it was she removed the over abundance of spinach to discover that there really was little to no other ingredients in her salmon and caper crepe. 

 We ordered some toast after my BFF commented that her meal was possibly the worst crepe she had ever seen. The toast was nice, great jam selection here. 

 Wont be back, eh....nothing to miss.
author: Charlie B.

description:
The only thing I liked the place is the friendly service. 

First off they pretend that they have Bloody Marys but don't be fooled because they do not. Unless you ask you'll order one and be served a soju and tomato juice abomination. The only reason I found out is because I asked if they had any pepper vodka. 

I ordered something called the "New Orleans", It's an eggs benedict style dish with crab cakes and "cajun sauce". The English muffins were soggy, the crab cakes were salty, and the "cajun sauce" had no bite at all. The eggs were under cooked. I can cook eggs at home so when I go to a restaurant I expect them to nail it. The yolk should be runny but the white should be solid, these eggs had all kinds of clear undercooked white squirting out every time I took a bite. The eggs were the worst part but the potatoes were also hard and undercooked.  

While I was there someone ordered a burger that looked amazing so I'm willing to try them again for lunch.
author: Manny F.

description:
This place is a great place for brunch. I was craving avocados and omelette one morning so I came here and got the Coronado Omelette (avocados, cheddar cheese, black beans, salsa, and sour cream). DELICIOUSSSS!!!!! :9 *drool*

Another plus for a huge glass of mimosa for 5 bucks and for their back patio seating areas. Absolutely gorgeous when the sun's out.
author: Nancy N.
