The food and service have been consistently excellent since my first visit back in 2003 (always have gone for breakfast/lunch/brunch.) And that consistency is probably what makes Savor so good. 

Anyway, the Bangkok Salad is insane, and while I'll scan the menu every time I go, it's usually this salad for me. In terms of breakfast/brunch, the Corned Beef Hash here is equally insane. The last time I was there (just a couple of weeks ago), they had a nice mango jam which was really tasty - perfect with my marble rye toast! I've had a few of the crepes which have been nice...and the different eggs benedict are also good stuff. 

It's pretty simple for me...the food and service are both equally and consistently excellent-that's kind of hard to find. Yes, the weekend waits can suck, but if you're not in a rush, it's worth it. And if you can't stand the wait, check it out during the week.
author: Carmine D.

description: Big fan of Sunday brunch at Savor.  Giant mimosas, delicious pancakes and egg scrambles.  Love sitting on the patio...and especially love that Savor is BABY FRIENDLY!!!
author: Kelsey C.

description: I've been here twice and had a great experience both times.  I sat in the back near the fireplace and it was relatively quiet.  The first time I had one of the benedictions, which was delicious.  The second time I had salmon in phyllo with sauteed vegetables and greens for sides.  The fish and accompanying sauce were delicious and the veggies were cooked perfectly.  Price is reasonable.  I think it's my favorite place in this area of 24th street -- quiet with a menu that has numerous things that interest me for not too much money.
author: Susie S.

description: This is by far my favorite restaurant so far. I love the unpretentiousness and casual atmosphere, the nice staff, the portions are great so you get your money's worth, and most importantly, the food is excellent. The crepe I had was very light but crispy and the ingredients inside - mushrooms, sun dried tomatoes, chicken, and pinoli nuts was so tasty.  The other day I tried their mushroom risotto with prawns and it was delicious. Their takeout is great too. I ordered a basic salad with grilled chicken and they were nice enough to keep everything separate, including the dressing. I will keep going back!
author: Pina C.

description:
Went there for brunch recently.  Not bad.  Order the Thai Chicken Salad - which was interesting, not bad - and French Toast - which was pretty average.  

The mimosa was decent.

We sat in the outdoor patio area - very nice and worth the wait.
author: Nick K.

description: I'm a big fan of their koyoto crepe.  The tofu is very tender and well marinated before it was cooked.  The service was great. We went for Sunday brunch and was greeted immediately and seated quickly after.
author: Lian F.

description: i had a very nice pan seared salmon sandwich after night class here. crispy skin and firm fish.  relaxed atmosphere and pleasant service. worth coming back to explore more menu options
author: Jeff W.

description: We went for brunch:  Cornbread with jalapeño jelly was new and delicious.  It looks like a great place and the menu held a great deal of promise, our server was wonderful everyone very helpful but the food was slightly lacking.  I was expecting more.  We ordered the cornbread of course; the Baja [(Spicy) chicken apple sausage, mushrooms, spinach onions, chipotle peppers with roasted jalapeno, cheddar cheese and salsa fresca in a crepe form[; Santa Fe [grilled chicken apple sausage, with scrambled eggs, green onions, provolone and salsa fresca]; and finally the New Orleans [crab cakes on english muffin with poached eggs topped with spicy cajun hollandaise].  The dishes for all of their seemingly amazing ingredients were just OK.  The Baja wasn't spicy at all, I didn't taste the chipolte or the jalepeno.  The Santa Fe was descent.  But the Crab cakes were OK but I was missing crab flavor and was getting only bread crumbs.  Cajun sauce really tasted more like regular hollandaise to me personally, and my co-diner.  The rosemary potatoes were tasty though.  But all in all, I wouldn't travel back there for breakfast.  If I lived in the area I would probably eat there a little more often but as it is now I only go in when I am in the area, and someone wants to go.
author: Sarah O.

description: Stepped in today with friends for a sunny lunch in the back patio. Many of the items on the menu sounded extremely appealing, but I finally settled on the Pacific Sandwich, seared salmon on a bun with arugula, chipotle sauce and avocado. And on the side were home potatoes and a mixed salad, a very filling meal. My full plate of food was bare by the end of the sitting. I enjoyed every last bite. And the price was extremely reasonable. The food definitely lives up to the name savor, with every bite. I would definitely like to go back to try some of their crepes and salads.
author: Misty G.

description:
great patio, friendly staff, tastey food just as everyone says, tad bit pricey ($2 for coffee!? ouch)...

minus a point for the surprise health charge once we received the bill.  if they are going to add this, they should be upfront about it, just something out of courtesy for the customer.  it's $1/person which isnt the worst thing ever, but sort of an unpleasant surprise.

i also dont understand why sf has this as it's own initiative when we have universal healthcare... but that's an off-yelp topic...
author: eric f.

description: I have been to Savor many times(over 100x) and I like their atmosphere and their food. And by food I mean, the New Orleans crab benedict, cheeseburger, all their salads, and omletes. I am not a fan of crepes and only tried their crepes once and it isn't the main reason I go there. Their service on the weekends is slow and the waiters are not very attentive and you always have to wave at anyone who works there but your waiter(nowhere to be seen) to refill your coffee or iced tea. They appear a bit disorganized.
author: Marc N.

description:
On weekends, this place is crawling with Baby Valley's finest and their 2.5 kids.  It's like these scumbags are fresh out of jail and Savor's the only whorehouse in town.  As an aside, the image of these uptight, khaki pant and polo wearing, stroller pushing, beat down by life dads fucking one of Savor's giant muffins makes me smile.  It's probably a more satisfying lay than some of their wives.  At least there would be something to hold on to...those muffins are HUGE and have you seen these woman?  How do they even have children?  Don't you have to have a certain percentage of body fat and say, HIPS, to birth a child?  Or wait, are they all renting wombs from poor women in India? So that they can have kids with their same fucked up, elitist, boring, plain looking DNA?  Delightful.  Yes, you are exactly the type of people who should be bringing babies into this world.   And yes, that was a really long aside.  I apologize.  I cannot help where my brain goes and I also WILL NOT EDIT MYSELF OR MY FEELINGS FOR ANY MAN OR WEBSITE!

Anyway, they'll wait days for standard brunch food alongside a couple of odd items like an egg scramble with tofu in it?  Err...okay.  Not much for vegans so you'll have to make due with oatmeal and fresh fruit.  I know, vegans.  Don't I KNOW.  Oh, they will make you a makeshift tofu-sans-egg scramble with SOYRIZO (!!!) which is good but somehow...lacking.  I dunno.  I just never really have an outstanding meal at Savor.  Oh and they give you a fuck ton of food and this is coming from a fattie so you know they mean business.  Well played, Savor.  

In closing, it's a superior brunch alternative to you know, Denny's.  No, that's cruel.  It's good.  I just wouldn't wait in line till the next lunar eclipse for a table.  Oh and if you can get a seat outside in the back on a sunny day, that's where it's at.
author: Laura B.

description: Descent brunch.  I am not sure if it is worth the long weekend wait, but the severs are sweet and the portions are big.  I did treat myself today~ Nutella, chocolate, banana and strawberry crepe with ice cream and whipped cream.  Pure heaven, and this was after I had the eggs benedict with sauteed onions and spinach.  Oink.
author: Stacy R.

description: I can't figure out why this place is so popular. The restaurant itself  is fairly pleasant, but the food and service are sub par. I've been here twice, once for breakfast and again for lunch. All of the breakfast/brunch items look awesome on the menu, but fail to impress once you have the food in front of you. I got some kind of omelet for breakfast, and it was just okay. When I went for lunch, I got the chicken club. The bread was really soggy like it had been saturated with butter. The home fries that came with it were undercooked. Our waiter was nice, but very slow and a bit spacey. I live down the street and don't know if I'll ever go back. We need better brunch spots in Noe! Maybe I'm just spoiled because I've been going to Zazie in Cole Valley which has the most delicious brunch on earth.
author: Jenny R.

description: Very good for breakfast and brunch. I got a crepe that was stuffed full and it came with salad and roasted potatoes. It was really busy and they had a little trouble figuring out who was supposed to wait on me but it got figured out, and they were very friendly about it.
author: Tim R.

description: Jared, you're wrong.  It's actually gotten better, when was the last time you were there.  New manager has perked up the place; employees are happy, customers are happy... if only we could do something about all those strollers in the isles...  Outside patio is by far one of the hottest brunch places in SF. And btw, the el paso is the best hangover cure one could come up with.
author: Laura S.

description: Everything I've ever had here (which has always been omelettes and crepes, I'm not sure why you'd want to order anything else here) has been delicious.  Huge portions of amazingness.  Great staff.  More than appropriate prices, atmosphere and menu for the neighborhood.
author: Emma A.

description:
Had lunch today; first time since we always have breakfast there on our frequent trips to SF. Just like bkfast, lunch was great. I had the soft shell crab sandwich and hubbie had fish tacos-both very, very good.
Our waitress, name I forget but might have been Letitia or Letisio was
fabulous! She just made the whole experience special and calmed us down as we steamed while we waited for our very late friends. 
Savor rocks!
author: Alan R.

description: I am sorry - a brunch place without REAL BACON?!?!?! Are you effin kidding?! What's the point? I like some of their food, but all I wanted was a BLT...they could not supply. Hey, and I even LIKE Canada, but canadian bacon is no substitute for the sweet sweet treat that is authentic bacon.
author: Jessa B.

description:
good salad, i had the bangkok which was not bad. the chicken kabobs on the salad had good flavor and the spicy lemon grass vinaigrette topped it off nicely. the patio seating in the back is nice and with the heat lamps the chill is taken away. another time i had a sandwich and damn if i can't remember it. most likely because it wasn't memorable.

for those who know noe valley the strollers are all over. baby making part of town for sure. the time i was at savor they had baby stroller valet parking. man that was funny. they thought of it all.
author: roger b.

description: This is a really nice place for brunch or lunch in Noe Valley, and is especially pleasant on a nice day if you wait for a place to sit in their back courtyard. The do very nice crepes and have an extremely attentive staff. Dig in!
author: Gregor G.

description: Excellent brunch spot. Too bad it's in Noe Valley, I rarely find myself there. Great menu selection of tasty and interesting food stuffs. Had lunch there & the server was very annoying, there's a decent wine list that he made us work our own way through. Had a fairly delicious apple, goat cheese & candied nut salad. The bff had a sandwich that I think she inhaled without noting flavor, she took the other half home.
author: Colleen B.

description: The crepes are awesome. The atmosphere is fun. I love the patio. Even my mom likes it. I avoid it during busy times.
author: Cate F.

description: Tasty! Especially the San Francisco crepe - salmon, spinach, capers, red onion. Very simple but delicious. Also, if you are a small short person like me, you probably want to split the portion - the crepe is huge and bursting with fillings, plus it comes with potatoes and a salad. But the portion is very fair for the price. Another plus - here's an outdoor patio for warm days.
author: K T.

description: Ive eaten here a few times. The food is delicious and the atmosphere is very intimate.
author: Angela T.

description: cool place. I love brunch food and this has got it!  I had the corned beef hash and it was huge and intimidating, but I handled the situation and was left very satisfied. If I am in the neighborhood, which I never am but should and will be more, I will pay another visit.  They have a patio area too, wonder if they allow dogs there....anybody know?
author: Aristocles P.

description: The fruit in my fruit salad was moldy...yeah, that's nasty. I already have some of that in my fridge from Safeway, no need for more.
author: Jenna W.

description: Deee-licious! I had a salsa-y sour creamy one and the wife had a pesto chicken, while mama had I forget. Great service and cool space. I likey!
author: Chris E.

description:
ZERO STARS!
Today was a sad day.  My husband and I wandered up to Savor for brunch, as we've done for many, many Sundays for five years now.  It's always been fantastic- service, food, atmosphere were always 5 stars.  It was the only place we went for brunch.  David, the manager, was consistently friendly and courteous, even when they were slammed (which is all the time).  Today was different.  There's a new manager now (named Zaid, FYI), who apparently is the cousin of the owner.  According to our waitress, David has been demoted to just "waiter".  
They messed up my order by giving me an omelette instead of a scramble.  I wasn't going to say anything, but then I noticed onions, which I specifically asked them to leave out.  When I sent it back, the waitress apologized and took it to the cook.  Two minutes later, Zaid brought my original plate back to me, claiming that I was wrong- although it was obviously an omelette, he basically said I was crazy and that it was a scramble (even though my husband was actually eating a scramble and it looked completely different).  It was totally humiliating that he brought my plate back and tried to tell me I was wrong.  At that point I my appetite had left me, so I told our waitress to just cancel my order.  In the meantime, Zaid came back with a scramble and he and my husband got into it.  My husband told him we had been loyal customers for years and had never been treated that way.  Zaid shrugged his shoulders and walked away.  As we left, my husband saw him again, and said, "I hope you're happy- you just lost two loyal customers."  Zaid yelled after us, "Yes, I AM happy!" Yikes, crazy!
author: Elena W.

description: I've been to Savor twice. The first time I had a really damn good salad (the one with Thai chicken or something like that). The other time I got a crepe which was way less impressive. It had pesto, chicken, sun dried tomatoes and a load of grease. I can handle some grease but this left me feeling pretty grossed out after I ate it. Not a good thing. I've had no issues with the staff but knowing how crowded this place gets, I'm not surprised at all. I would go back for that salad though, it's one of my favs I've found in the city so far.
author: margot b.

description: How many places cook a burger exactly how you want it? Savor does ... consistently! I have a picky eater in my household and nothing but a precisely cooked "medium-well" done burger will satisfy. The El Dorado burger comes with crisp, not oily fries and a side of salad greens on the plate. A bit difficult to find the burger on the menu, but it's listed under sandwiches. I enjoy the menu variety. The waiters and waitresses are always quick on refilling our coffee cups too without asking, multiple times, even though we can tell they are a bit rushed serving others. I left a nice tip, they deserved it.
author: Shelley F.

description: Have I mentioned that the crab cake is served on eggs benedict? If you are a crab cake fan, you gotta try it.
author: Ervinna L.

description: I received a text message "  "Savor for dinner?".  I said yes, but with fear.   Last time I ate there the dinner was a blah (see previous review).  This time, I split the hamburger and it wasn't so bad.  Something the hubby could have made at home, but at least we didn't have to do the dishes.
author: michele g.

description: Good overall, venue, food quality and brunch option.  A big draw for the stoller crowd.  We enjoy taking our family and friends here.
author: I have something to say... A.

description:
I've lived in San Francisco for going-on three years, and the one thing that finally got me out to Noe Valley (aside from various after-dark house parties, which totally don't count) was Savor.  And while Noe Valley was worth the wait and lived up to all my expectations (puppies and babies everywhere!), I'm not sure that Savor did: It was a little too run-of-the-mill to merit the hype; brunch spots like Savor abound, and much closer to home than 24th and Who-Knows-Where.*

*Longest sentence ever.  Longer even than the wait for a table at Savor.
author: Hannah J.

description: Ah Savor, my most despised Noe Valley restaurant. They seemed to have a lot of trouble with temperature when I went. The orange juice was warm (not cold or room-temp, but warm), the French toast was cold and so was the syrup. That combined with a practically nonexistent wait-staff made this one of my worst dining experiences ever (and I've eaten at a Denny's full of drunk teenagers). :)
author: Brad L.

description: The food here is decent.  It's kind of like a nicer Crepevine where you don't have to order at the register, you sit down and someone waits on you.  The crepes are pretty delicious, especially the sweet crepes.  A good place to go for brunch.
author: H. A.

description:
Savor is in one of the nicest restaurant spaces in Noe Valley--the outdoor patio is lovely on a sunny day, and even in the fog it's protected enough to be enjoyable.  The place is clean and the decor is nice too.

We went on a Tuesday at noon and had wonderful service from a warm, friendly and efficient waiter.  The host was friendly too.  

I had the Santa Barbara crepe--salmon, red onion, spinach, havarti, capers, YUM!  It was delicious!  The salmon was in 1-inch chunks, not little slivers like smoked salmon would be, but it was flavorful and not at all dry.  I'm quite picky about home fries, and these were good--small enough chunks so that they're not all dry and flavorless in the middle, a good golden crunchiness but not burned, etc.  They didn't taste aMAZing but they were a damn sight better than the usual huge herbed-up burned chunks that you find in most crepe places.  

The salad on the side was just OK, nothing super special, just a plain vinaigrette-type dressing on some mixed greens. 

The coffee was delicious!

Overall, I'd say that Savor is a good place to eat, a decent value for the neighborhood, and a lovely outdoor place to bring friends, especially out-of-town guests on a sunny day.  Trick them into thinking of San Francisco as a cozy, sunny place where outdoor brunch is always possible!
author: Lorelei S.

description: I think company makes this place perfection. Very simple good food. Stick to the salads and sandwiches. I was surprised at the pulled pork sandwich. It was really good. Huge serving of salad and home fries makes the $10 price worth it. This is your regular neighborhood joint and you should enjoy coming here with your favorite people.
author: Cristina R.

description: I know, I know, you love Savor's  brunch's.  Well here's a little-known fact.  This baby-strollered, dog-tied eatery serves the best burgers in the city, beating out such venerable places as Harry's, Lills's, Barney's, Burger Joint, Zeitgeist, In-N-Out, Home, and Burgermeister.  Yep; I've enjoyed burgers at all of them and Savor takes home the crown.  Mmmmm... juicy and flavorful and ready for your big, fat mouth.
author: Scott W.

description: Savor is one of my local neighborhood favorites! Be planful on the weekends as sometimes there can be a line outside the door. But once seated... either inside our outside on their heated patio, be sure to order the Corn Bread with Jalapeno jelly... SO GOOD! While their sandwiches and pankcakes are good... you can never go wrong with the egg scrambles, I opt for either the Rio Grand with goat cheese or the Baja for a more spicy option. Service can be hit or miss when it comes to speed... but they always seem to make up for it in kindness.
author: Matt O.

description: This place is SO over rated. It's just Ok. Everytime I go there I expect it to be better than it is, but I usually feel sick after the meal is over. The food's just Ok. I suppose it's a nice enough neighborhood restaurant where the whole family can agree on the menu, so if you aren't interested in great food, go on ahead. I think the best thing about this restaurant is that they have an outdoor patio.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Great brunch spot and easily accommodating to larger parties (4+).  Tons a great choices from sweet or savory crepes to killer scrambles and even more killer eggs benny variations.  Mimosas to boot and its a party.
author: Chard M.

description: Super yummy and we didn't have to wait an hr. to be seated!!!  This is always a plus.  Brunch there on Sunday was delicious!!! I had such a monster breakfast there was plenty to take home for left overs.  The Rio Grande, I think that's what is it called.  It was a scramble w/ spinach, chevre, sun dried tomatoes, chicken, etc. was awesome!!!  My pals had the pancakes w/ strawberry preserves and the crab cake eggs benny.  Apparently the flap jacks were a huge hit!!!  I would for sure go back, as the service was very nice and breaky was delicious!
author: Nicole F.

description: This is another one of our "go-to" places, especially for our occasional weekend breakfast out.  We've been coming here for years.  The food and service is consistently good.  I've tried many things on the breakfast and lunch menu.  My favorite for breakfast is the Rio Grande scramble.  I love the homemade jams they bring to the table for your side of toast.  Both the savory and sweet crepes are good choices too.  OMG!  the jalapeno cornbread is something not to be missed.  Love the casual atmosphere and the portions are huge.  I hear you can get a half-order of the French Toast if you can't handle a full order.
author: Julie D.

description: Savor has gone way downhill. It used to be a regular standby for a good brunch whenever I could stave off the bf's hAnger long enough to get him to wait to be seated. Their home fries were delicious and the outside patio's a definite plus. The last two times I went here were both disappointing. The first time the service was slow and the home fries were greasy. The second time the waitress didn't put in our order and we waited for over an hour while she blamed the kitchen. Then when our food did arrive it was cold. I think she comped us our coffee. Thanks. Now, it's possible my review is colored by hearing about the kid who puked all over a table after too many pancakes, and only  a cursory wipedown of the table was given, but really, I think it's because Savor got too big for its britches.
author: Leah S.

description: Four stars based on the nutella and bananas crepe I had. I suspect the place is mediocre at best, but this crepe was breathtaking.
author: Joe C.

description: This place is OK, but it is overrated. The portions are also ridiculously big, almost obscenely so. I would check out Toast or Casa Mexicana for some good alternatives. If you do eat here go for the patio... otherwise not worth the wait.
author: John B.

description: I am still exploring the Noe Valley restaurants and have been walking past this one for a while and then finally went in for a nice weekday breakfast on a day off.  The decoration and atmosphere was great.  The crepes are amazing along with the french toast.  In fact, everything we got was fantastic and had a lot of flavor.  The prices are a tad steep ($9-12), but the amount of food you get makes up for that.  If I would have planned ahead, I could have totally taken some back to the fridge.  Next time...
author: Chris M.

description: This place is great! Has a lovely backyard patio that I hadn't noticed from the street, beautiful spot. There was no wait for brunch Sunday at 11am which was great, and service was super prompt. Food was tasty too!
author: Sarah Y.

description: Wow! Great brunch spot in Noe Valley! It has spacious indoor seating as well as outdoor! I can't wait to come back when it warms up in the city. The menu selection here is great! It ranges from omelettes, scrambles, french toast, pancakes, crepes, sandwiches, and salads! Yes.. that many choices. I was pretty torn on what to get, but decided on the Cinnamon walnut french toast! It came with 6 slices, huge! The bread was really delicious, with tiny bits of walnuts, so you get the right amount of crunch and flavor. I'm coming back for sure soon!
author: Denise L.

description: Good solid breakfast food.  And a lot of it.  Had the eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast.  The toast is excellent.  Also had a mimosa, which was fine.  People are nice.  Only reason I didn't give it four stars is because the menu never changes.
author: Kevin M.

description: Noe Valley spectacular, a really cute patio outback shaded with trees and heatlamps in case too cold.   great service, good selection of crepes and different salads
author: Jordan V.

description: Attentive staff and nice setting.  Just don't get seated outside in either far corner.  Food is good for the most part.  Potatoes can be hit or miss.  Great salad selection.  Best Mimosas!
author: Sas C.

description: Seems like there are pretty mixed reviews of this place- I had a decent experience here, today. I had the swedish pancakes, and they were really good. Everything on the menu sounded so good, and I had a hard time deciding. I did notice that the prices were kind of on the high side for breakfast, though. Oh, and we didn't have any problems getting a seat outside right away, but it did seem like the waiter was rushing us.
author: Ashly M.

description: I am an even bigger fan of Savor's than I was before. The Charming Foreigner and I had our wedding rehearsal dinner on the patio and everyone had such a fabulous meal and a great time. Savor spruced things up for us and the service and food were great. We gave our guests the option of vegetarian risotto, chicken, trout, or steak, and the feedback we got from our very "foody" families was all positive. Personally, the panko-breaded trout at Savor is my favorite cooked fish dish at any SF restaurant. :)
author: akimbo j.

description: I've grown up with Savor and I love it. The food is great, the portions are huge and the prices are so good. I love breakfast at anytime of the day, and this is my favorite place for breakfast morning, noon and night.
author: Bobby P.

description: Took family from New York City for brunch this past Sunday and loved it.  We had my three year old nephew in tow with us and the staff couldn't have been nicer or more attentive. There's a large selection on the menu to choose from.   The food was great, we all had omelettes.  I ordered the Tsunami omelette (vegan).  Delicious!  And then we ordered a sweet crepe to share.  Can't remember the name of the crepe, it's the one with coconut and marscapone.  It was to die for!!!!   We sat in the outdoor seating area in the back, gorgeous day for it .  It was all good.  I would highly recommend Savor for their brunch.  I've never eaten any other meal there so couldn't tell you, but brunch they know how to do.
author: Magdalena ..

description: Everything is average!  The menu does a good job in describing everything and, I won't lie, I've been a sucka and ordered the same thing like 3 times because of the description but it's always "BLAH"............  It's edible, decent priced and decent choice for a last minute bite.
author: Justin C.

description:
Not the kind of place I would normally recommend, but it really is pretty good.  Big menu of standard sandwhiches, innovative crepes, predictable breakfast.  Not as boring as a diner, but not French Bistro either.

Try the Jerusalem sandwich!  A great variation on a chicken shawerma / pita roll up.  Tuna sandwich is also very good.  

HOWEVER, not worth waiting in a line for.  Why do people do that?
author: Zack S.

description: The Jalepeno Corn Bread... to die for!  This is one of my favorite and most frequently visited eateries.  I usually get the Jalepeno Corn Bread with one of  their yummy salads.  If i am really hungry I go for the Kyoto Crepe, love tofu!
author: Diane V.

description: Savor has been a staple in my dining out repertoire for years.  I ADORE the corn bread with the jalapeno jelly-  SERIOUSLY amazing.  I recently had some of my friends from England in for a visit-  we went to many spots to eat out, both posh and dive, and Savor was their #1 fave over all!  The only reason that I am not giving a complete five star review is that the last time we went, the service was HIDEOUS, a curse I seem to be having in the Noe Valley area lately.  However, the specials are always great, if you go to dinner-  the ceviche is especially good.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
the first time i had brunch here, i thought i was in love.  the food was perfect, the atmosphere cozy, the coffee strong and good.  love.

the second visit, not so much love any more.  my friend's pancakes were uncooked in the middle.  battery.  not buttery- that might have been tasty- battery.  as in batter and not cake.  my scramble was fine- not fantastic- and the egg to ingredient ratio was way, way, way off.

so all in all... savor is ok.  great if you are in the area and want to take your chances...
author: Samantha W.

description: Huge menu, large portions, everyone can find something here. Service is good and very prompt. Food is good but doesn't stand-out. Went for dinner and everything was good but nothing was "wow". Looks like it is a solid brunch place though.
author: Audrey N.

description: One of my favorite breakfast/brunch places in town.  Their crepres are excellent; not too sweet but very satisfying.  Love their omelettes too.  Staff are all friendly and cozy atmosphere.
author: Mami S.

description: I went here for breakfast with friends and it was all that!  I had La Suisse French Toast with bacon and orange juice.  It filled me up and I didn't get heart burn!  My friends enjoyed their meals as well.  I heard and read it gets busy after 9am, so we arrived around 830.  Our waitress was nice and we sat in the backyard area.  All in all, it was a great experience and one that I would definitely recommend.
author: Shaun W.

description: This was our second time to Savor for brunch, and I'm glad we returned.  I had the Granada salad with grilled eggplant (they freely do substitutions), and my partner, being the contrarian, decided on a dessert and ordered the Jamaican - a banana-filled crepe with vanilla ice cream.  Both were delicious, but the portions are huge so their were leftovers.  And, the wait staff is friendly, attentive and energetic.  We'll be back!
author: Rick B.

description: this place is your standard brunch with a spanish twist i guess - the mimosa's are huge so one is just right, they give you soo much food so your never going to finish it unless your a heifer but u never know. The food is great everytime, its very consistent. Try the eggplant crepe its exxxxcellent.
author: Tony G.

description: Nice location in Noe. Great food defi try the Baja eggs with extra avocado. Parking's a pain. Make reservations 30min prior to getting there on a weekend (ask for Adrian and he should oblige)
author: pratik j.

description: I ordered the special: Ravioli with a Tomato Cream Sauce. I unfortunately had to take off a few stars for this one. It was inedible. I mean Really Bad. I cant remember the last time I went to a restaurant and could not eat what I ordered.
author: Rosie M.

description:
Recently went back to this restaurant after several years. It has definitely lost its luster. Food was o.k. but once cute back patio has been 'de-flowered' and looks a little depressing with its faded plastic seats. Where did all the pretty plants go?

Also I agree with Monkey S. that the surcharge is bullshit. If you're going to make a 'protest' then let me know before I sit down to eat. I've never heard of a business trying to foist off the expenses of a basic human right 
and then make the consumer feel guilty about the ambush. Providing healthcare should be an employers responsibility not foisted onto the consumer. Presenting this in the guise of a 'protest ' is even worse.  If that means increasing prices go ahead and if I can't afford to eat there I wont. 

Congratulations Savor in extorting your 'protest' from me. Pay your own bills from now on and don't expect me or any other consumer to pity you. That's the last dollar you'll get from me.
author: james P.

description:
the whole staff was extremely friendly. the location was great. it was extremely busy but we went during brunch on a sunday... even still, they were able to accommodate a party of 4 and a baby in great time. i ordered an omelette (the monte carlo plus added mushrooms) and i was in shock when they brought out my plate. i swear, i could've fed a family of four!! i looked at my friends' and husband's plates and theirs looked exactly like mine. mostly everyone was satisfied with their meals - my husband and one girlfriend both ordered crepes (i forget the name.. the one with the salmon in it) and they loved it. my other girlfriend ordered a pulled bbq pork sandwich and she wasn't too pleased with it. it was overloaded with sauce.. so much so that she could not even taste her meat! ... she's been there before, though, and was satisfied with whatever else it was that she ordered. 

overall, great restaurant. you definitely get what you pay for (and more) as far as those portions go!
author: PauLine R.

description: It's been several months since I've been here.. perhaps July. But the beet salad & wine were delish! Service seemed pretty good. I'll definitely go back.
author: Tracy C.

description: The last time I went here I was flying high as a kite due to some special truffles I ate at Dolores Park. While I have normally stuck with the standard crepe fare that Savor churns out, this time I went with the ceviche and some other stuff that I can't remember anything about except that it tasted good. If it's a nice day, sit on the patio, have an iced tea, and enjoy!
author: Chris B.

description: Everything on 24th street seams to very pricey. If you are craving a big meal (brunch or breakfast) then I would say come here. Although on a windy day it can get chilly if you are sitting outside. The heaters don't do much against the wind. I have only had there Crepes their and I think they are delicious. I had the Milano crepe which was packed with artichoke hearts. It became a little too salty by the end. Their selection on food is limited to egg dishes, crepes, sandwiches and salads. There salads look huge along with their sandwiches. My mom loves this place, and I think its ok. Guess it depends on your tastes.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Having succummed to gluttony here (religiously!) for the last handful of years you'd think I would have owned some stock in this place by now! I've become biased and critical in my search for a great breakfast joint - and this place is the reason why! No other place in town can hold a torch against this one and I can honestly say that I have not been able to find another brakfast place that surpasses this. Some places run a close second, but this place is by far TOPS! I'll even surrender myself to it by rolling out of the house on a weekend afternoon, still half asleep and slightly hung over wearing no makeup at all (gasp!)and dark sunglasses to hide my bloodshot eyes with a desperate need of changing that dry, parched, ashtray taste in my mouth, I acquired from my previous night's mistakes and disguising it with something more savoring (no pun intended) and flavorful knowing that there will most likely be a minimum 20 minute wait for a table (sometimes the wait is not that long). But I know that the wait is worth it, at least I know that I can depend on the complimentary coffee waiting for me at the door to sustain my patience and waken my tastebuds. And to top it all off, there is one of the cutest little patios around town. So.... about the food:

Awesome breakfast! Savor makes the best breakfast scrambles, omelets and crepes in town, all of which are hefty in portion and are served with either a salad or rosemary potatoes - and let me tell you, they do have the BEST rosemary potatoes! They've truly got it down and just know how to roast them the right way (better made than some other breakfast joints i have gone to, which shall remain nameless at least for the purpose of this review) and would make Emerill Lagazzi take note. You'll also find a good selection of sandwiches and large salads as well which are also very tasty; along with fresh squeezed orange juice, mimosas and good coffee. In short, the menu is very extensive and items such as The Baja, The Tsunami, The Barcelona, The Tuscany provide unique tastes that will satisfy any taste or craving you may have.

 If you are having breakfast, forget about the bacon, you won't find it here, so get over it! who needs bacon anyway when your served hearty and flavorful portions to chow down on?!
author: NirvAnna M.

description:
My friend Camila and I came here on a Saturday night around 7:30 p.m. 

There was no wait, we were seated and waited on immediately. Hence, star #1.

I noticed the soup of the day was clam chowder. Ordered a bowl and decided that I had died and gone to homemade clam chowder heaven. Bring on star #2.

Consistent refills of drinks, and the "just right" amount of inquiries into whether or not our food was ok and if we needed anything. Star #3.

Then, the french dip came. Delicious beef topped with bleu cheese and caramelized onions on a crunchy baguette with a side of caesar salad. All for only $10? Star #4.

Good thing we didn't stay for dessert and coffee... I might run out of stars to give.
author: Jovi C.

description: Yummy salads, grilled chicken, crepes, and sandwiches. Good lunch spot to meet up with a friend/family. Can be a bit of a wait but it always goes faster than you think it will be.
author: Kyla L.

description: I really liked Savor.  We walked in on a Monday night and were seated immediately.  We decided to share a salad, which was huge and enough for the both of us.  We sat in the back outside, as the weather was gorgeous.  Overall, a really fun night with good food.
author: Joanna S.

description: Savor is my favorite breakfast/lunch place in the city.  Just go.  It's worth it - especially the New Orleans - crab benedict.  Yummy.  Be prepared for a line at breakfast but lunch during the week is usually a walk in experience.  The line is worth it - they provide coffee as you wait and it's 24th street - great window shopping.
author: Shannon M.

description: Decent brunch but not as good as the hype -  lines can be long. Go down the street to Chloe's if you can.
author: Jon B.

description: We had a funny waiter.  He took our orders and then came by 5 minutes later and asked, "I have a question about your order.... What was your order?"  Other than that, he was very good.  He was pleasant, the service there was great.  The weather was so beautiful in SF yesterday so we sat in the patio. I had the Milano (vegetarian) crepe filled with eggplant, artichoke hearts, mushroom, onions, roasted garlic!  Yummy!  The side orders of salad was very good because the dressing was just right.  Most restaurants tend to saturate their salad with dressing, but mine was just right.  A great start to a very nice and relaxing day.
author: Grace L.

description: For some reason this place is always busy.  The food is average at best.  I really wanted to like this place and have gone at least 10 times ordering different meals.  I love Noe Valley for weekend brunch, but probably won't be returning to Savor if Toast can seat me faster.  The eggs benedict dishes are pretty good, and that's about it.  If you do make it out to Noe Valley for breakfast and end up at Savor, don't miss out on the freshly baked muffins!
author: Katie S.

description: I am definitely a fan of this place.  I usuallyt come here hung over on Saturday morning and love the large breakfast they have to offer.  Their benedicts and scrambles are creative and delicious.  24th st has some very tough competition for breakfast nooks and I find myself continuing to come back to this one.
author: Cali Party Bus S.

description: Mmmm. Hot corn bread with jalapeno jelly. Breakfast all day long. Vanilla pancakes. Too much food on a plate. Heaven. Mmmm.
author: Billy A.

description: We went on Easter Sunday for lunch and it was quite busy, but we only had to wait about 20 minutes. We had taken a Bar Method exercise class that morning so we were starving! I had the Tuscany Savory Crepe and it was amazing! Huge portions plus it came with Home Potatoes and Mixed Greens that were equally as good. It really hit the spot. They have a huge menu so it was really hard to narrow down what I wanted. My friend had the Mazatlan Savory Crepe and was equally as happy. Our server was friendly and efficient for being such a busy day. Although the people next to us had a different waiter and he was terrible! I will be back next time I am in town!
author: Kari S.

description: I would say the food at Savor is very good--not fantastic, but solidly good. I am a big fan of this place, though, because they are so kid-friendly. The kid's menu is very affordable and well loved by my daughter. They are very accomodating to families, and the food and atmosphere is nice.
author: Jiga M.

description:
Breakfast was great but not fantastic.  Was not impressed by the fact that one of the (unisex) restrooms were out of order (PostScript: never is a big fan of unisex bathroom). 

Had the baja scramble with lots... and lots... and lots... of tabasco sauce.  It was tasty yet easily forgettable.  Service was prompt yet not outstanding.  Tables are a *tad* too close together but I can see why the owner of this place would do it - the place does get busy on the weekends! 

The one saving grace about this place is the neighborhood in which it is situated.  And probably the portion.  

I'll spend my hard-earned money on La Taza in the MIssion.
author: Ange L.

description:
BEST CORNED BEEF HASH IN SAN FRANCISCO

Sit outside and enjoy breakfast - the corned beef hash has real chunks of tender corned beef, onions, potatoes and even some green pepper.  Best I have ever had!!!
author: larry b.

description:
I love Savor.  The menu has great variety, the prices are good, the portions are big enough to share.  The patio is lovely on a nice day.  Sitting inside can suck because, like everywhere in Noe Valley, you can't throw a fork without hitting a screaming toddler, and the high ceilings really echo.  I used to live a block from this place and ate there just about weekly. The service varies from excellent to lousy, depending on who you get.  However, they're generally friendly and accomodating. 
I especially recommend the entree salads and the pumpkin pancakes.
author: Sarie L.

description: Perhaps my favorite breakfast place in town. Their scrambles and crepes are awesome and huge. Make sure and fast before coming here. Nice patio at the back for the summer, fireplace inteh winter. Pretty large but has a nice cosy feel. Staff are friendly, service is prompt. I have only been here on weekday mornings so can't comment on the wait.
author: Stuart J.

description: I'm so glad we decided to go to Savor for dinner...breakfast truly hits the spot any time of the day, I finished every last bite of my meal.  It's hard to tell from the outside but Savor is a lot more intimate towards the back with a nice, warm fireplace.  Another plus was the friendly service with a smile.
author: Debbie Y.

description: I came here with a couple of friends for lunch the other day. Our main goal was to eat outdoors and enjoy this hot unusual weather we've been having. Savor came to mind. I copied Claire and ordered the Tuscany crepe with a side salad. Claire said that it's what she orders all the time, and so I copied. Sorry Claire! It didn't live up to it. The flavor wasn't there for me. Next time, I'll have something else. Julie seemed to enjoy her salad with seared ahi tuna on top. She practically licked the plate clean! So the 3 stars go for the outdoor seating on that nice hot day and very friendly staff!
author: Anne E.

description: NOTHING TO SAVOR at savor.  Absolutely terrible experience. Chefs yelled at each other so loudly you couldn't talk or hear others as well as banging plates loudly. Chili was bland and tasteless, my friend ordered a steak and fries -the steak was raw and the fries were greasy. She was sick all night long and i felt ripped off by the experience.
author: melody m.

description: Savor is a great neighborhood place for lunch, or brunch if you can stand the wait. Great salads, savory crepes, and a yummy black bean soup is always on the menu. Good service and no attitude - perfect!
author: Mariangela S.

description: Brings back some good memories for me enjoying Sunday brunch here.  i love eating on the patio.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: I've been in love with Savor since my teens when my girls and I decided HS was for the birds. I will never abandon my favorite lazy day creperie - it got me through many a mundane and restless day my senior year!
author: Rebecca M.

description: Tasty Food, Good Service: I was there for breakfast. I had the crepes with pecans & cinnamon. The waiter was very nice and the inside was pleasant.
author: Randy W.

description: I love this place.  The food is always so fresh and tasty.  I recommend the sandwiches and the salads, in particular the chicken pesto sandwhich and the greek salad both are very tasty.  I have also had the french toast for breakfast which are also amazing.  The bloody mary's are huge and delicious.  The outdoor seating is very pleasant.  The only downside is the service is a bit slow.
author: Alex E.

description: Here's a JARED that thinks Savor is excellent.  We had the pumpkin spice pankcakes, scrambled eggs, and chicken apple sausage.  Everything was GREAT, especially the pancakes.  It's in a beautiful locale so check it out for yourself
author: Jared F.

description: I went here mid-afternoon one day to avoid the ridiculous weekend crowds. I have to say, I couldn't understand what all the hype was about. The food is good but the entire menu bears an uncanny resemblance to other city creperies such as Squat and Gobble or Crepevine. Not sure what all the fuss is about. I'd also recommend Chloe's or some of the other little cafes on 24th street over Savor.
author: Jill M.

description: Yum. The food was so good I continued to eat well after being full and then couldn't eat the rest of the day. There is so much to choose from - from traditional breakfast to different dishes. Recommend checking it out.
author: elizabeth s.

description: I have never understood the appeal of this place. On weekends there's always a line and the food is really not very good. The service is is not great either. I've been back a few times thinking that I might have hit an off day or night but nope, the food is just not that good to justify the lines. For brunch or breakfast, I'll take Joe's over Savor any day. Good, simple food with none of the noe valley attitude.
author: Reza E.

description: Good food. Remember to get the seat next to the fireplace. Staff is always PARTICULARLY good which is really appreciated. If you have an aversion to rich whites don't go but i had the good fortune of sitting next to a date dinner with some very young people and it was good people watching. Skews old usually. Can be fffing cold by the window. Try the salmon salad. Sort of the denny's for yuppies...
author: Bubble B.

description: I have been here two or three times and always thought the food was DELICIOUS and reasonably priced.  Big portions and friendly service.  My favorite thing about this place is the patio area out back.  CUTE.
author: Sleuthy W.

description: I can count on Savor to be pretty consistent; but consistently just okay.  It's nothing to write home about.  I do love the Mango Iced Tea, though.
author: Tamar D.

description: Went here over the weekend for brunch.  Pretty packed but cool atmosphere.  Staff & waitress were friendly & attentive.  I had the Barcelona crepe which was good not great.  My friend had the New Orleans Benedict which was really good.  My daughter had the scrambled eggs & potatoes.
author: Natacha M.

description:
I've been here dozens of times over a lot of years. (I also really liked the prior two similar restaurants that were in this spot before it, waaaaaay long ago.) 
AMBIANCE: Nice, casual, friendly feel. Wood, tile, earth colors. Nice big outdoor patio for enjoying the outside.
FOOD: I've enjoyed so many things on their menu... delicious crepes (I just saw on the Crepevine website that Savor was also theirs!), creative and yummy salads, soups, fabulous breakfast "scrambles"...  Good quality coffee and lattes. There just isn't anything I've had there that I didn't enjoy.
SERVICE: Nice folks who do their best. Occasionally things might be a little slow when they're slammed... but that's understandable.
PRICE: Just as I'd expect. Not too much, not too little.
CONS: (But I'm not going to take away any stars...) Too bad the patio area has to be shared with other businesses... laundry, nails, whatever. It would be nicer if the cozy patio were private. The brunch crowd stands out on the sidewalk in front waiting to get in... it's a popular place on weekends, and just like all good places in the city, ya often gotta wait. Also, the bathroom door opens up uncomfortably in the middle of the restaurant, so I always feel paranoid that I need to check and double-check the lock, so that nobody opens up the door on me -- giving a site to a big crowd!
But I don't want to end on that note. I'm giving this place five stars because it consistently holds up as a high-quality neighborhood restaurant, providing yummy food, nice atmosphere and friendly folks.
author: Zoe H.

description: My Aunt, Uncle, and cousins were coming over from the East Bay for Breakfast and I had to find a good place to take them.  I quite honestly don't think I could have made a better choice.  The atmosphere was relaxed and casual.  We sat outside under shade provided by the awnings.  The food was excellent.  My relatives all got french toast (challah and traditional).  I got the Coronado omelet which was excellent (copious amounts of avocado).  Also, good strong coffee and friendly service at reasonable prices.
author: Dwight B.

description: Went there while visiting a friend. They have a nice little outdoor patio with a good vibe. Big portions that taste good. I had the Arizona omelette which was great and I really liked the bread. Our server was very attentive and kept the coffee flowing which is always a plus. I always hate having to flag down servers at brunch for coffee refills.
author: Karen D.

description: As my friend Angella (angellaellisha.yelp.com) said, Savor is definitely a top pick in Noe Valley. The atmosphere is friendly and the portions of food are very generous. I usually get one of the savory crepes which come with a salad and side of potatoes. Definitely stop by if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Alexander S.

description:
i have been a regular at SAVOR for over 10 years.
their menu includes great salads, hummus, crepes -- both savory and sweet and great brunches. i love their curry chicken salad, chicken shawerma, and pumpkin spice pancakes! (not all at the same time)
excellent wait staff... attentive, friendly and very welcoming.
they offer both inside and patio seating, so it's a great place on a nice day. the prices are reasonable, so i can afford to frequent savor often. 
for a local noe valley regular GO TO spot, SAVOR serves it right!
author: Betty M.

description: I'm not sure if the nay-sayers are going to the same place I am, but I've been there a handful of times now and it's always been good. The menu has a lot of options for the vegematarian in you, the idea of eggplant in my crepe has me drooling. You're going to pay Noe prices (~$9.25/plate) but it's plentiful in size and the rosemary potatos are awesome. Scramblers, omlets, salads, crepes (dinner and desert), sandwiches and a back patio that's secluded are all winners.
author: Troy E.

description: My mainstay in the neighborhood.  Whenever I'm craving a deep dive into satiation on a Sunday, I find myself at Savor ordering their Bodega Bay tuna melt; the sourdough is thick, the tuna is fresh and the cheese is mellow enough to marry, not overpower, the two.  Their salads are equally as good, but I rarely feel like being salubrious on the occasions that I go to Savor.
author: Grave Y.

description: Good breakfast spot, staff always friendly. Parking not bad weekday mornings.
author: Lisa S.

description:
it's not that i mind waiting 5 minutes to order, or mind a forgotten coffee here and there. it's not that a 5-10 minute wait taking 20 minutes is THAT big a deal.

but when the food is good, but fare from rare, why would i go through all that?
author: Seiji C.

description: I love coming here for breakfast.  I have never had to wait even on a Saturday (OK only once I had to wait for like 20 min), nice outdoor seating, great menu with lots to choose from, and great service.  This place is also kid friend which is good for me these days.
author: Michelle M.

description: There are certain brunch spots in the city that get busy and then there are brunch spots that get BUSY busy -- like Disneyland busy.  This is the Haunted Mansion of busy brunch locales (Pork Store is the Space Mountain).  The menu is pretty big, and the dishes themselves are even bigger.  I didn't think the Club Sandwich or their crepes were anything amazing, but they did the trick.
author: Tim G.

description:
very yummy veggie sandwich and friendly service.
also has a very cute courtyard to sit in.
author: Alexandra D.

description: Mmm - who doesn't love a good crepe!?  Their whole menu tastes really fresh and delicious, and they have great service.  I love sitting out on their patio on a warm-ish day (does it ever really get *that* warm here?). :)
author: Jenn K.

description: Great place for brunch! My friends and I went there a few weeks ago and I had a great salmon dish. It always seems busy on the weekends!
author: sonam d.

description: Great dinner! We had everything from the seafood chowder to tuna melt (was not given any shit for my individualized requests) to the porkchops to the sake. Everything was delicious, reasonably priced, and the service was great.
author: Laura M.

description: This place is very average. I wouldn't drive out of the way to come here but if you're spending the day walking around the little shops in Noe Valley then it wouldn't be a bad place to stop by. When I went I didn't have the breakfast food, so I can't comment on that. All I can say is that it is a very spacious restaurant and it was a very unmemorable experience.
author: Barbara O.

description: We read a review on Yahoo that said this place has the best breakfast in San Francisco.  Took a ride up on a Saturday morning from the South Bay to try it out and it was disappointing..  The Egg's Benedict was good, but the crepes weren't great & the servings were small.  Also, the menu options were limited.  Not enough pancakes/waffle type selection.
author: l. a.

description: We ran in for dessert and wine...it was all delicious and the wait staff was so attentive...we will be back real soon!
author: Sabina N.

description: Strolled into Savor on a Sunday morning.  I was pleasantly surprised at the variety of eggs benedict (personal favorite) that they offered.  I was perfectly satisfied with the meal that I ordered, however it was just plain mediocre.  Nothing truly stood out, but I really have nothing to complain about.  Since I was traveling from out of town, I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to come back to Savor but if it were down the street, I would maybe venture in here now and again for my eggs benedict fix.  Savor is a true 3-star establishment.
author: Kelly D.

description: A great place for sunday brunch. I always order the the San Francisco crepe. The corned beef hash is also fantastic. I'd give this place 4 stars if not for the fact that the service is so inconsistent. Sometimes, I've had attentive and friendly service. Other times, I've been ignored for what feels like hours, and other times the service can be downright hostile. I was once yelled at by the receptionist because she said I didn't make a reservation although I actually did. They have lots of outdoor seating which is nice on a sunny morning.
author: Eater S.

description: I enjoyed that there was an outdoor patio, the food was decent, but the fact that it took 15 mins to even get a glass of water takes this place down in stars. The waiter was perfectly nice, but everything was SO SLOW!  I just had a tuna sandwich so it was hard to mess up...the bread was good, and the fact that it comes with salad and country potatoes made me happy. I'll probably come back some day, but there are so many other options on this street that I will continue to explore for awhile.
author: Lisa K.

description: Savor is solid and always reliable for a good meal at a good price. Service is typically very good and the staff is friendly. The only negative are the rosemary potatoes that are served with everything; I like potatoes cooked very well done and they make them ahead of time so they can never cook them more for me. I usually order extra side salad instead of potatoes, which they accommodate without an extra charge.
author: J.J. P.

description: yummy local breakfast joint known for its wide variety of savory crepes, low prices, laarge portions, great breakfast options anytime, nice wait staff, and long lines on weekend mornings... we prefer to go for dinner to avoid the lines and see our favorite staffer, Tessa.  Try the cornbread w/relish!
author: K S.

description: Like many of the other reviews say, it's a great breakfast spot. If you like omelets, be sure to try them here. I had some of my best morning meals at this place. Portions are huge so come hungry. And be prepared to wait on a weekend morning because it can become pretty crowded.
author: Gene C.

description:
i have been here like maybe 5-6 times already but that was before my "yelping" days and since i have my friends from marin here in my hood with me i wanted them to try this.

carlos always order the same thing...if we go to ping's he orders kung pao chicken or the mongolian beef...he doesnt like to try new stuff (or maybe not sometimes with a little egging he will be a sport and try something new) now with fonzy although he's rambling "tacos or tostadas" or something like that i first thought of taking them to my "el farolito" but again its very rare that we do dine in the city i want them to try something new.

carlos : what kind of food do they serve?

malou : i dont know exactly, continental? fuzion? (huh?) all i know is the lamb shank is good and so are the crepes and the french toast too.

fonzy: i'll order the santa fe

carlos: what's curry? is it spicy?

malou : yes it is, its indian...

carlos: h*ll no, im not gonna order it then, how come it says singapore

malou: oh yeah they do have curry in singapore too. just try it. ah miss (server) what would you recommend?

ms server: the steak is good and so is the chicken marsala...but the singapore is good too i like it.

malou: ill have the lamb shanks please, thank you.

now judging by the plates after, i must say that i have not disappointed my guest from the other side of the bridge.

the service was superb, since ms server is always asking if everything is ok and we get the soda refills quick.

i give it a five star because i  think all the friends that i have brought here were never disappointed.

go check it our, the patio dining is good to on warm days.
author: Malou C.

description: I really like this place when it's not crowded.  The food has been consistantly good, I like the variety on their menu, and I can't forget to mention that their mimosas are generous in size and taste.  The ambiance is great.  For sunny days there is the patio, and for yucky days there is the fireplace indoors.  Now, back to the crowds.  Obviously they're doing something right because people want to come here, but, it's frustrating when you can't get in and that's usually the weekends.  During the week they do steady business but I don't think there's a problem finding a spot (at least I haven't had one), during the weekend...well, maybe try the off hours or prepare to be patient.
author: Kirsten F.

description: In answer to the question, Savor came before Crepevine, though they are owned by the same people. I recommend: The Golden Gate salad-- spring mix with orange vinaigrette and beets with gorgonzola cheese and caramelized walnuts. It comes with foccacia. The Barcelona crepe and the Milano crepe-- they come with fabulous potatoes and salad, quite a full meal.
author: Cleo B.

description: I have liked this place before, but my last brunch was a huge disappointment. My crab Benedict was topped with an undercooked soft boiled egg. Runny yolk is ok, but runny egg whites is a bit too much for me.
author: Keith J.

description: The food is consistently good, especially the salads and crepes.  The prices are even better for the portions served.  You can usually just walk in and get a table.  The wait staff is very helpful and nice.
author: Nadine H.

description: Great place to go for brunch with a group. Good service and good brunch food. If you call 30 mins ahead they will put your name down for a table so that you do not have to wait when you get there :)
author: Mitali D.

description: An awesome family-friendly brunch place.  Yummy food, attentive waitstaff, although the later you come the longer the wait.  They are awesome with kids, they make you feel good (instead of apologetic) about bringing your baby out to brunch.
author: Yvonne M.

description:
Nice ambiance. Large portions of food at a fair price. Variety of pancake choices too, which is nice change of pace.  

Service was efficent and friendly too.
author: Mya P.

description: There is usually a long wait if you go on the weekend for brunch. I have had breakfast twice. the first time I got the pumpkin spice pancakes which were yummy the next a standard eggs and toast kind of deal which was good.I got a lot of food and was able to give the homeless man on the corner a good meal as well. I really like this place for lunch or dinner. The salads and sandwhichs are really good. never had a crepe but the smelled good. The staff was very friendly
author: Carli M.

description: On a nice night, this is the place to go for patio dining on 24th. Get the cornbread with the jalapeno marmalade jelly for an app. Or a huge salad to split. If you're feeling all kinds of hunger, get the El Baron, medium. Avocado, cheddar, Jack, lettuce, tomato, grilled onions and mushrooms and 1/2 a pound of ground beef that gave this girl an instant heartburn. So worth it.
author: Genevieve R.

description: I have been going to Savor for years and no matter when I go or what I order it is always a great experience. The wait even on weekends is not very long and they offer free coffee to those of us who need morning caffeine while we wait for our table . The service is warm and capable, and they always treat me like a regular even though it can sometimes be a month in between visits. Especially good, is the Eggs Benedict made with crab cakes. I also like the scrambles. This place uses the best ingredients and the food always tastes fresh and delicious. The portions are perfect and the atmosphere is pleasant. I would recommend brunch there anytime. They even seem willing to accomodate large parties. I will continue coming here and I urge city-dwellers and surburbanites alike to make the trip.
author: Andrew D.

description: I can't believe I haven't reviewed Savor yet. It's in my neighborhood, so Donna A. and I come here often. The staff is so friendly and I've always enjoyed the food. Last night was no exception when Donna and I both couldn't resist the Trout special. It was fantastic. Stella on tap is a nice bonus as well. It does get crazy busy on the weekends though, so shoot for odd hours if you don't feel like waiting.
author: Chris R.

description: After three meals here, can safely say this is a 4 star restaurant. I love the Petra sandwich as well as the salads. Others who have eaten with me generally like the salads and sandwiches as well. Appetizer (mexa plate?) was so-so, and entree plates tend to be slightly better than average but not stellar. No experience with breakfast/brunch as we never leave the house before 11 on days off. Service has ranged from good to excellent. Hostess-types usually less than helpful and often look bored and disinterested. Overall, very good and consider it a consistent crowd pleaser.
author: Karin S.

description:
I have been here about five times and it's always been very good. Large portions. I have split entrees a few times when I wanted a lighter meal. Salads are large and very flavorful. I have had a few and modified them to add marinated tofu and another time salmon. The tofu wasn't in the best marinade, but I still enjoyed it. I have enjoyed several different crepes at breakfast as well really enjoyed the corned beef hash. Very flavorful with shredded corned beef. Also I like the tropical iced tea. I really don't have any complaints. The service was very good and attentive whether at busy brunch time or when it has been dead. I think I drank four large glasses of ice tea without realizing it as the waitress just kept filling my glass. At dinner I had a special of Oso Bucco and shared it with my husband. Very nice version and falling of the bone with tons of flavor.
Since SF has passed a new code that restaurants must cover health care for their employees I actually preferred that the $1 per person charge for this is listed as an additional cost rather than just raising their overall costs. When the bill arrived I got the waitresses attention and before I could start to inquire she said " Oh let me explain the SF Health charge" and then said " would you prefer that the overall menu items go up as I would be happy to let the owner know your preference." I don't prefer that. I would actually like to know that I am paying for that. However it would be nice if it was noted somewhere on the menu. It may be, but I didn't notice it.
author: Terri S.

description: We were just wandering around Noe Valley looking for someplace to eat when we stumbled upon Savor. It took the hostess about 30 seconds to get us a table and immediately, my cynical alarm bells went off. This couldn't be good. How could a place still have available seating at 7:30 on a Saturday night? Turns out my instincts were wrong this time. The server was sweet and attentive. Although there was nothing spectacular about the menu, the food was delicious and the servings were HUGE! I went out of there feeling satisfied and happy - exactly like I would after going to a big sale at the mall. Will definitely go back there and recommend the place to my friends.
author: Charles U.

description: My husband and I love going to Savor.  Their food is always great!  Service is also exceptional! We go with our 18 month old and they are very kid friendly.  She is always excited to see her Savor friends.  Its a must for us to try and have breakfast or lunch at least twice a month if not more often there
author: Serena S.

description: A friend of mine took me here recently. It was not a b-fast place I have tried before, since I usually frequent Pork Store or Crepevine, but I do have to mention that I had the best omelet there.  I don't normally order omelettes because the eggs are never cooked well, but this one was large, light and fluffy and chock full of ham and veggies.  So tasty!!!  And service was awesome, kid friendly.
author: Robin W.

description: Pretty much everything is good on the menu. I love their mocha. I also am a big sides person. I always order a side of potatoes, toast and ham or bacon. According to my husband all of the omlettes are good. Great service, no long wait, comfortable seating in or outside. The outside patio is delightful and is covered and heated! Inside is always warm and inviting. Great family place. Food is ALWAYS good. Just go here for breakfast, so good.
author: julie q.

description: Good omelletes and crepes. Avoid during the weekend as it is too crowded and there is a wait. Whenever DJ T-Rock is in town he always wants to go there so he can get the salad with salmon on top - his favorite. Their home potatos need work though...
author: David P.

description: Seems pretty consistent and the mimosas are big and made with odwalla orange juice.  However the last couple times I was there I left feeling unsatisfied so I won't be going back.  Plus they don't have regular bacon.  I mean they have Canadian bacon, how hard is it to add bacon to your menu?
author: b s.

description: A solid brunch treat. Good crepes, savory and sweet. Not trying to be  the fanciest place, but dependable good food. Would get four stars but the service seems to be a little too busy to take care of all the details. A nice patio on nice days.
author: Mark A.

description: For a neighborhood joint where you can walk in and usually get a table in a few minutes (except during weekend brunch, which, really, where *can* you get a table without waiting?), it's great.  I get the salads.  They accommodate well (I'm picky).  It's not too expensive.  Great service.  Good food.
author: jrig R.

description: Very good food for brunch, service is nice.  Patio was rainy but attempted to be cozy with the heat lamps.  I'd recommend it.
author: gary p.

description: I look forward to going to Savor a few times a year.  Sitting near the fireplace on cold days is great, as is sitting outside on nice ones.  I love the omelettes and crepes (New Orleans and the San Francisco, I think).  Although they took the frittata off the menu you can still request one.  Sunday brunch is way too busy for me.  The coffee, as I remember it, was only 'ok'.
author: Castro G.

description: I went back for brunch again recently and sat on the back patio for the first time.  Absolutely fabulous!  Great atmosphere, great food, and great service!
author: TK B.

description: As a bus kid, sometimes I end up at places that only muni takes me.  On this fateful New Year's Day, I got into Noe Valley, thanks to a friend with a car.  We went to Savor for an early dinner, and it was definitely enjoyable.  Sweet ambiance, delicious food, and fairly decent service.  My friend got the New Orleans, which involved a version of eggs benedict--only with crab cakes and a spicy hollandaise sauce.  It was super tasty.  I got a crepe with salmon and dill havarti.  It was pretty good--love me some onions, but it seemed a bit heavy on them, and maybe slightly skimpy on the salmon.  Still really good and worth trying.  Good portions, and definitely a great brunch spot to check out.  Their sandwiches and salads looked yummy too, but decided to go with a little bit more decadence.  It wasn't the absolute best, but I would totally recommend checking it out--I would go again.  It also seems like a good spot to bring your visiting out of towners.  The food is good and the neighborhood is adorable.  You really can't go wrong with that.
author: Courtney H.

description: Better late than never... I am the Kelly W. that Audrey D. is talking about... I've been meaning to write this (well what I really had in mind was a hand written thank you, but we see how well that went) since my birthday their on April 18th because the birthday celebration was absolutely perfect. My husband and I share the same birthday so we decided to have a group of our friend out for a brunch... they don't take ressies so I called about an hour before hand and said we had about 15 people coming (that was an under-estimate) by the time we got there it was about 20... no problem. The staff, as my friend Ray said, parted the seas to seat all of us on the beautiful (and lucky for us sunny) patio in the back. The drinks were huge, the food was served quick and was delicious and well priced. We got ice cream for our dessert with a candle in it. Overall our group had such a wonderful time, it was really the perfect day and I want to thank the hospitable staff at Savor for making it all happen. Cheers.
author: Kelly W.

description:
If you ever drive by Savor, located on the main drag in Noe Valley, on any weekend morning/early afternoon, you might be mystified by the long-ass wait that is going on outside.  I am equally mystified why anybody would wait for what is standard, American brunch fare.  Don't get me wrong -- Savor is a great place to have in the neighborhood.  Their sandwiches (I like the tuna melt) are very satisfying, their homefries crispy, and their crepes pretty decent.  But I don't get the desire to stand in line for breakfast.  Try it at 3pm on a weekday afternoon or a midweek dinner and you'll find it is a nice place for a quick and cheap meal.

Bottom line: nothing amazingly special, but nonetheless a nice place for a good ol' American meal.
author: L G.

description: Me and a co-neighborhood-inhabitor go here for lunch whenever we are "working from home" - it's delicious. Their portions are big, and we usually share a few things. All the vegetarian crepes I have tried were pretty good, and the corn bread with jalapeno jelly is to die for ~
author: Shipra K.

description: I have recently moved here in San Francisco and every Monday a group goes out called "Brunch Bunch" and they chose Savor this day. For what you get with the price, the meals are quite exceptionally large and hefty. When you go, expect to pay at least $10 - $15 for your lunch because it is quite up there in price if you are on a tight budget (like I am) but it is definitely worth it. Among the group of people I was with, most people did not finish their meals because they were quite large in proportion to their body size. I decided to join in and take some of their meals altogether. For my meal, I got the crepe with chocolate which was indeed a nice choice because it was filled with many dessert flavors such as whipped-cream and vanilla ice cream on the side, a perfect meal for a nice summer afternoon. Out of the other eighteen people that went, I happen to try the eggs benedict which had a nice and delightful taste, but I felt that I had to add tabasco sauce to complete the meal. Overall, Savor is a great place if you are on vacation and you want to check out the beauty of Noe Valley with the extravagant shops and culture which is all located in the small little pocket of San Francisco. I do recommend this place to for a nice date or even if friends if you are not on the 21st century term, "recession budget."
author: Jon-o G.

description: Possibly my favorite restaurant in SF.  Perfect for brunch; they have great pancakes and huge mimosas.  The menu is kind of limited, mostly crepes and salads, but there's something for everyone since the crepes are so versatile (Italian, Greek, Japanese).  The salads are great and extremely filling.  If you get a whole one you may need to take some home.  There is a great range of these as well.  The service is usually good and the food is consistently excellent and reasonably priced.  Try the spicy cornbread.
author: carter h.

description: Very good savory crepes! Usually there is about a 1/2 hour wait for a table on weekends.
author: Emmy B.

description:
Have come here for years, as always I enjoyed the food, but the seating confusion started out my visit badly. 
I came with my daughters.  We are all very fair, so I requested an outdoor table, if it was in the shade. Otherwise I expressed that inside would be fine.
The host assured me that all the outside tables were in the shade.
While I was waiting, 3 other parties came in;  one pair, a family with a stroller and a couple with a dog.
The pair and the dog party were addressed went off to the outside.  Another employee asked if I had been assisted.  I told him that I had checked in with the host, but he had gone to seat others who had come after me.This employee immediately took us outside to a table, which unfortunately was in the sun!
There was another empty table in the shade, and I asked if we could sit there.  I was told that the party with the stroller would have to sit there.  He pointed out another table that was being cleared.  I am handicapped, so standing and waiting was a stretch, but we did.

When we walked over to the table, the party with the dog said that that table had been promised to them.  I then told the employee I would like to sit inside, as there were a number of empty tables there.
Graciously, the dog party took the table in the sun (at their suggestion) and we were seated in the shade. Once seated the service was very good and the food consistant as ever! The crab was fresh and the waiter attentive.
SOOO..on my next visit I may have to bring my dog or a stroller!  I hate to join in the Noe Valley 'stereo-type' complainers, but come on...
author: Nancy P.

description:
This is one of my favorite neighborhood places--the food is consistent (love the potatoes that come with most dishes, seasoned well and the perfect ratio of soft potato chunks and crispy-crunchy edgy bits) and the service is always friendly. The portions are enormous and prices are reasonable. I've never left this place feeling gypped.

If this matters to you, the yummy balsamic vinaigrette that comes on their side of greens (and other entree salads) is made with raw egg, which my pregnant self learned when asking about their Caesar dressing (raw egg there, too). Who knew?
author: Shauna W.

description:
Used to be better when it was newer.

My last visit I noticed it was really dirty and could use some sprucing up.  The food is better at their other locations like Crepevine and for less money.  Their dinner specials are pretty good but again why do their windows, window sills, and kitchen have to be so filthy, grimy, and dirty?
author: Franco L.

description:
We had great service.  Seriously great service.  It was a saturday afternoon, we were seated within 5 minutes and the waiter was attentive, positive and non-intrusive.
